access_notes: Link to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/143057/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/143058/downloadThis link is no longer available. 10/26/2020.

title: Global Tuberculosis Report 2020
annotation: This 232-page annual report provides a comprehensive and up-to-date assessment of the tuberculosis (TB) epidemic, and of progress in prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of the disease, at global, regional and country levels. In recognition of the enormous health, social, and economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, the report includes a provisional assessment of how the pandemic will affect the TB epidemic, people with TB, and progress toward global TB targets.
authors: Baddeley, Annabel; Bartens, Marie-Christine; Dean, Anna; Dias, Hannah; Falzon, Dennis
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/336069/9789240013131-eng.pdfLink to executive summary: https://www.who.int/tb/publications/global_report/TB20_Exec_Sum_20201014.pdfLink to technical appendix: https://www.who.int/tb/publications/global_report/TB20_Technical_Appendix_20201014.pdf

title: Disaster Recovery: COVID-19 Pandemic Intensifies Disaster Recovery Challenges for K-12 Schools
annotation: This 14-page report summarizes a study that examined how the COVID-19 pandemic has affected schools recovering from recent natural disasters; the support the U.S. Department of Education has provided to help schools recover from recent natural disasters and how the COVID-19 pandemic has affected schools’ use of these resources; and how recovery efforts from recent natural disasters were affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Nowicki, Jacqueline
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/720/710136.pdf

title: 10 Things Healthcare Professionals Need to Know About U.S. COVID-19 Vaccination Plans
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: With the possibility of one or more COVID-19 vaccines becoming available before the end of the year, this web page lists 10 things healthcare professionals need to know about where those plans currently stand.

title: Guidance for SARS-CoV-2 Point-of-Care Testing
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides guidance on the regulatory requirements for SARS-CoV-2 point-of-care (POC) testing, using POC tests safely, and information on reporting POC test results. POC tests, such as some rapid tests for diagnosing an infectious disease, provide results within minutes of the test being administered, allowing for rapid decisions about patient care. POC tests can also extend testing to communities and populations that cannot readily access care.

title: Sharing and Shifting Tasks to Maintain Essential Healthcare During COVID-19 in Low Resource, Non-US Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: These considerations, updated on October 14, 2020, are intended for countries where access to basic essential health services is constrained due to the COVID-19 pandemic, that have an underlying health workforce shortage, and that are considering implementation of a task shifting or sharing approach to strengthen and expand the health workforce for the delivery of COVID-19 care and other essential health services.

title: Online Presentation and Q&A on the Words into Action Guidelines on Disaster Displacement
source: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
annotation: In this one-hour, seven-minute presentation, experts answer questions on the key issues related to disaster displacement and the tools available to address displacement risk in disaster risk reduction strategies, focusing particularly on the Words into Action Guidelines on Disaster Displacement.
authors: Desai, Bina; Cappellan, Pauline; Kumar, Animesh; Solberg, Atle; Llosa, Silvia

title: Survey on Race and Health
annotation: This survey, a joint project between the Kaiser Family Foundation and ESPN’s The Undefeated, explores the public’s views and experiences on the topics of health care, racial discrimination, and the coronavirus pandemic, with a special focus on Black adults, a group that has borne a disproportionate burden of COVID-19 cases and deaths.
authors: Hamel, Liz; Lopes, Lunna; Munana, Cailey; Artiga, Samantha; Brodie, Mollyann
access_notes: Link to full report on the survey: http://files.kff.org/attachment/TOPLINE-KFF-The-Undefeated-Survey-on-Race-and-Health.pdf

title: Good Participatory Practices for COVID-19 Research and Response
annotation: This one-hour, 26-minute webinar highlights approaches to good participatory practices, tips, and tools for COVID-19 research and response, providing practical examples of how these methods work to engage and empower communities through their involvement.
authors: Mumba, Noni; Davies, Alun; Tam, Way Jia

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Additional Tools and Resources
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides COVID-19 tools and resources intended for use by healthcare workers in non-U.S. healthcare settings.

title: Enforcement Policy for Modifications to FDA-Cleared Molecular Influenza and RSV Tests During the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Public Health Emergency
annotation: This nine-page guidance was issued to provide a policy to help expand access to certain FDA-cleared molecular assays intended for detection and identification of influenza (flu) viruses, including those molecular influenza assays that also detect and identify respiratory syncytial viruses (RSV), during the influenza season and for the duration of the COVID-19 public health emergency.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/142933/download

title: Human Cost of Disasters: An Overview of the Last 20 Years (2000-2019)
source: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
annotation: This 17-page report confirms how extreme weather events have come to dominate the disaster landscape in the 21st century. It focuses primarily on the staggering rise in climate-related disasters over the last 20 years, and is also a commentary on the need to strengthen disaster risk governance for the entire range of natural hazards and man-made hazards, including related environmental, technological, and biological hazards and risks.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.undrr.org/media/48008/download

title: Emergency Global Supply Chain System (COVID 19) Catalogue
annotation: This four-page catalog, updated on October 13, 2020, lists all medical devices, including personal protective equipment, medical equipment, medical consumables, single use devices, and laboratory and test-related devices, that may be requested through the COVID-19 Supply Portal.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/20200822-catalogue-v13.pdf?sfvrsn=7ab2ed1b_3&download=true

title: 2009 Influenza Pandemic
annotation: This 19-page document discusses the extent of the H1N1 pandemic influenza and U.S. international preparations as of June 2009, as well as considerations for the future.
authors: Salaam-Blyther, Tiaji

title: Elastomeric Respirators: Strategies During Conventional and Surge Demand Situations
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on October 13, 2020, offers guidance for the use of reusable elastomeric particulate respirators to provide respiratory protection to healthcare practitioners (HCP) against pathogens as a component of a formally developed and implemented written respiratory protection program. It is based on what is currently known about the transmission and severity of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

title: Convalescent Plasma or Hyperimmune Immunoglobulin for People with COVID‐19: A Living Systematic Review
annotation: The goal of this 425-page study was to continually assess, as more evidence becomes available, whether convalescent plasma or hyperimmune immunoglobulin transfusion is effective and safe in treatment of people with COVID‐19.
authors: Chai, Khai Li; Valk, Sarah; Piechotta, Vanessa; Kimber, Catherine; Mousef, Ina
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013600.pub3/epdf/fullLink to resource in Arabic: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013600.pub3/full/fa#CD013600-abs-0003Link to resource in French: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013600.pub3/full/fr#CD013600-abs-0007Link to resource in Portuguese: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013600.pub3/full/pt#CD013600-abs-0005Link to resource in Spanish: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013600.pub3/full/es#CD013600-abs-0009

title: Clinical Guidance: Family Presence Policies for Pediatric Inpatient Settings During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page, updated on October 12, 2020, provides answers to frequently asked questions during the COVID-19 pandemic about family presence policies, which are are critical components of family-centered care for all children and are particularly important for children with special health care needs, including those with disabilities, medical complexity, and serious illness.

title: Handbook for Public Health Capacity-Building at Ground Crossings and Cross-Border Collaboration
annotation: This 68-page handbook, updated on October 12, 2020, follows a comprehensive approach to health system strengthening at borders in order to support International Health Regulations (IHR) national focal points and other national agencies in developing and implementing evidence-based action plans for IHR capacity development at ground crossings. The approach includes the movement of travelers and baggage, cargo, containers, conveyances, goods, and postal parcels across ground crossings, as well as the interaction with adjacent border communities.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1272765/retrieveLink to document in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/331534/9789240009172-rus.pdf

title: Countering Stigmatization in the Humanitarian Response to COVID-19
annotation: This 16-page report highlights key findings and recommendations outlined in a webinar and roundtable event hosted by the InterAction Protection Working Group in July 2020 to discuss how stigma is impacting humanitarian responses during the COVID-19 pandemic, best practices, key challenges, and ways forward.
access_notes: Link to additional information: https://www.interaction.org/blog/countering-stigmatization-in-the-humanitarian-response-to-covid-19-2/

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: AdviseDx SARS-CoV-2 IgM
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the AdviseDx SARS-CoV-2 IgM assay. The AdviseDx SARS-CoV-2 IgM assay is authorized for the qualitative detection of IgM antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum, serum separator tube, and plasma (dipotassium EDTA, tripotassium EDTA, lithium heparin, lithium heparin separator tube, sodium heparin).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142939/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142937/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: Architect: https://www.fda.gov/media/142940/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: Alinity i: https://www.fda.gov/media/142941/download

title: Strategies for Optimizing the Supply of Isolation Gowns
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page offers a series of strategies or options to optimize supplies of isolation gowns in healthcare settings when there is limited supply. It includes considerations for returning to conventional capacity practices.

title: Contact Tracing by Community Health Workers in Low-Resource, Non-U.S. Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides information on how community health workers can support contact tracing efforts related to COVID-19 in low resource and resource-limited non-U.S. settings. The considerations provided can be adapted to follow national or local guidelines and account for local context.

title: Strategic Considerations in Preparing for Deployment of COVID-19 Vaccine and Vaccination in the WHO European Region
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for Europe
annotation: This 11-page document outlines the key strategic considerations for ministries of health, their agencies, national immunization technical advisory groups/committees, and relevant public and private sector authorities in the WHO European Region in preparing for deployment of COVID-19 vaccine and vaccination in their countries. The objective is to allow Member States to identify and address any critical gaps for effective deployment of COVID-19 vaccines.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/335940/WHO-EURO2020-1148-40894-55356-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=yLink to resource in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/335941

title: National Action Plan for Combating Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria, 2020-2025
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This 47-page document presents coordinated, strategic actions to change the course of antimicrobial resistance in the next five years. The new plan includes CDC activities to combat antibiotic-resistant infections in healthcare, food and farms, animals, communities, and the environment, both at home and abroad.
access_notes: Link to additional information: https://aspe.hhs.gov/pdf-report/carb-plan-2020-2025Direct link to document: https://aspe.hhs.gov/system/files/pdf/264126/CARB-National-Action-Plan-2020-2025.pdf

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Toolkit for Correctional and Detention Facilities
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on October 9, 2020, provides COVID-19 guidance and tools to help administrators of correctional and detention facilities make decisions and protect and communicate with staff, people who are incarcerated, and their communities.

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Correctional and Detention Facilities
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on October 9, 2020, provides guidance for correctional and detention facilities to plan, prepare, and respond to the COVID-19 pandemic. It also provides communication resources and posters.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/correction-detention/index.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/correction-detention/index.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/correction-detention/index.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/correction-detention/index.html

title: Wildfire Smoke and COVID-19: Frequently Asked Questions and Resources for Air Resource Advisors and Other Environmental Health Professionals
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on October 9, 2020, provides Air Resource Advisors and other environmental health professionals with key messages about wildfire smoke and COVID-19. It also provides resources that can be given to communities affected by wildfire smoke during community spread of SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to page in Spanish: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/php/smoke-faq-sp.html

title: CDC’s Diagnostic Test for COVID-19 Only and Supplies
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on October 9, 2020, describes how to order the CDC 2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time Reverse Transcriptase (RT)-PCR Diagnostic Panel and supplies. In addition to this test, CDC has developed a diagnostic test that can be used to detect SARS-CoV-2, influenza A, and influenza B viruses at the same time. This test is called the CDC Influenza SARS-CoV-2 (Flu SC2) Multiplex Assay.

title: Clinical Care Guidance for Healthcare Professionals about Coronavirus (COVID-19)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on October 9, 2020, provides clinical care guidance for healthcare professionals about COVID-19, including for home care, ending home isolation, and by patient type.

title: Addressing the COVID-19 Crisis: An Open Forum Webinar Series for Pharmacists
annotation: This one-hour open forum provides the latest information on COVID-19 followed by a group discussion on what’s working, what’s challenging, and what resources are available to assist pharmacists as frontline responders and essential healthcare providers.
authors: Hogue, Michael; Patel, Anita; Hannan, Claire; Bernstein, Ilisa; Rothholz, Mitchel
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://www.pharmacist.com/sites/default/files/audience/Week27PresentationCOVID19WebinarSeries.pdf

title: Systematic Racism, Health Disparities, and COVID-19: Leading through Complex Trauma
source: Association of State and Territorial Health Officials
annotation: Speakers in this one-hour, three-minute webinar discuss systemic racism, health disparities, COVID-19, and the unprecedented social and economic stress impacting individuals, families, and communities across cultures, generations, genders, and racial groups. They cite tools for supporting individuals as they develop healing and resiliency around complex trauma.
authors: Henderson-Smith, Linda; Guroff, Elizabeth; Roeschlein, Amelia

title: ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) National Network Learning Session: American Red Cross Disaster Response During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: ADA [Americans with Disabilities Act] National Network
annotation: This one-hour, seven-minute webinar covers several aspects of disaster response from the perspective of the American Red Cross during the COVID-19 pandemic, including preparation and guidance development for disaster response, the strategy for non-congregate sheltering, and the challenges of this strategy. Worker safety and workforce care protocols are also shared.
authors: Casey-Lockyer, Mary
access_notes: Link to recording: https://us02web.zoom.us/rec/share/IoW3bTywqBQbViWCWckRdHkuetAgN8Vo2vVyKPS7Uplz9j_O-vXH1gEu7rfAAT9R.XTEHDsJffU989Xc8Link to presentation slides: http://adapresentations.org/doc/10_08_20/American%20Red%20Cross%20Disaster%20Response%20During%20the%20COVID-19%20Pandemic.pdfLink to transcript: http://adapresentations.org/doc/10_08_20/Transcript%2010-08-20.pdf

title: Review Process For Vaccines to Prevent COVID-19: A Discussion
source: Center for Infectious Disease Research and Policy [University of Minnesota]
annotation: This one-hour, two-minute video features a discussion with the current Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Commissioner and a former FDA Commissioner regarding the review process for vaccines to prevent COVID-19.
authors: Osterholm, Michael; Hahn, Stephen; Hamburg, Margaret A.

title: Letter of Authorization: SDNA-1000 Saliva Collection Device
annotation: This six-page document provides the Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for the SDNA-1000 Saliva Collection Device (SDNA-1000), which is intended for use by individuals to collect, stabilize, and maintain during transport, unprocessed saliva specimens suspected of containing SARS-CoV-2 ribonucleic acid (RNA).
access_notes: Link to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142907/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Maverick SARS-CoV-2 Multi-Antigen Serology Panel v2
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Maverick SARS-CoV-2 Multi-Antigen Serology Panel v2. The Maverick SARS-CoV-2 Multi-Antigen Serology Panel v2 is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human dipotassium EDTA venous whole blood, dipotassium EDTA plasma, and serum.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142914/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142912/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142915/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: ACCESS SARS‐CoV‐2 IgM
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Access SARS‐CoV‐2 IgM. The Access SARS‐CoV‐2 IgM is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142910/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142908/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142911/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: CareStart™ COVID-19 Antigen
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the CareStart™ COVID-19 Antigen test. The CareStart™ COVID-19 Antigen test is authorized for use using nasopharyngeal swab specimens collected from individuals who are suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider within the first five days of the onset of symptoms.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142918/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142916/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142919/download

title: Recommendations for Influenza Prevention and Treatment in Children: An Update for Pediatric Providers
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Center for Preparedness and Response
annotation: During this one-hour, nine-minute Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) call, subject matter experts from the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and CDC discuss strategies primary care providers and medical subspecialists can use to improve flu prevention and control in children this season. They discuss the importance of vaccinating, testing, and treating influenza during the COVID-19 pandemic, and review recommendations about influenza antiviral use in children.
authors: Dawood, Fatimah; Kimball, Anne; Munoz, Flor
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2020/FINAL_Peds_COVID_Flu_COCA_Final-Combined.pdf

title: CDC’s Interim Guidance for General Population Disaster Shelters During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This interim guidance for general population disaster shelters, updated on October 8, 2020, is based on current information about the transmission and severity of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Because conditions vary from community to community, disaster shelter managers should look to their state and local health officials for information specific to their location.

title: Interim Guidelines for Collecting, Handling, and Testing Clinical Specimens for COVID-19
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: These COVID-19 guidelines for laboratories, updated on October 8, 2020, add clarification on language for the collection of specimens, and include the addition of saliva language.

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Clinical Decision Algorithm to Guide Care Advice Messages
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides healthcare workers with a clinical decision algorithm to guide care advice messages regarding COVID-19.

title: Interim Guidance on the Use of Rapid Antigen Detection Tests for the Identification of SARS-CoV-2 Infection
annotation: This web page provides interim guidance on the use of rapid antigen detection tests (RADT) for SARS-CoV-2 in the context of the public health system. These guidelines were developed in collaboration with provincial and territorial public health authorities and will be updated periodically as the science evolves.

title: Ethics Grand Rounds: Vaccine Trials for COVID-19
annotation: Speakers in this 58-minute presentation discuss vaccines for COVID-19, current clinical trials, and the ethical issues that they raise. An issue is if one vaccine is proven effective, should all other clinical trials be stopped?
authors: Erbelding, Emily; Millum, Joseph; Goodman, Steve

title: Human Antibody Responses to SARS-CoViD-2
annotation: The speaker in this one-hour, four-minute presentation, the 5th Annual William E. Paul Lecture, discusses the development of antibody responses, focusing on neutralizing antibody responses to SARS-CoViD-2. At the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, a group of 148 individuals who had recovered from SARS-CoV-2 infection were recruited to Rockefeller University to give blood for analysis. This lecture summarizes features of the humoral immune response in these individuals and their neutralizing properties in vitro and in animal models.
authors: Nussenzweig, Michel

title: Strengthening Disability Inclusion in Humanitarian Action
annotation: This one-hour, 33-minute presentation discusses disability-inclusive practices and approaches being used in humanitarian action, and what more needs to be done to ensure the rhetoric around disability-inclusive humanitarian preparedness and response is being translated into action.
authors: Fenton, Wendy; Uja, Sulayman AbdulMumuni; Abdalla, Alradi; Al Sheikh Ahmed, Sherin; Bula, Simione

title: Preparing the Whole Community: Including Individuals Experiencing Homelessness in Disaster Planning
source: Natural Hazards Center [University of Colorado at Boulder]
annotation: This report details how collaboration between emergency management officials and homeless service providers can ensure that individuals experiencing homelessness are included in planning for disasters, sheltering, response, and recovery.
authors: Gin, June

title: Virtual Launch of the Capitol Hill Steering Committee on Pandemic Preparedness and Health Security
source: Center for Health Security [Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health]
annotation: This one-hour launch of the Capitol Hill Steering Committee on Pandemic Preparedness and Health Security features a discussion about how the committee will provide an educational forum to discuss new topics, technologies, and ideas that could improve domestic health security now and in the future.
authors: Inglesby, Thomas V.; Baldwin, Tammy; Burr, Richard; Casey, Bob; Hyde-Smith, Cindy

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: ePlex® Respiratory Pathogen Panel 2
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the ePlex® Respiratory Pathogen Panel 2. The ePlex® Respiratory Pathogen Panel 2 is authorized for use with nasopharyngeal swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of respiratory viral infection consistent with COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142904/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142902/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142905/download

title: Diagnostics Allocations Frequently Asked Questions
annotation: This three-page fact sheet provides answers to frequently asked questions about COVID-19 diagnostic supply allocations, including how the allocation principles are developed.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/dx-allocation-faqs-for-website-v3.pdf?sfvrsn=467fcb6a_2&download=true

title: Recommendations on Providing Clear Instructions to Patients Who Self-Collect an Anterior Nares (Nasal) Sample in a Health Care Setting for SARS-CoV-2 Testing
annotation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) provides these recommendations that health care providers give clear, step-by-step instructions to patients who, in a health care setting, are self-collecting anterior nares (nasal) samples for SARS-CoV-2 testing. Without proper instructions, patients may not collect an adequate sample for testing, which may decrease the sensitivity of the test.

title: Lower Flu Vaccination Rates Among Black, Hispanic, and Low-Income Seniors Suggest Challenges for COVID-19 Vaccination Efforts
annotation: This analysis explores variation in the rate of flu vaccination among adults ages 65 and older covered by Medicare, and reasons cited for not getting vaccinated, based on data from the 2018 Medicare Current Beneficiary Survey. Findings include that flu vaccination rates are lower among older Black and Hispanic adults than older white adults.
authors: Cubanski, Juliette; Neuman, Tricia; Damico, Anthony

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: UCLA SwabSeq COVID-19 Diagnostic Platform
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the UCLA SwabSeq COVID-19 Diagnostic Platform. The UCLA SwabSeq COVID19 Diagnostic Platform is authorized for use with upper respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142804/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142802/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142805/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: ZEUS ELISA SARS-CoV-2 IgG Test System
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the ZEUS ELISA SARS-CoV-2 IgG Test System. The ZEUS ELISA SARS-CoV-2 IgG Test System is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma (dipotassium EDTA, lithium heparin and sodium citrate).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142808/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142806/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142809/download

title: Infection Prevention and Control and Preparedness for COVID-19 in Healthcare Settings: Fifth Update
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 20-page document aims to provide guidance to healthcare facilities and healthcare providers in the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK) on preparedness and infection prevention and control (IPC) measures for the management of possible and confirmed cases of COVID-19 in healthcare settings, including long-term care facilities (LTCFs). It also addresses the management of clinical diagnostic specimens at laboratories in the EU/EEA.

title: Interim Final Rule (IFC), CMS-3401-IFC; Requirements and Enforcement Process for Reporting of COVID-19 Data Elements for Hospitals and Critical Access Hospitals
annotation: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) has released new regulatory requirements in this 12-page memorandum for all hospitals and critical access hospitals to report COVID-19 data elements in accordance with a frequency and in a standardized format as specified by the Secretary during the public health emergency for COVID-19.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cms.gov/files/document/qso-21-03-hospitalscahs.pdf-0

title: Emergency Use Authorization for Vaccines to Prevent COVID-19
annotation: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued this 18-page guidance to provide sponsors of requests for Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for COVID-19 vaccines with recommendations regarding the data and information needed to support the issuance of an EUA for an investigational vaccine to prevent COVID-19 for the duration of the COVID-19 public health emergency.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/142749/download

title: Frequently Asked Questions: Interfacility Transport of the Critically Ill Neonatal or Pediatric Patient with Suspected or Confirmed COVID-19
annotation: This web page, updated on October 6, 2020, provides answers to frequently asked questions about interfacility transport of pediatric patients and the importance of providing the best medical care while reducing the risk to transport team members and minimizing the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) where possible during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: COVID-19 Guidance for Hospital Reporting and FAQs for Hospitals, Hospital Laboratory, and Acute Care Facility Data Reporting
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: This 15-page document, updated on October 6, 2020, details the federal government’s COVID-19 data needs, explains the division of reporting responsibility between hospitals and states, and provides clear, flexible options for the timely delivery of daily data reports on COVID-19 testing, capacity, and utilization. The objective is to allow states and hospitals either to leverage existing data reporting capabilities or, where those capabilities are insufficient, to provide guidance in how to build upon existing capabilities.
access_notes: Link to Disaster Lit record for Centers for Medicare & Medicare Services Interim Guidance (October 6, 2020): https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:23981.

title: Issue Brief: Reports of Increases in Opioid-Related Overdose and Other Concerns During COVID Pandemic
annotation: This 17-page report, updated on October 6, 2020, lists the steps states must take to save lives, reduce harm, and get people the treatment they need as the opioid epidemic continues during the COVID-19 pandemic. It also notes the concerns stemming from a growing number of national, state, and local media reports suggesting swells in opioid-related mortality—particularly from illicitly manufactured fentanyl and fentanyl analogs.

title: Guidance on Newborn Screening During COVID-19
annotation: The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) strongly supports the continued provision of health care for children during the COVID-19 pandemic unless community circumstances related to the pandemic require necessary adjustments. This page, updated on October 6, 2020, provides guidance on several types of screening during the pandemic.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: AQ-TOP COVID-19 Rapid Detection Kit PLUS
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the AQ-TOP COVID-19 Rapid Detection Kit PLUS. The AQ-TOP COVID-19 Rapid Detection Kit PLUS is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142799/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142797/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142800/download

title: Scientific Brief: SARS-CoV-2 and Potential Airborne Transmission
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The principal mode by which people are infected with SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19) is through exposure to respiratory droplets carrying infectious virus. This web page details potential airborne transmission of respiratory viruses, and how SARs-CoV-2 is spread.

title: Impact of COVID-19 on Mental, Neurological and Substance Use Services
annotation: This 48-page report of a survey completed by 130 countries during the period June-August 2020 provides information about the extent of disruption to mental, neurological, and substance use services due to COVID-19; the types of services that have been disrupted; and how countries are adapting to overcome these challenges.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1310579/retrieve

title: Potential FEMA Emergency Sheltering Options During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: The ongoing COVID-19 pandemic may complicate efforts to provide sheltering in typical congregate settings. This three-page report, updated on October 5, 2020, discusses potential emergency sheltering models previously used by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and challenges posed by COVID-19, as well as policy considerations.
authors: Webster, Elizabeth; Lee, Erica

title: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Innovation Catalog: Second Edition
source: Enhancing Learning and Research for Humanitarian Assistance
annotation: This 60-page document is an updated collection of some of the most promising solutions in water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH). It offers easier navigation, updated evidence on a range of innovations, plus a number of newly added innovation projects.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.elrha.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/HIF-WASH-innovation-catalogue-second-edition-2020-WEB_spreads.pdf

title: September 9-10, 2020, Virtual Public Meeting: Antimicrobial Resistance and COVID-19
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Health [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This two-day virtual meeting focused on the impact of COVID-19 and its effect on antimicrobial resistance (AMR). Topics included presentations on the COVID-19 mortality rate due to secondary acquired infections, antibiotic stewardship practices during a pandemic, disruptions in the agricultural industry due to COVID-19, and the intersection of AMR and emergency preparedness.
authors: Srinivasan, Arjun; Heil, Emily; Yu, Kalvin; O'Leary, Sean; Clancy, Cornelius
access_notes: This web page provides links to the meeting agenda, recordings, documents, and presentations.

title: Infection Prevention and Control Recommendations for Medical Evacuation by Aircraft of Patients with Suspected or Confirmed COVID-19 from Remote and Isolated Communities in Canada’s North
annotation: The purpose of this web page is to provide infection prevention and control guidance for the medical evacuation of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 by air, based on current PHAC COVID-19 guidance and the PHAC Routine Practices and Additional Precautions guidance.

title: Child Protection Minimum Standards Implementation Toolkit
source: Alliance for Child Protection in Humanitarian Action
annotation: This web page provides links to the documents in this toolkit, which contains essential information on how to promote and implement the Child Protection Minimum Standards in diverse humanitarian settings from refugee contexts to infectious disease outbreaks and beyond.

title: Gulf Coast Disaster Recovery
annotation: This 49-page document describes how Louisiana and Mississippi allocated their shares of Community Development Block Grant funds, the administration challenges associated with the housing recovery programs, and the human capital challenges the States encountered.

title: Temporary Enforcement Guidance: Tight-Fitting Powered Air Purifying Respirators (PAPRs) Used During the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Pandemic
source: Occupational Safety and Health Administration [U.S. Department of Labor]
annotation: This web page details temporary guidance for enforcing initial and annual fit-testing requirements related to tight-fitting powered air-purifying respirators. The new enforcement discretion policy permits the use of National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH)-approved tight-fitting powered air-purifying respirators for protection against the coronavirus when initial and/or annual fit testing is infeasible due to respirator and fit-testing supply shortages. The guidance applies to healthcare personnel and other workers in high or very high exposure risk activities.

title: Got Masks? PPE Compliance and Fatigue in First Responder Realms
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: This 56-minute webinar discusses the importance of personal protective equipment (PPE) in the First Responder Environment, techniques to deal with PPE fatigue, and how to improve compliance. The presenters answer questions from participants, including about PPE requirements in the office, ambulance, and firehouse.
authors: Grindle, Amanda; Kumar, Lekshmi; Carr, Michael; Tysor, Ben; Miles, Wade
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/b9423bf471c704e2f8d2afdbfc9ab758.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: BioFire Respiratory Panel 2.1-EZ (RP2.1-EZ)
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the BioFire Respiratory Panel 2.1-EZ (RP2.1-EZ). The BioFire RP2.1-EZ is authorized for use with nasopharyngeal swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142695/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142693/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142696/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: OmniPATH COVID-19 Total Antibody ELISA Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the OmniPATH COVID-19 Total Antibody ELISA Test. The OmniPATH COVID-19 Total Antibody ELISA Test is authorized for the detection of total antibodies (including IgM/IgG/IgA) to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142699/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142697/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142700/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Sofia 2 Flu + SARS Antigen FIA
annotation: This four-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Sofia 2 Flu + SARS Antigen FIA. The Sofia 2 Flu + SARS Antigen FIA is authorized for use with certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of respiratory viral infection consistent with COVID-19 by their healthcare provider within the first five days of the onset of symptoms.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142703/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142701/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142704/download

title: Hybrid Hearing with Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex M. Azar II
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Oversight and Reform
annotation: This two-hour, 53-minute Congressional hearing of the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis features Secretary Alex Azar, who responds to questions about the Department of Health and Human Services’ response to the coronavirus pandemic.
authors: Clyburn, James; Azar, Alex

title: Framework for Equitable Allocation of COVID-19 Vaccine
annotation: This 216-page report, finalized on October 2, 2020, offers an overarching framework for COVID-19 vaccine allocation to assist policymakers in the domestic and global health communities. Built on widely accepted foundational principles and recognizing the distinctive characteristics of COVID-19, this report's recommendations address the commitments needed to implement equitable allocation policies for COVID-19 vaccine.
access_notes: Link to Discussion Draft: https://www.nap.edu/resource/25917/25914.pdfLink to report webinar: https://www.nationalacademies.org/event/10-02-2020/final-report-public-release-webinar-framework-for-equitable-allocation-of-covid-19-vaccine

title: “Whoever Finds the Vaccine Must Share It:” Strengthening Human Rights and Transparency Around Covid-19 Vaccines
annotation: This 83-page document summarizes research examining the rights implications surrounding COVID-19 vaccine availability and affordability. It drew on more than six months of reporting on the pandemic’s impacts on different populations, including health workers.
authors: Kashyap, Aruna; Wurth, Margaret

title: COVID-19: What Physicians Need to Know Webinar Series
annotation: Each installment of this webinar series aims to gain fact-based insights from the nation’s highest-ranking subject matter experts working to protect the health of the public, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Guide to Investigating Outbreak Origins: Nature Versus the Laboratory
source: James Martin Center for Nonproliferation Studies, Monterey Institute of International Studies
annotation: COVID-19 has exposed key gaps in the global community’s ability to assess infectious disease outbreaks of international concern, in particular the ability to differentiate between natural and laboratory sources of infection. The purpose of this 34-page paper is to outline a readily adoptable, stepwise methodology to guide the investigation of corresponding outbreak origins, building upon traditional epidemiological principles.
authors: Pitch, Richard; Pomper, Miles; Luster, Jill; Lentzos, Filippa
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://nonproliferation.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Investigating-Outbreaks.pdf

title: Vaccine Allocation Planner for COVID-19
annotation: This vaccine allocation planner will help state and county decision-makers by estimating the size of their highest priority populations in every county of the U.S., the number of vaccine doses that may be available to each state, and the percent vaccine coverage achievable under various scenarios. It was jointly developed by Ariadne Labs, a joint center for health systems innovation at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, and the Surgo Foundation.

title: Healthcare Operations During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response (ASPR) Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange (TRACIE) presents a speaker series focused on how the COVID-19 pandemic brought healthcare and public health, emergency medical services, and emergency and management together to adjust healthcare operations. Links to each presentation are on this one-page fact sheet.

title: Enforcement Policy for Non-Invasive Remote Monitoring Devices Used to Support Patient Monitoring During the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Public Health Emergency (Revised)
annotation: The FDA is issuing this 12-page guidance to provide a policy to help expand the availability and capability of non-invasive remote monitoring devices to facilitate patient monitoring while reducing patient and healthcare provider contact and exposure to COVID-19 for the duration of the COVID-19 public health emergency.

title: Framework for Equitable Allocation of COVID-19 Vaccine
annotation: This 216-page report offers an overarching framework for vaccine allocation to assist policy makers in the domestic and global health communities. Built on widely accepted foundational principles and recognizing the distinctive characteristics of COVID-19, this report's recommendations address the commitments needed to implement equitable allocation policies for COVID-19 vaccine.

title: Indian Health Service COVID-19 Pandemic Vaccine Draft Plan
source: Indian Health Service (IHS) [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This 24-page plan details how the Indian Health Service (IHS) health care system will prepare for and operationalize a COVID-19 vaccine when it becomes available. This draft plan includes an overview of the IHS Vaccine Task Force and is divided into seven sections.  Each section includes key IHS activities, assumptions, and specific actions for the Vaccine Task Force, Areas, and the IHS National Supply Service Center.

title: Assessment of Risks of SARS-CoV-2 Transmission During Air Travel and Non-Pharmaceutical Interventions to Reduce Risk
source: Harvard University, Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
annotation: This 187-page document summarizes the emerging scientific literature on the effectiveness of selected non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPI) used to control transmission of the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 on board aircraft. Based on modeling of aircraft ventilation systems and current evidence about this novel coronavirus, the report presents recommendations regarding risk mitigation for airlines, airline passengers, and crew members.
access_notes: Link to Phase One Report Highlights: https://cdn1.sph.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/2443/2020/10/Phase-One-Report-Highlights-1.pdf

title: COVID-19 and the Experiences of Populations at Greater Risk  Description and Top-Line Summary Data — Wave 1, Summer 2020
annotation: This 63-page report presents the results of the first of four waves of COVID-19 and the Experiences of Populations at Greater Risk Survey, fielded during summer 2020, with particular focus on populations deemed at risk or underserved, including people of color and those from low- to moderate-income backgrounds.
authors: Carman, Katherine Grace; Chandra, Anita; Bugliari, Delia; Nelson, Christopher; Miller, Carolyn
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/research_reports/RRA700/RRA764-1/RAND_RRA764-1.pdf

title: COVID-19 and the Cost of Vaccine Nationalism
annotation: This 75-page report examines how the management of the COVID-19 crisis may be affected by vaccine nationalism and what the associated economic cost would be of inequitable access to vaccines across countries.
authors: Hafner, Marco; Yerushalmi, Erez; Fays, Clement; Dufresne, Eliane; Van Stolk, Christian
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/research_reports/RRA700/RRA769-1/RAND_RRA769-1.pdf

title: 2020 American Heart Association Guidelines for CPR and ECC (Emergency Cardiovascular Care)
annotation: This web page provides several documents related to the 2020 American Heart Association Guidelines for CPR and ECC. The highlights document is available for download in 17 languages.

title: Economics of Vaccine Development and Supply: Responding to COVID-19 and Preparing for the Next Threat
source: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality  [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This seven-page brief summarizes key points from a meeting convened by Academy Health in August 2020. Research and policy experts reviewed existing research on vaccine development, manufacturing, and distribution, including financing mechanisms to help ensure access to vaccines in developing countries.
authors: Cassil, Alwyn

title: COVID-19 Homeless System Response: Alternative Approaches to Winter Sheltering During COVID-19
source: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
annotation: Due to the current community spread of COVID-19, local facilities that are normally available to prevent death from exposure for people experiencing homelessness are now more limited. This three-page document provides a framework for a graduated approach to sheltering from life-threatening temperatures and regular seasonal weather.

title: COVID-19 Homeless System Response: COVID-19 Preparedness Checklist for Shelter Facilities
source: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
annotation: This three-page document provides a series of preparedness checklists designed to help homeless shelter providers implement strategies for mitigating the spread of COVID-19 in winter facilities.

title: GLASS Guide for National Surveillance Systems for Monitoring Antimicrobial Consumption in Hospitals
annotation: This 88-page document proposes an approach for monitoring antimicrobial consumption in hospitals, based largely on the WHO methodology used for monitoring  antimicrobial  consumption on a national level. It is part of the Global Antimicrobial Resistance and Use Surveillance System (GLASS).
authors: Schweickert, Birgitta; Muller, Arno; Ivanovska, Verica
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/336182/9789240000421-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: GLASS Manual on the Management of Antimicrobial Consumption Data
annotation: This 80-page manual summarizes the WHO methodology for a global program on surveillance of antimicrobial consumption (AMC), a component of the Global Antimicrobial Resistance and Use Surveillance System (GLASS). It is intended to guide countries on how to use the GLASS-AMC Microsoft Excel template to prepare the national AMC surveillance data according to the WHO methodology; and produce national AMC data files to foster AMC data analysis at national level.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/336216/9789240010192-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: GLASS Methodology for Surveillance of National Antimicrobial Consumption
annotation: This 68-page document details the methodology for monitoring the use of antimicrobials, both in terms of strengthening the surveillance and optimizing the use of antimicrobials. It is part of the Global Antimicrobial Resistance and Use Surveillance System (GLASS), and discusses data collection and management.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/336215/9789240012639-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: Airborne Transmission of SARS-CoV-2: Proceedings of a Workshop - In Brief
annotation: This 18-page document summarizes an Environmental Health Matters Initiative (EHMI) workshop, held on August 26-27, 2020, that delved into the rapidly evolving science on the spread of the SAR-CoV-2 virus, as part of a larger body of COVID-19 related work at the National Academies. It featured experts in aerosol science and atmospheric chemistry, building engineering, epidemiology, environmental health, infectious disease, pulmonary medicine, public health, and virology to explore the evidence on airborne transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
access_notes: Link to Disaster Lit record for related video: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:23613

title: Dispersion Modeling Systems Relevant to Homeland Security Preparedness and Response
annotation: The purpose of this 119-page report is to provide a comprehensive database of dispersion models that are currently available while also briefly explaining the fundamental concepts of atmospheric transport and dispersion. It can act as a comprehensive guide to relay risk, sampling, and model choices to decision-makers. The dispersion model background information and model summaries are intended to provide a quick reference for those new to air dispersion modeling or for those seeking to expand their knowledge base.
authors: Pirhalla, Michael
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://cfpub.epa.gov/si/si_public_file_download.cfm?p_download_id=541378&Lab=CESER

title: In Vivo Exposures for Prolonged Exposure Therapy During a Pandemic
source: National Center for PTSD [Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder] [U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs]
annotation: This web page describes Prolonged Exposure (PE), an evidence-based treatment for PTSD, and how conducting PE during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may require creativity to identify in vivo exposures that are meaningful and effective for patients while also compliant with shelter-in-place, physical distancing, and other safety recommendations.
authors: Cuccurullo, Lisa; Joyce, Jennifer

title: Impact of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Parental Stress and Young Children’s Development During Physical Distancing
source: Natural Hazards Center [University of Colorado at Boulder]
annotation: This study investigated the potential parental stress risk factors of the parents of young children during the COVID-19 pandemic, with consideration of socioeconomic and ethnic backgrounds.
authors: Zhang, Chenyi; Qiu, Wei

title: Decarcerating Correctional Facilities During COVID-19: Advancing Health, Equity, and Safety
annotation: This 124-page document offers guidance on efforts to decarcerate, or reduce the incarcerated population, as a response to COIVD-19 pandemic. It examines best practices for implementing decarceration as a response to the pandemic and the conditions that support safe and successful reentry of those decarcerated.
access_notes: Link to related video: https://www.nationalacademies.org/event/10-20-2020/decarcerating-correctional-facilities-during-covid-19-advancing-health-equity-and-safety-report-release-webinar

title: Health System Considerations: When Influenza Meets COVID-19
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for Europe
annotation: This 30-page document provides preparedness and response measures to take when COVID-19, influenza, and acute respiratory infections coincide in the WHO European Region. It is divided into seven sections: Prevention and health system preparedness; Risk communication and community engagement; Immunization; Surveillance; Clinical management of clusters and cases; Needs of special settings and groups; and Public health and social measures, including infection prevention and control.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/336165/WHO-EURO-2020-1248-40998-55644-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: Preserving the Scientific Integrity of Getting to COVID-19 Vaccines
annotation: This six-part virtual vaccine symposium, held on October 6, 2020 and co-sponsored with the University of Washington, brings together leading voices in the field to explore complex issues regarding COVID-19 vaccines, from development to allocation. Topics include the Science and Structure of the U.S. Government’s COVID-19 Vaccine Trial Program, and Protecting Scientific Integrity in the Design and Conduct of COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy Trials.
authors: Cauce, Ana Mari; Daniels, Ronald; Fauci, Anthony S.; Slaoui, Moncef; Jerome, Keith

title: Gulf Research Program Annual Report 2019
annotation: This 22-page document is the sixth annual report of the Gulf Research Program (GRP) to summarize how funds were used. These annual reports review accomplishments, highlight activities, and, over time, will assess metrics to determine how the program is progressing in accomplishing its goals. The program seeks to enhance oil system safety and the protection of human health and the environment in the Gulf of Mexico region and other areas along the U.S. outer continental shelf with offshore oil and gas operations.

title: COVID-19 Digital Classroom: Course Series
annotation: This course series is part of the COVID-19 Digital Classroom initiative. These courses are primarily designed for community-based health workers who practice in low- and middle-income countries. They cover a range of topics on COVID-19, including basic information on the virus and how to mitigate its public health effects.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.Link to course series in Arabic: https://communityhealthacademy.course.tc/catalog/track/covid-19-digital-classroom-course-series-arabic

title: Flu Prevention During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This three-page document provides guidance about preventing flu during the COVID-19 pandemic, including recommendations for child care programs.
access_notes: Link to document in Spanish: https://www.childcareaware.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/FluSeason-IssueBrief-Spanish-10092020.pdf

title: Capitol Hill Steering Committee on Pandemic Preparedness and Health Security
source: Center for Health Security [Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health]
annotation: This web page provides information about the Capitol Hill Steering Committee on Pandemic Preparedness and Health Security, an educational forum to discuss new topics, technologies, and ideas that can improve domestic health security now and in the future. The page provides links to monthly events focused on lessons learned from responses to natural, man-made, and other complex health emergencies, such as the COVID-19 pandemic, and how to better mitigate and respond to future health crises.

title: HHS/ASPR: Addressing the Needs of Older Adults in Disasters
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This course provides information, resources, tools, and strategies to help users assess and address the needs of older adults in common disaster situations, including natural disasters and infectious disease outbreaks. It is designed to improve public health and emergency medical responders’ capability to address the access and functional needs of community-dwelling older adults in disasters.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: COVID-19 Transmission in U.S. Child Care Programs
annotation: This 25-page report provides information about a survey conducted by Yale University of more than 55,000 child care providers from May and June 2020 in the United States that helps provide some answers to the safety of child care workers during the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Gilliam, Walter; Malik, Amyn; Shafiq, Mehr; Klotz, Madeline; Reyes, Chin
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://pediatrics.aappublications.org/content/pediatrics/early/2020/10/12/peds.2020-031971.full.pdfLink to executive summary: https://www.childcareaware.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/yale-exec-summary-final.pdf

title: Ethics and Vector-Borne Diseases: WHO Guidance
annotation: This 74-page document details several aspects of vector-borne diseases, including malaria, dengue, and Zika, that raise significant ethical issues. The primary audience for this guidance is persons working directly in vector-borne disease prevention and control, including program managers, researchers, and field workers. The goal is to help readers recognize aspects of their work that raise significant ethical challenges and to respond to these challenges in accordance with internationally accepted values and norms.

title: XXII World Congress Special Session: COVID-19 and OSH (Occupational Safety and Health)
annotation: This web page provides recordings from the XXII World Congress Special Session: COVID-19 and OSH, held on October 5-6, 2020, with topics that included Innovations in Addressing COVID-19, and The Changing World of Work and COVID-19.

title: Risk Assessment and Testing Protocols for Reducing SARS-CoV-2 Transmission in K-12 Schools
annotation: This 18-page document aims to aid discussion around whether and how to reopen schools by helping school administrators to assess the risk of SARS-CoV-2 in their schools, and identifying key considerations in developing a screening program to regularly test students and staff for the virus to support schools to open in-person more safely.
authors: Rivers, Caitlin; Silcox, Christina; Potter, Christina; Franklin, Michelle; Ray, Rebecca
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.rockefellerfoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Risk-Assessment-and-Testing-Protocols-for-Reducing-SARS-CoV-2-Transmission-in-K-12-Schools_Final-10-14-2020.pdf

title: Flight Plan to Recovery: Preparing Airports for the Return of the Traveling Public
annotation: This 83-page report summarizes presentations from airport industry leaders who discussed current and ongoing practices to get passenger confidence back to aid in airport recovery during a virtual Airport Cooperative Research Program Insight Event on May 28, 2020. Specific topics presented the aviation industry with challenges that are mutually shared by all partners, including safety, public confidence, and financial sustainability.

title: Impact of COVID-19 on School Re-Opening
source: National Association of County and City Health Officials
annotation: This one-hour, 24-minute webinar discusses the impact of COVID-19 on school re-opening. Representatives from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Association of School Nurses, and Harris County Public Health provide insight on how COVID-19 is impacting the virtual and in-person return to school, share CDC guidance and recommendations, and provide insight on local issues and practices.
authors: Massetti, Greta; Mendonca, Linda; Rivera, Maria
access_notes: Link to recording: https://naccho.zoom.us/rec/play/3F0C7eLWrFfa49B_lWJvyBN9ZI14lJ441HLgoi26xNR-OOUB8AZJpm37-S6985ikRJ8QSUx7eCd5XoSy.TbCoqyHIrx-U4wfsLink to presentation slides: https://www.naccho.org/uploads/downloadable-resources/Impact-of-COVID19-on-School-ReOpening_Slides.pdf

title: Listening to Californians with Low Incomes: Health Care Access, Experiences, and Concerns Since the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This 37-page report discusses the results of a statewide survey of California’s residents age 18 to 64 who had received health care since March 2019, with an oversampling of residents with low incomes. The survey, conducted in the summer of 2020, asked respondents about their health care concerns, experiences, and access before and during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as about their experiences with racial discrimination and the impact of the pandemic on employment and insurance coverage.
authors: Joynt, Jen; Catterson, Rebecca; Rabinowitz, Lucy
access_notes: Link to web page with additional information: https://www.chcf.org/publication/listening-californians-low-incomes/

title: Improving Pandemic Preparedness: Lessons From COVID-19
annotation: This 158-page report assesses the global response to COVID-19, and frames pandemic disease as a stark threat to global and national security that neither the United States nor the world can afford to ignore again. It argues that future pandemic threats are inevitable and possibly imminent; policymakers should prepare for them and identify what has gone wrong in the U.S. and multilateral response.
authors: Burwell, Sylvia Matthews; Townsend, Frances Fragos; Bollyky, Thomas; Patrick, Stewart
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cfr.org/report/pandemic-preparedness-lessons-COVID-19/pdf/TFR_Pandemic_Preparedness.pdf

title: Responding to Non-Communicable Diseases During and Beyond the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This 20-page document provides an initial review of emerging information (as July 2, 2020) on the relations among COVID-19, non-communicable diseases (NCDs), and NCD risk factors. It demonstrates that  people living with NCDs are at higher risk of severe COVID-19-related illness and death and that there are limited data for estimating risk. It was published with the United Nations Development Programme, and the UN Interagency Task Force on NCDs.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/334143/WHO-2019-nCoV-Non-communicable_diseases-Evidence-2020.1-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=yLink to document in Arabic: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/334143/WHO-2019-nCoV-Non-communicable_diseases-Evidence-2020.1-ara.pdf?sequence=17&isAllowed=yLink to document in Chinese: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/334143/WHO-2019-nCoV-Non-communicable_diseases-Evidence-2020.1-chi.pdf?sequence=5&isAllowed=yLink to document in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/334143/WHO-2019-nCoV-Non-communicable_diseases-Evidence-2020.1-rus.pdf?sequence=26&isAllowed=y

title: WHO Guidance for Climate Resilient and Environmentally Sustainable Health Care Facilities
annotation: The aim of this 92-page guidance is to enhance the capacity of health care facilities to protect and improve the health of their target communities in an unstable and changing climate; and to empower health care facilities to be environmentally sustainable, by optimizing the use of resources and minimizing the release of waste into the environment.
authors: Corvalan, Carlos; Sena, Aderita; Prats, Elena; Campbell-Lendrum, Diarmid
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/335909/9789240012226-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: Pandemic Influenza Preparedness Framework
annotation: This 32-page issue of the Pandemic Influenza Preparedness progress report was developed as the world continues to respond to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic. Despite the many challenges brought on by this global crisis, much was nonetheless achieved to continue the work to prepare for the next influenza pandemic, and readers will be able to learn about some of the happenings on the ground in a new section entitled “Stories from the field.”
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/335937/9789240012653-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) Preservation Planning Toolkit
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: This two-page toolkit from the COVID-19 Healthcare Resilience Working Group provides links to documents that are designed to aid any personal protective equipment (PPE)-using organization to plan and implement preservation strategies. It assists users to understand types of preservation strategies their organizations may implement, and provides estimates of positive impacts of using those strategies in increasing the duration of a specified PPE supply.

title: FDA Briefing Document: Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee Meeting
annotation: This 38-page document is a briefing paper for a meeting to be held on October 22, 2020, to discuss studies that should be conducted, pre- and/or post-licensure, to evaluate the safety and efficacy of COVID-19 vaccine candidates, including in special populations (e.g., pediatric populations and pregnant women), and to further evaluate the immunogenicity and duration of effectiveness of these vaccines. The committee will also be asked to discuss the need for post-marketing safety studies following approval of a Biologics License Application (BLA) for a COVID-19 vaccine.

title: "Greatest Need Was to Be Listened To:” The Importance of Mental Health and Psychosocial Support During COVID-19
source: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
annotation: This 24-page joint report, sponsored by the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), International Fede­ration of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), Danish Red Cross, Lebanese Red Cross, and Swedish Red Cross, collates seven case studies from mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS) activities around the world to highlight how Red Cross and Red Crescent volunteers are treating the hidden wounds of the COVID-19 pandemic among the world’s most vulnerable communities.
authors: Clomen, Dick; Horn, Rebecca; Osorio, Milena; Powell, Melanie; Rydell, Anne
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://pscentre.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Covid19_Report_061020.pdf

title: Pandemic Fatigue: Reinvigorating the Public to Prevent COVID-19
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for Europe
annotation: Across the WHO European Region, Member States are reporting signs of pandemic fatigue in their populations – defined as demotivation to follow recommended protective behaviors, emerging gradually over time and affected by a number of emotions, experiences, and perceptions. This 28-page framework document provides key considerations for the planning and implementation of national and subnational strategies to maintain and reinvigorate public support to prevent COVID-19.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/335820/WHO-EURO-2020-1160-40906-55390-eng.pdfLink to document in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/335823/WHO-EURO-2020-1160-40906-55391-rus.pdf

title: COVID-19 Physician FAQs
source: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
annotation: This web page provides links to COVID-19 FAQs for obstetrician-gynecologists. FAQ topics are Ethics, Telehealth, Obstetrics, and Gynecology.

title: Face Masks, Public Policies and Slowing the Spread of COVID-19: Evidence from Canada
annotation: This 68-page report estimates the impact of mask mandates and other non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPI) on COVID-19 case growth in Canada, including regulations on businesses and gatherings, school closures, travel and self-isolation, and long-term care homes. Counterfactual policy simulations suggest that mandating indoor masks nationwide in early July could have reduced the weekly number of new cases in Canada by 25 to 40 percent in mid-August, which translates into 700 to 1,100 fewer cases per week.
authors: Karaivanov, Alexander; Lu, Shih En; Chen, Cong; Pamplona, Stephanie
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w27891/w27891.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: UMass Molecular Virology Laboratory 2019-nCoV rRT-PCR Dx Panel
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the UMass Molecular Virology Laboratory 2019-nCoV rRT-PCR Dx Panel that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142691/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142689/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142692/download

title: COVID-19 Diagnostics
annotation: This collection of COVID-19 diagnostic resources, developed with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), is designed for clinicians, clinical microbiologists, and other laboratory science professionals. Resources are provided for Antibody Testing, Rapid Testing, and RT-PCR Testing.

title: COVID-19 Infection Prevention
annotation: This web page, developed with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), reviews research and guidance on the use of masks, face coverings, and eye protection, as well as strategies that include physical distancing and isolation during the COVID-19 pandemic. It covers Eye Protection, Isolation and Infection Control, Masks and Face Coverings for the Public, Personal Protective Equipment in Medical Settings, and Physical Distancing.

title: epitweetr Tool
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The R-based tool epitweetr allows users to automatically monitor trends of tweets by time, place and topic, with the aim of detecting public health threats early through signals, such as an unusual increase in the number of tweets. It was designed to support public health experts with the early detection of threats from infectious diseases but can be extended to all hazards and other fields of study by modifying the topics and keywords.
access_notes: Materials are available in a zip file.Link to Early Detection of Public Health Threats from Twitter Data manual: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/epitweetr_user_manual.pdfLink to User Documentation: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/epitweetr_vignette.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: iC SARS-CoV2 Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the iC SARS-CoV2 Test. The iC SARS-CoV2 Test is authorized for use with upper respiratory tract specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142595/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142593/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142596/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Access IL-6
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Access IL-6. The Access IL-6 is authorized for use in human serum and plasma specimens collected from patients with confirmed coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19) to assist in identifying severe inflammatory response to aid in determining the risk of intubation with mechanical ventilation, in conjunction with clinical findings and the results of other laboratory testing.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142599/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142597/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142600/download

title: Toolkit on State Actions to Mitigate COVID-19 Prevalence in Nursing Homes
annotation: This 186-page toolkit, updated in October 2020, catalogs the many innovative solutions designed at the state level to protect the nation’s vulnerable nursing home residents during the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.

title: Core Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action (2020)
annotation: The Core Commitments for Children (CCCs) promote equality, transparency, responsibility and a results-oriented approach to enable predictable and timely collective humanitarian action. Initially developed in 1998, and revised in 2010 and again in 2020, the CCCs are grounded in global humanitarian norms and standards and set commitments and benchmarks against which UNICEF holds itself accountable for the coverage, quality and equity of its humanitarian action and advocacy.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.unicef.org/media/84086/file/Core%20Commitments%20for%20Children%20(English).pdfLink to Disaster Lit record for Core Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action (2010): https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:14594

title: Antigenic and Genetic Characteristics of Zoonotic Influenza Viruses and Candidate Vaccine Viruses Developed for Potential Use in Human Vaccines
annotation: This web page, updated in October 2020, provides the most current information about zoonotic influenza virus activity and virus characterization, and describes the current status of the development of candidate vaccine viruses for pandemic preparedness purposes. It is meant to provide guidance for national authorities and vaccine companies on the selection of candidate viruses for use in vaccine development. Summaries on this page begin in August 2006 and are added periodically.

title: What to Do If a Child Becomes Sick at Child Care or Reports a New COVID-19 Diagnosis
