annotation: This one-page flowchart details what to do if a child in child care displays an illness consistent with COVID-19, or if parents, guardians, or caregivers report a child to have recent contact with a person with COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to flowchart in Spanish: https://www.childcareaware.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/WhatToDo-COVID19InChildCare-Flowchart-Spanish.pdf

title: Indian Country COVID-19 Response and Update
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Appropriations
annotation: Witnesses at this one-hour, 18-minute Congressional hearing discuss how agencies have implemented the appropriate COVID-19 response funding for the Indian Health Service, and tribal and urban Indian health organizations; the new and continuing challenges in addressing the pandemic; and how the federal government can help tribal nations, Indian health facilities, and Bureau of Indian Education-funded schools.
authors: McCollum, Betty; Allis, Kevin; Angus-Hornbuckle, Carolyn; Crevier, Francys

title: Considerations for the Use of Real-World Evidence to Assess the Effectiveness of Preventive Vaccines
annotation: This two-day workshop, held on September 17-18, 2020, was organized to exchange information with stakeholders from industry, academia, and government about the scientific, clinical, and regulatory challenges and opportunities in using real-world evidence to assess the effectiveness of preventive vaccines. It included a discussion of emerging infectious diseases (e.g., coronavirus, Ebola, influenza pandemics) and other scenarios (e.g., maternal immunization to prevent disease in infants through the use of licensed/recommended vaccines) in which traditional clinical trials could be impractical or ethically unacceptable.
authors: Gruber, Marion; Roberts, Jeff; Forshee, Rich; Cavaleri, Marco; Izurieta, Hector
access_notes: Scroll down this page for recordings and agenda.

title: Study of the COVID-19 Outbreak and Response in Connecticut Long-Term Care Facilities
annotation: This 157-page report assesses the COVID-19 outbreak in long-term care (LTC) facilities in Connecticut. It recommends ways to help the state and LTC facilities prevent future infectious disease outbreaks, and identifies immediate and achievable steps the state and LTC industry can take to prepare for a second wave of COVID-19.
authors: Rowan, Patricia; Gupta, Reena; Lester, Rebecca; Levere, Michael; Liao, Kristie

title: Guidance Related to the Emergency Preparedness Testing Exercise Requirements-Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)
annotation: This nine-page worksheet presents guidance for surveyors, as well as providers and suppliers, with relevant scenarios on meeting the emergency preparedness testing requirements in light of many of the response activities associated with the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency (PHE). CMS regulations for emergency preparedness require specific testing exercises be conducted to validate a facility’s emergency program.

title: Ransomware Guide
annotation: This 16-page guide details practices that organizations should continuously engage in to help manage the risk posed by ransomware and other cyber threats. It provides actionable best practices for ransomware prevention, as well as a ransomware response checklist that can serve as a ransomware-specific addendum to organization cyber incident response plans.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cisa.gov/sites/default/files/publications/CISA_MS-ISAC_Ransomware%20Guide_S508C.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Alimetrix SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Alimetrix SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142591/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142589/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142592/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Aeon Global Health SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Aeon Global Health SARS-CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142534/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142532/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142535/download

title: Guidance on the Use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for Pediatric Care in Ambulatory Care Settings During the SARS-CoV-2 Pandemic
annotation: This web page, updated on September 30, 2020, provides guidance for mitigating the risk of infection for all who work or receive care in pediatric ambulatory settings, including the appropriate use of personal protective equipment (PPE) along with consistent and effective infection prevention and control practices.

title: COVID-19 Testing Guidance
annotation: This guidance, updated on September 30, 2020, was developed to help pediatric practices determine when to test for severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection in their patient population.

title: COVID-19 Guidance for Schools Kindergarten to Grade 12
annotation: This guidance, updated on September 30, 2020, provides information for both public and private institutions providing K-12 education programs in the classroom setting. It takes into consideration the diverse needs of population groups based on vulnerability, ethnicity/culture, disability, developmental status, and other socioeconomic and demographic factors.

title: Guidance on the Use of Influenza Vaccine in the Presence of COVID-19
annotation: The guidance on this web page is designed to support provincial and territorial vaccine programs and primary care providers in offering influenza vaccine during the COVID-19 pandemic. Topics include delivery and administration of influenza vaccine during COVID-19 pandemic, and who should receive the influenza vaccine during COVID-19 pandemic.

title: EU Laboratory Capability Monitoring System (EULabCap), 2018
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 44-page, fifth consecutive report of the European Union Laboratory Capability (EULabCap) monitoring program presents European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) laboratory capabilities and capacities in 2018, and the trends of previous survey results over the period 2013–2018.
authors: Leitmeyer, Katrin; Struelens, Marc
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/EULabCap-survey-2018.pdf

title: Preventing Global Catastrophic Biological Risks
annotation: This 32-page report summarizes the exercise scenario and discussion from a scenario-based tabletop exercise designed to identify gaps in global capabilities to prevent and respond to high-consequence biological events, which was held in February 2020. It includes recommendations from the organizers.
authors: Cameron, Beth; Eckles, Jacob; Jordan, Jacob; Yassif, Jaime
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://media.nti.org/documents/NTI_BIO_TTX_RPT_FINAL.pdfLink to the exercise website, which includes videos: https://www.nti.org/about/projects/global-catastrophic-biological-risks/preventing-global-catastrophic-biological-risks-tabletop-exercise-2020-munich-security-conference/

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: SARS-CoV-2 Mass Array Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the SARS-CoV-2 Mass Array Test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142547/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142545/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142548/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Akron Children’s Hospital SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Akron Children’s Hospital SARS-CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142542/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142540/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142543/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: CentoSure SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the CentoSure SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay. The CentoSure SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay is authorized for use with dry oropharyngeal swab specimens from individuals without symptoms or other reasons to suspect COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142538/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142536/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142539/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Nirmidas COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2) IgM/IgG Antibody Detection Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Nirmidas COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2) IgM/IgG Antibody Detection Kit. The Nirmidas COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2) IgM/IgG Antibody Detection Kit is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma (dipotassium EDTA and lithium heparin) specimens.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142560/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142558/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142561/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: FREND COVID-19 total Ab
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the FREND COVID-19 total Ab. The FREND COVID-19 total Ab is authorized for the qualitative detection of total antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human dipotassium EDTA plasma.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142556/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142554/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142557/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: LIAISON SARS-CoV-2 IgM
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the LIAISON SARS-CoV-2 IgM. The LIAISON SARS-CoV-2 IgM is authorized for the detection of IgM antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma (sodium heparin, lithium heparin, and dipotassium EDTA).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142551/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142549/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142552/download

title: Strengthening Health Security Across the Globe: Progress and Impact of U.S. Government Investments in the Global Health Security Agenda
annotation: This 28-page document is the fourth Global Health Security Agenda (GHSA) annual report. It details the progress and impact of investments made by the United States in the GHSA to protect against infectious disease threats and their subsequent adverse effects on global health, security, and the economy.

title: Webinar Series - Respirators and Other Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for Health Care Personnel Use During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page provides information about a webinar series, starting on September 29, 2020, discussing the importation of respirators during the COVID-19 pandemic, and the Food and Drug Administration's collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on the sampling and testing of international respirators in support of the FDA's respirator Emergency Use Authorizations.

title: COVID-19: Management of Staff and Exposed Patients and Residents in Health and Social Care Settings
annotation: This guidance provides advice on the management of staff and patients or residents in health and social care settings according to COVID-19 exposures, symptoms, and test results. It includes guidance for staff with symptoms of COVID-19, and staff return to work criteria.

title: COVID-19: How to Work Safely in Care Homes
annotation: These print and video guidance materials for those working in care homes provide information on how to work safely during this period of sustained transmission of COVID-19, including information about personal protective equipment and case studies.
access_notes: Link to Case Scenarios for Health Care Workers: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-how-to-work-safely-in-care-homes/case-scenarios-for-health-care-workers

title: National Public Health Framework for the Prevention and Control of Vector-Borne Diseases in Humans
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: Five federal departments and the Environmental Protection Agency contributed to developing this 16-page national framework for vector-borne disease prevention and control, which includes federal activities necessary to detect, prevent, and control vector-borne diseases in humans in the United States.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cdc.gov/ncezid/dvbd/pdf/Brochure_National_Framework_VBDs-P.pdf

title: COVID-19 Target Product Profiles for Priority Diagnostics to Support Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic v.0.1
annotation: The World Health Organization has published this 38-page final version of Target Product Profiles (TPP), updated on September 28, 2020, for priority COVID-19 diagnostics. These TPPs describe the desirable and minimally acceptable profiles for four tests.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/blue-print/who-rd-blueprint-diagnostics-tpp-final-v1-0-28-09-jc-ppc-final-cmp.pdf?sfvrsn=af73a99a_2&download=true

title: Housing and Shelter During a Pandemic Webinar Series
source: Naval Postgraduate School, Center for Homeland Security and Defense
annotation: This web page provides information and links for a webinar series discussing the challenges and emerging model practices for housing, sheltering, and congregate population management during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Risk Mitigation Tool for Child and Youth Settings Operating During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This tool will assist school boards and operators of child and youth settings in considering risks to children/youth, staff, and volunteers during the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic, and provide examples of strategies that may be implemented to mitigate potential risks.

title: Pertussis: Annual Epidemiological Report for 2018
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This eight-page report provides information about pertussis cases in 2018, when there were 35,627 cases of pertussis reported by 30 European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) countries. Five countries - Germany, the Netherlands, Norway, Spain, and the United Kingdom (UK) - accounted for 72 percent of all notified cases.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/AER_for_2018_pertussis.pdf

title: COVID-19: Current State of the Pandemic
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: This 53-minute webinar describes the current COVID-19 pandemic hotspots in the U.S. and globally, including the epidemiology of the current wave of infections. It also discusses country-wide testing needs to mitigate and suppress COVID-19 infections, reviews the evidence regarding possible re-infections of COVID-19, and interprets the data behind the newest therapeutic guidelines for COVID-19.
authors: Tennill, Trish; Klinger, Amanda; Mukherjee, Vikram
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/53cf2eb5e0fc5d60650c7f9024e4e23b.pdf

title: COVID-19 Vaccine Planning Information Session for Tribal Communities
annotation: The purpose of this one-hour, four-minute webinar is to introduce Tribal leaders to COVID-19 vaccine distribution options and planning considerations. It includes an overview of the federal government’s COVID-19 vaccine planning activities, and highlights considerations for Tribal leaders and health organizations serving Tribal and urban Indian communities making decisions about vaccine distribution.
authors: Whicker, Marion; Groom, Amy; Vigario, Jennifer
access_notes: Link to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Presentation Vaccine Planning Webinar Slides: https://www.nihb.org/covid-19/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/CDC-Presentation-Vaccine-Planning-Webinar_9_24_Final.pdfLink to Indian Health Service (IHS) Presentation Vaccine Planning Webinar Slides: https://www.nihb.org/covid-19/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/IHS-Presentation-for-NIHB_final_09252020.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: MosaiQ COVID-19 Antibody Magazine
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the MosaiQ COVID-19 Antibody Magazine. The MosaiQ COVID-19 Antibody Magazine is authorized for the detection of total (IgM and IgG) antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and dipotassium (K2) and tripotassium (K3)EDTA plasma.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142485/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142483/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142486/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Genetrack SARS-CoV-2 Molecular Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Genetrack SARS-CoV-2 Molecular Assay. The Genetrack SARS-CoV-2 Molecular Assay is authorized for use with anterior nasal swab specimens self-collected at home using the Vo’ COVID-19 Test Home Collection Kit by individuals suspected of COVID-19 when home collection is determined to be appropriate by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142481/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142479/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/142482/download

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 and Outreach Efforts: Resources for Communication Tools and Social Media Assets in a COVID-19 Environment
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources to effectively communicate to diverse populations in the COVID-19 environment.

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 and Minority/Vulnerable Populations: Resources for Outreach and Protection of At-Risk Individuals in a COVID-19 Environment
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources to engage and protect minority and vulnerable populations in the COVID-19 environment.

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 and K-12 Schools: Resources for Operating K-12 Schools in a COVID-19 Environment
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources related to ways K-12 schools across the country are operating in the COVID-19 environment.

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 and Institutions of Higher Education (IHE): Resources for Operating IHEs in a COVID-19 Environment
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources related to ways institutions of higher education (IHEs) across the country are operating in the COVID-19 environment.

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 and Critical Infrastructure and Businesses: Resources for Operating Critical Infrastructure in a COVID-19 Environment
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources related to how critical infrastructure and businesses across the country are operating in the COVID-19 environment.

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 and Community and Faith-Based Organizations Resources for Operating in a COVID-19 Environment
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources related to ways community and faith-based organizations across the country are operating in the COVID-19 environment.

title: Modelling the Allocation and Impact of a COVID-19 Vaccine
annotation: This 21-page report identifies optimal vaccine allocation strategies within and between countries to maximize health (avert deaths) under constraints on dose supply. It extended an existing mathematical model of SARS-CoV-2 transmission across different country settings to model the public health impact of potential vaccines, using a range of target product profiles developed by the World Health Organization.
authors: Hogan, Alexandra; Winskill, Peter; Watson, Oliver; Walker, Patrick; Whittaker, Charles
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.imperial.ac.uk/media/imperial-college/medicine/mrc-gida/2020-09-25-COVID19-Report-33.pdf

title: Digital Contact Tracing and Data Protection Law
annotation: This 47-page report discusses how data privacy and security (together, data protection) law applies to a public health authority’s use of digital contact tracing tools, the role of technology in assisting with contact tracing, and potential privacy concerns. Appendix A provides Digital Contact Tracing Apps By State.
authors: Gaffney, Jonathan; Holmes, Eric; Linebaugh, Chris

title: Capacity Building for Improved Behavioral Health in Rural America: Resilience in the Wake of COVID-19
annotation: This one-hour, two-minute webinar seeks to summarize challenges with opioid and other substance misuse, emphasizing related problems for rural communities in the wake of COVID-19; highlight opportunities to address these challenges through science-based prevention programming, using illustrations from work on virtual trainings to enhance resilience; and share recent developments in capacity building for science-based prevention programming in rural communities, focusing on the National Behavioral Health Extension Network (NBH E-Net).
authors: Spoth, Richard; Pliler, Greg; Knutson, Cassandra

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Emergency Use of the COViage System During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This four-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the COViage System (or “COViage”) for use by healthcare providers in the hospital setting for adult patients (18 years of age or older who are admitted to the hospital) with confirmed COVID-19 (based on a positive PCR test result) for the computation of proprietary patient status indices referred to as Respiratory Decompensation Status and Hemodynamic Instability Status as an adjunct to patient monitoring during the COVID-19 outbreak.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142455/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142454/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142453/download

title: Children’s Health and Well-Being During the Coronavirus Pandemic
annotation: This brief examines how a range of economic and societal disruptions stemming from COVID-19 may affect the health and well-being of children and families. It finds that school openings/closures, social distancing, loss of health coverage, and disruptions in medical care could negatively impact the health and well-being children in the U.S.
authors: Garfield, Rachel; Chidambaram, Priya

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Emergency Use of the Duke University COVIAGE
annotation: This four-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers  of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of COVIAGE. This device is authorized for use by healthcare personnel (HCP) as an extra layer of protection in addition to personal protective equipment (PPE) to prevent HCP exposure to pathogenic biological airborne particulates by providing isolation of hospitalized patients with suspected or confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19, at the time of definitive airway management, when performing airway-related medical procedures, or during certain transport of such patients during the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142451/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142447/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Facilities: https://www.fda.gov/media/142448/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Personnel: https://www.fda.gov/media/142449/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2/Flu/RSV
annotation: This four-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2/Flu/RSV test. The Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2/Flu/RSV test is authorized for use with certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of respiratory viral infection consistent with COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142436/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142434/downloadLink to Instructions for Labs: https://www.fda.gov/media/142437/downloadLink to Instructions for Point-of-Care: https://www.fda.gov/media/142438/download

title: Biological Event Horizon: No Return or Total Resilience
annotation: This three-hour, 41-minute virtual meeting was held to better understand emerging biological threats and novel science and technology solutions for biodefense. Participants discuss how the ongoing novel coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic is revealing major gaps in national readiness to prepare for, respond to, and recover from biological threats.
authors: Brooks, Susan; DeGette, Diana; Yassif, Jaime; Ramachandran, Sahini; Madhav, Nita

title: COVID-19: Optimizing Healthcare Personal Protective Equipment and Supplies
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This one-hour, 32-minute webinar from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) discusses federal authorities and COVID-19, NIOSH activities supporting respirator supply optimization, and healthcare and related applications standards gaps supporting supply optimization.
authors: Hintz, Leslie; Ignacio, Joselito; Hick, John L.; D'Alessandro, Maryann
access_notes: Site requires free registration.Link to presentation slides: https://files.asprtracie.hhs.gov/documents/aspr-tracie-optimizing-healthcare-ppe-webinar-ppt-final.pdfLink to Q&A: https://files.asprtracie.hhs.gov/documents/aspr-tracie-covid-19-optimizing-ppe-and-supplies-webinar-q-and-a.pdfThis training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1093722.

title: Increased Transmission of COVID-19 in the EU/EEA and the UK – Twelfth Update
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 27-page update analyzes the risk posed to the general population, vulnerable individuals, and healthcare provision by the current increase in COVID-19 case notification rates observed in the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/covid-19-risk-assessment-increased-transmission-12th-update-september-2020.pdfLink to related infographic: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/publications-data/infographic-increased-transmission-covid-19-eueea-and-uk

title: Guidelines for the Implementation of Non-Pharmaceutical Interventions Against COVID-19
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The guidelines in this 38-page report detail available options for non-pharmaceutical interventions against COVID-19 in various epidemiologic scenarios, assess the evidence for their effectiveness, and address implementation issues, including potential barriers and facilitators.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/covid-19-guidelines-non-pharmaceutical-interventions-september-2020.pdfLink to related infographic: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/images/covid-19-non-pharmaceutical-measures-infographic.png

title: List N: EPA’s Registered Antimicrobial Products for Use  Against Novel Coronavirus SARS-CoV-2
annotation: This interactive web page, updated on September 24, 2020, provides an expanded list of over 420 EPA-registered disinfectant products that have qualified for use against SARS-CoV-2, the novel coronavirus that causes COVID-19. It has enhanced functionality to allow users to sort these products by surface type and use site.
access_notes: This page includes a link to the list in a PDF document.Link to List N Tool: COVID-19 Disinfectants (mobile app): https://cfpub.epa.gov/giwiz/disinfectants/index.cfmLink to FAQs (English): https://www.epa.gov/coronavirus/frequent-questions-about-disinfectants-and-coronavirus-covid-19Link to Spanish Lista N: Desinfectantes para usar contra SARS-CoV-2: https://espanol.epa.gov/espanol/lista-n-desinfectantes-para-usar-contra-sars-cov-2Link to FAQs in Spanish:  Preguntas frecuentes sobre la Lista N: Desinfectantes para usar contra SARS-CoV-2 https://espanol.epa.gov/espanol/preguntas-frecuentes-sobre-la-lista-n-desinfectantes-para-usar-contra-sars-cov-2Link to Portuguese: Lista N: Desinfetantes para uso contra SARS-CoV-2: https://www.epa.gov/lep/lista-n-desinfetantes-para-uso-contra-sars-cov-2Link to FAQs in Portuguese: Perguntas frequentes sobre desinfetantes e coronavírus (COVID-19): https://www.epa.gov/lep/perguntas-frequentes-sobre-desinfetantes-e-coronavirus-covid-19

title: Guidelines for the Implementation of Non-Pharmaceutical Interventions Against COVID-19
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 38-page document, updated on September 24, 2020, provides guidelines that detail available options for non-pharmaceutical interventions against COVID-19 in various epidemiologic scenarios, assess the evidence for their effectiveness, and address implementation issues, including potential barriers and facilitators.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/covid-19-guidelines-non-pharmaceutical-interventions-september-2020.pdf

title: PanVax Tool for Pandemic Vaccination Planning
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The PanVax tool is a Microsoft Excel-based instrument that guides jurisdictional planning and outreach efforts during preparedness activities. The tool helps local planners understand how their vaccine providers (i.e., pharmacies, clinics, hospitals, employers, schools, points of dispensing) might contribute to the community’s vaccination response during a severe pandemic.
access_notes: Link to manual: https://www.cdc.gov/flu/pandemic-resources/tools/downloads/PanVaxManual_v3.3.pdfLink to Excel file: https://www.cdc.gov/flu/pandemic-resources/tools/downloads/PanVaxPlanningTool_v3.3.xlsxLink to resource in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/flu/pandemic-resources/tools/panvax-tool.htm

title: Interim Guidance: Death Care Services and Handling of Dead Bodies During the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Pandemic
annotation: This guidance is intended for death care providers, including funeral homes, cemeteries and crematorium operators, medical examiners, coroners, medical personnel, and any other personnel community members in remote and isolated communities, who will be handling dead bodies of deceased persons confirmed or suspected to have been infected with COVID-19, or in regions with high levels of community transmission.

title: Preparing Health Care Providers for a COVID-19 Vaccine
annotation: Attorneys advising health care providers and entities, from inside or outside the providers, should take time now to prepare for the legal issues that will ultimately arise once successful development and deployment of an effective COVID-19 vaccine is possible. Even as the COVID-19 pandemic places intense stress on health care providers and legal institutions, it is important to engage with the area of vaccine law to help plan ahead and chart the way out of this crisis. This webinar covers these issues, as well as other relevant, pertinent aspects of vaccine law.
authors: Abramson, Brian Dean; Williamson, Jerry
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: Focusing on Employee Safety While Responding to COVID-19
annotation: This one-hour, 30-minute webinar provides information on safety measures employees should consider and practice when conducting drive-through and drive-up screening or vaccination services during the COVID-19 response.
authors: Garrett, Carol; Harrison, Kenneth; Persky, Leigh; Poe, William
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: New Behavioral Health Tool for the COVID-19 Era
source: National Center for Disaster Medicine and Public Health [Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences]
annotation: Presenters in this 56-minute webinar, held in collaboration with the Center for Study in Traumatic Stress (CSTS), discuss the recently published Second Edition of the Curriculum Recommendations for Disaster Health and its application, including for COVID-19.
authors: Strauss-Riggs, Kandra ; Flynn, Brian; Morganstein, Joshua; Vance, Mary
access_notes: Link to the curriculum: https://www.usuhs.edu/sites/default/files/media/ncdmph/pdf/ncdmph_csts_revised.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Orawell IgM/IgG Rapid Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Orawell IgM/IgG Rapid Test. The Orawell IgM/IgG Rapid Test is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and acid citrate dextrose (ACD) plasma.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Clear Dx SARS-CoV-2 Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Clear Dx SARS-CoV-2 Test. The Clear Dx SARS-CoV-2 Test is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142420/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142419/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142418/download

title: Updated Evidence to Support the Emergency Use of COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma
annotation: This five-page document describes four lines of evidence that continue to support the emergency use of  COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma at this time, one month after initial issuance of the Emergency Use Authorization: 1) historical data regarding prior experience with the use of convalescent plasma in other outbreak settings; 2) data from animal studies; 3) data that continues to emerge in the published literature from clinical studies performed during the current outbreak; and 4) results obtained from a large expanded access treatment protocol (National Expanded Program).

title: Data for Decision-Making: Responsible Management of Data During COVID-19 and Beyond
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Science, Space, and Technology
annotation: This one-hour, 17-minute Congressional hearing focuses on how data drives the decision-making at every level of the response to COVID-19, and how ensuring the integrity, transparency, and accuracy of this data is crucial to keeping everyone safe and prepared.
authors: Johnson, Eddie Bernice; Foster, Bill; Lee, Lisa; Maragakis, Lisa; Roy, Avik

title: Health Care Lifeline: The Affordable Care Act and the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Energy and Commerce
annotation: Witnesses in this four-hour, eight-minute Congressional hearing discuss the Affordable Care Act (ACA)’s impact on the status of health coverage amidst COVID-19, and what needs to be done to expand and improve access to quality, affordable health care.
authors: Pallone, Jr., Frank; Aron-Dine, Aviva; Cameron, Dean; Holtz-Eakin, Douglas; Lee, Peter

title: COVID-19: An Update on the Federal Response
source: U.S. Senate, Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions
annotation: Witnesses in this three-hour, 18-minute Congressional hearing discuss the Department of Health and Human Services’ ongoing response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and how each of their agencies and offices are working to prevent, diagnose, and treat the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
authors: Fauci, Anthony S.; Redfield, Robert; Giroir, Brett; Hahn, Stephen

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Assure COVID-19 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Device-Assure Tech. (Hangzhou Co., Ltd)
annotation: This three-page fact sheet, updated on September 23, 2020, informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Assure COVID-19 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Device. The Assure COVID-19 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Device is authorized for the detection of IgG and IgM antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human venous whole blood (sodium EDTA), serum, or plasma (sodium EDTA).

annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the ViroKey SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test v2.0. The ViroKey SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test v2.0 is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.

annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Clarifi COVID-19 Test Kit. The Clarifi COVID-19 Test Kit is authorized for use with saliva swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142378/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142376/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142379/download

title: Guidance for Reopening Buildings After Prolonged Shutdown or Reduced Operation
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page recommends checking for hazards before reopening a building after a prolonged period of building inactivity, and provides guidance about mold, Legionella and Legionnaires’ disease, and lead and copper.
access_notes: Link to page in Spanish: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/php/building-water-system-esp.html

title: GLASS Whole-Genome Sequencing for Surveillance of Antimicrobial Resistance
annotation: This 72-page document from the Global Antimicrobial Resistance and Use Surveillance System (GLASS) addresses the applications of whole-genome sequencing (WGS) for antimicrobial resistance (AMR) surveillance, including the benefits and limitations of current WGS technologies. Local, subnational, national and international case studies are included as examples of use of WGS in AMR surveillance.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1304087/retrieve

title: COVID-19 Vaccine Introduction Readiness Assessment Tool
annotation: This readiness assessment tool is a national level tool in an Excel spreadsheet. Data inputs should be entered into the worksheet National Readiness. Suggestions for timing and intervals to implement activities and assess progress are provided in the timeline.
access_notes: Direct link to spreadsheet: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1312921/retrieve

title: Mental Health in a Time of Crisis
annotation: This one-hour, 31-minute webinar discusses the importance of mental health, especially in times of crisis like the current COVID-19 pandemic when already scarce resources are often pulled for other priorities. The conversation pays particular attention to the need for mental health services to be highly contextualized and responsive to the needs and perspectives of people with lived experience.
authors: Fast, Paul Shelter; Farmer, Mychelle; Raviola, Guiseppe; Sunkel, Charlene; Devkota, Matrika
access_notes: Site requires free registration.Link to presentation slides: https://coregroup.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Session4_CORE_NCDWebinar_MentalHealth_v1c_FINAL.Oct19.pptx

title: Preparing Countries for COVID-19 Vaccine Introduction
annotation: There are immediate actions that countries can take to prepare for COVID-19 vaccines. This two-page document provides a brief summary of pre-planning actions that all countries can begin working on immediately.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/336187/WHO-2019-nCoV-Vaccine_introduction-2020.1-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: Behavioral Health Care and COVID- 19: The Next Phase
source: Mental Health Technology Transfer Center Network
annotation: As COVID-19 infections reach the six-month and six-million infected mark in the United States, behavioral health organizations are finding themselves having to move beyond rapid infectious disease preparations and on to a "next phase" of care. This one-hour webinar explores the ongoing approaches to care and how they are evolving to best meet the needs.
authors: Raney, Lori
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: In Response: Yan et al Preprint Examinations of the Origin of SARS-CoV-2
source: Center for Health Security [Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health]
annotation: This 13-page document undertakes a scientific review of a recent report, released as a preprint put forward by the Rule of Law Society, which presents a theory about the origin of SARS-CoV-2 but offers contradictory and inaccurate information that does not support their argument.
authors: Warmbrod, Kelsey; West, Rachel; Connell, Nancy; Gronvall, Gigi
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.centerforhealthsecurity.org/our-work/pubs_archive/pubs-pdfs/2020/200921-in-response-yan.pdf

title: WHO SAGE Seasonal Influenza Vaccination Recommendations during the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This four-page document provides interim recommendations from the WHO Strategic Advisory Group of Experts (SAGE) on Immunization for influenza vaccination during the COVID-19 pandemic. It also provides programmatic considerations for national authorities planning and conducting their influenza vaccination programs, as well as research  considerations to address current knowledge gaps.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: KimForest SARS-CoV-2 Detection Kit v1
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the KimForest SARS-CoV-2 Detection Kit v1. The KimForest SARS-CoV-2 Detection Kit v1 is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142362/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142360/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142363/download

title: Reinfection with SARS-CoV-2: Considerations for Public Health Response
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The aim of this 14-page Threat Assessment Brief is to elucidate the characteristics and frequency of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 reinfection in the literature, to summarize the findings about SARS-CoV-2 infection and antibody development, and to consider several questions about reinfection and transmission.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/Re-infection-and-viral-shedding-threat-assessment-brief.pdf

title: COVID-19: Federal Efforts Could Be Strengthened by Timely and Concerted Actions
annotation: This 371-page report updates the GAO's oversight of federal actions to support public health, individuals, and the economy during the COVID-19 pandemic, and details evolving lessons learned relevant to the nation’s response to pandemics. It provides 16 recommendations for federal agencies.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/709492.pdf

title: PREP Act and COVID-19: Limiting Liability for Medical Countermeasures
annotation: The Public Readiness and Emergency Preparedness Act (PREP Act) authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) to limit legal liability for losses relating to the administration of medical countermeasures such as diagnostics, treatments, and vaccines. This six-page report, updated on September 21, 2020, reviews the structure of the PREP Act and the HHS Declaration to explain the scope of this liability immunity as it applies to COVID-19 countermeasures.
authors: Hickey, Kevin

title: FDA Guidance on Conduct of Clinical Trials of Medical Products During the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency
annotation: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued this 35-page guidance, updated on September 21, 2020, to provide general considerations to assist sponsors in assuring the safety of trial participants in the conduct of clinical trials of medical products, maintaining compliance with good clinical practice (GCP), and minimizing risks to trial integrity during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/136238/download

title: Interim Laboratory Biosafety Guidelines for Handling and Processing Specimens Associated with Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on September 19, 2020, provides general and specific biosafety guidelines for handling COVID-19 specimens, as well as information about clinical laboratory testing; packing, shipping, and transport; and related resources. Updates include Standard Precautions.

title: Maintaining Essential Health Services During COVID-19 in Low-Resource, Non-U.S. Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The purpose of this guidance is to provide ministries of health, public health authorities, and implementing partners with a framework for implementing strategies to reduce preventable illness and death during the COVID-19 pandemic in persons with non-COVID-19 illness and injury, particularly in low-resource settings.

title: Adult Social Care: Our COVID-19 Winter Plan 2020 to 2021
annotation: This web page sets out the key elements of COVID-19 national support available for the social care sector for winter 2020 to 2021, as well as the main actions to take for local authorities, National Health Service organizations, and social care providers, including in the voluntary and community sector.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: GK ACCU-RIGHT SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR KIT
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the GK ACCU-RIGHT SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR KIT. The GK ACCU-RIGHT SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR KIT is authorized for use with upper respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142309/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142307/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142310/download

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Checklist for K-12 Schools
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: As K-12 schools reopen for in-person instruction, it is important to have systems in place for the monitoring and evaluation of COVID-19 mitigation strategies. Monitoring and evaluation provide practical information for making timely decisions, addressing community needs, and identifying best practices to promote the health, safety, and well-being of students, faculty, and staff.

title: Large-Scale Geographic Seroprevalence Surveys
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: CDC is conducting seroprevalence surveys called “large-scale geographic seroprevalence surveys” in locations across the United States. The first seroprevalence surveys began in areas that first reported community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in the United States; they are now being expanded to more regions. Descriptions of these surveys are provided on this web page.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/geographic-seroprevalence-surveys.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/geographic-seroprevalence-surveys.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/geographic-seroprevalence-surveys.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/geographic-seroprevalence-surveys.html

title: Contact Tracing: Frequently Asked Questions; Information for Health Departments
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on September 18, 2020, provides answers to frequently asked questions about contact tracing, with topics covering basics, and digital tools and information. It also provides links to additional resources.

title: COVID-19 Interim Guidance: Return to Sports
annotation: This web page, updated on September 18, 2020, provides new guidance for pediatricians to inform families on how to mitigate risk and prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2 to others both within sport and within families and the community.

title: Breastfeeding Guidance Post Hospital Discharge for Mothers or Infants with Suspected or Confirmed SARS-Co V-2 Infection
annotation: This guidance, updated on September 18, 2020, was developed to support pediatricians providing direct care for breastfeeding families after discharge from the newborn hospital stay during the COVID-19 pandemic. Post-discharge guidance and education are essential to support families, ensure the health of mothers and infants, and ensure mothers are able to reach their breastfeeding goals.

title: Public Health Webinar Series on Blood Disorders: Update on COVID-19 and Thrombosis Risk
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: Participants in this one-hour webinar will learn to summarize the evidence from peer-reviewed publications of COVID-19-associated venous thromboembolism (VTE); describe proposed mechanisms by which COVID-19 may increase the risk for VTE; and recount the latest guidelines for preventing VTE in patients who are hospitalized for COVID-19.
authors: Garcia, David; Sanfilippo, Kristen; Cukor, Adam

title: Advancing the Response to COVID-19: Sharing Promising Programs and Practices for Racial and Ethnic Minority Communities
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: The Health and Human Services Office of Minority Health (OMH) hosted this virtual symposium to highlight state, tribal, territorial, and community-based efforts to address COVID-19 among racial and ethnic minority and American Indian and Alaska Native populations. It featured national, state, tribal and local experts leading efforts developed for public health leaders at all levels and community organizations confronting the pandemic.
authors: Azar, Alex; Collins, Felicia; Giroir, Brett; Liburd, Leandris; Adams, Jerome

title: REMOVE: Guidance on Removing Hazardous Substances
annotation: This web page provides guidance that is designed to help people respond safely to incidents involving hazardous substances, including acid attacks.

title: Testing and Treatment of 2020-2021 Seasonal Influenza During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Center for Preparedness and Response
annotation: Speakers in this one-hour, 18-minute Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) call provide an overview of CDC’s recommendations for health care providers regarding influenza diagnostics and the use of antiviral medications for the 2020-2021 influenza season, including considerations during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Campbell, Angela; Uyeki, Timothy
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2020/COCA-Call-Slides_091720_Final.pdf

title: Age Groups that Sustain Resurging COVID-19 Epidemics in the United States
annotation: This 32-page report discusses how adults aged 20-49 are a main driver of the COVID-19 epidemic in the United States; yet, in areas with resurging epidemics, opening schools will lead to more COVID-19-attributable deaths, so more targeted interventions in the 20-49 age group could bring epidemics under control, avert deaths, and facilitate the safe reopening of schools.
authors: Monod, Melodie; Blenkinsop, Alexandra; Xi, Xiaoyue; Hebert, Daniel; Bershan, Sivan
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.imperial.ac.uk/media/imperial-college/medicine/mrc-gida/2020-09-17-COVID19-Report-32.pdf

title: Baseline Projections of COVID-19 in the EU/EEA and the UK: Update
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 34-page report provides updated 30-day projections that illustrate potential future trends in COVID-19 transmission in the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) countries and the United Kingdom. They are presented with the inherent model assumptions and uncertainties.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/ECDC-30-day-projections-Sept-2020.pdf

title: Emergency Preparedness and Response Operations
annotation: This web page, updated on September 17, 2020, provides information about emergency response and recovery programs at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). It describes CMS actions on recent disasters and emergencies, and provides information about emergency preparedness, response, and recovery.

title: Personal Protective Equipment for SARS-CoV-2
annotation: This five-page document about types of personal protective equipment is for workers who may be expected to be in contact with known or potentially contagious clients or members of the public, or with exposure to SARS-CoV-2, during their jobs.
authors: Fuller, Thomas; Smith, Michele
access_notes: Link to Spanish version: https://aiha-assets.sfo2.digitaloceanspaces.com/AIHA/resources/Personal-Protective-Equipment-for-SARS-CoV-2-White-Paper_Spanish.pdf

title: ASPR TRACIE (Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response/Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) Technical Assistance Request: Family Assistance Center (FAC) During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This three-page document from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources in response to a request for response plans and planning documents for establishing a family assistance center (FAC) during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Medical Supply Chains and Policy Options: The Data Challenge
annotation: This three-page report details the data from an annual government survey of U.S. manufacturers, analyzed in conjunction with official U.S. trade statistics, that provides some insight into domestic medical supply production activities, including personal protective equipment and pharmaceuticals, and a rough estimate of the share that some imported medical products make up in total U.S. supply.
authors: Schwarzenberg, Andres; Sutter, Karen

title: Evidence to Support Safe Return to Clinical Practice by Oral Health Professionals in Canada During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This report is a comprehensive knowledge product concerning key issues that inform the provision of oral health care by relevant providers in Canada during the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be updated several times over the course of 2020-2021.

title: Considerations for Infants and Toddlers During Disasters
annotation: This one-hour webinar features a discussion of the experiences of child care providers who have been impacted by emergencies, the ways Child Care Resource & Referral (CCR&R) agencies support their work, and the concrete steps agencies and child care providers can take to address the safety and wellbeing of infants and toddlers in emergencies.
authors: Coats, Julie Looper; Nett, Holly; Ritter, Jillian
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: Avoiding Barriers to Access for a COVID-19 Vaccine
source: Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health
annotation: In this one-hour, four-minute webinar, leaders and scientists in the international vaccine field discuss the barriers to vaccine access that must be overcome and avoided, and the role the international community will play in promoting equity in delivering a COVID-19 vaccine.
authors: Kim, Jerome; Bar-Zeev, Naor
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://www.jhsph.edu/ivac/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Presentation_Barriers-to-Vaccine-Access.pdf

title: Engaging Community Health Workers to Support Home-Based Care for People with COVID-19 in Low-Resource Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides suggestions for how Community Health Workers (CHWs) can support home-based care in low resource settings, including different actions CHWs can implement to support patients, their families, and their communities during COVID-19, and how to identify which people are eligible for home-based care.

title: Emergency Shelters in Disaster Response in Global, Low Resource Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides suggestions to assist disaster response shelter management and staff in taking appropriate actions for reducing the possibility of COVID-19 virus spread among shelter staff, volunteers, residents, and visitors before, during, or after a disaster.

title: Frequently Asked Questions: Calculating Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) RT-PCR Laboratory Test Percent Positivity
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page answers frequently asked questions about calculating severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) RT-PCR laboratory test percent positivity, including how a high percent positivity can be reduced.

title: Healthcare Workers: N95 and Other Respirators
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page describes N95 and other respirators, and how to learn strategies to optimize supplies of N95 respirators when supply is limited.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Visby Medical COVID-19
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Visby Medical COVID-19. The Visby Medical COVID-19 is authorized for use with nasopharyngeal, nasal, or mid-turbinate swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142227/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142225/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142228/download

title: Review of Coronavirus Response Efforts
annotation: This three-hour, 12-minute Congressional hearing features witnesses who discuss the Department of Health and Human Services’ ongoing response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and address how each of their agencies and offices are harnessing innovation to prevent, diagnose, and treat the novel coronavirus SARs-CoV-2.
authors: Blunt, Roy; Redfield, Robert; Kadlec, Robert; Giroir, Brett

title: From the Factory to the Frontlines: The Operation Warp Speed Strategy for Distributing a COVID-19 Vaccine
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: This 11-page report to Congress details a strategy to achieve the principal purpose and objective of Operation Warp Speed (OWS): ensuring that every American who wants to receive a COVID-19 vaccine can receive one, by delivering safe and effective vaccine doses to the American people beginning January 2021.
access_notes: Link to COVID-19 Vaccine Distribution Process Infographic: https://media.defense.gov/2020/Sep/16/2002498504/-1/-1/1/OWS-VACCINE-DISTRIBUTION-GRAPHIC.pdf

title: COVID-19 Vaccination Program Interim Playbook for Jurisdiction Operations
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This 57-page document serves as an interim playbook for state, territorial, and local public health programs and their partners on how to plan and operationalize a vaccination response to COVID-19 within their jurisdictions. The document’s sections cover specific areas of COVID-19 vaccination program planning and implementation, and provide key guidance documents and links to resources to assist those efforts.

title: Ten Clinical Tips on COVID-19 for Healthcare Providers Involved in Patient Care
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on September 16, 2020, provides 10 clinical steps on COVID-19 for healthcare providers regarding Treatment and Prophylaxis, Symptoms and Diagnosis, Co-Infections, and Severe Illness.

title: Homelessness and COVID-19 FAQs
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on September 16, 2020, provides answers to frequently asked questions about homeless and COVID-19, including about protection, shelters, and encampments.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/faqs.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/faqs.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/faqs.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/faqs.html

title: Continuity Resources and Technical Assistance: Federation Continuity Directives 1 and 2
source: Federal Emergency Management Agency [Department of Homeland Security]
annotation: This web page, updated in September 2020, provides information about FEMA’s National Continuity Programs, which provide outreach and technical assistance to whole community partners across the nation.
access_notes: Direct link to Federal Continuity Directive 1: https://www.fema.gov/media-library-data/1486472423990-f640b42b9073d78693795bb7da4a7af2/January2017FCD1.pdfDirect link to Federal Continuity Directive 2: https://www.fema.gov/media-library-data/1499702987348-c8eb5e5746bfc5a7a3cb954039df7fc2/FCD-2June132017.pdfDirect link to Continuity Risk Toolkit: https://www.fema.gov/media-library-data/1517503126676-1047d362dc8eb1bcaf92316879061b92/ContinuityRiskToolkit.pdf

title: Coronavirus Lessons Summary (2020)
annotation: This web page provides links to Coronavirus Rapid Lesson Sharing Reports, starting in June 2020.

title: ASPR TRACIE (Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response/Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) Technical Assistance Request: Pediatric Infectious Disease Surge in Long-Term Care Facilities
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This six-page document from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides a list of resources in response to a request to conduct a literature search on pediatric surge of infectious disease at long-term care (LTC) facilities.

title: COVID-19 in Pregnancy: Clinical, Research and Therapeutics Updates Virtual Workshop
annotation: This five-hour, 47-minute workshop brings together experts in the field to discuss the progress and challenges in obstetric therapeutic research and patient care, share experiences in clinical management of pregnant women and newborns with COVID-19, and explore effective approaches to obstetric therapeutics during the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Link to recording: https://videocast.nih.gov/watch=38459

title: COVID-19 Testing Strategies and Objectives
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 22-page document outlines strategies and objectives for sustainable SARS-CoV-2 testing of populations to achieve specific public health objectives in various epidemiological situations. General population-wide testing, as well as targeted testing of individuals, or specific populations related to particular settings, are presented on the basis of country experiences and information collected from scientific literature.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/TestingStrategy_Objective-Sept-2020.pdfLink to related infographic:  https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/publications-data/infographic-objectives-covid-19-testing-strategies

title: SARS-CoV-2 Reference Panel Comparative Data
annotation: The FDA has published comparative performance data for some authorized COVID-19 molecular diagnostic tests. The tables show the Limit of Detection (LoD) of more than 55 authorized molecular diagnostic COVID-19 tests against a standardized sample panel provided by the FDA. The FDA provided these standardized samples, known as a reference panel, to test developers who are required to assess their test’s performance against this panel (or other FDA-recommended reference materials) as a condition of their Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

title: Universal Screening for SARS‐CoV‐2 Infection: A Rapid Review
annotation: This 75-page report details a rapid review to assess the effectiveness of universal screening for SARS‐CoV‐2 infection compared with no screening, and the accuracy of universal screening in people who have not presented to clinical care for symptoms of COVID‐19.
authors: Viswanathan, Meera; Kahwati, Leila; Jahn, Beate; Giger, Kayla; Dobrescu, Andreea
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013718/epdf/fullLink to abstract in Spanish: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013718/full/es#CD013718-abs-0003

title: Telehealth and Health Equity: Considerations for Addressing Health Disparities during the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Center for Preparedness and Response
annotation: In this one-hour, six-minute Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) webinar, presenters discuss the intersection of telehealth and health equity and implications for health services during the COVID-19 pandemic. They identify long-standing systemic health and social inequities that contribute to COVID-19 health disparities, while highlighting opportunities and limitations of telehealth implementation as an actionable solution.
authors: Liburd, Leandris; McDow, Kendra; Alli, Kemi
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2020/2_COCA_Call-Slides_091520_Final.pdf

title: Indicators for Dynamic School Decision-Making
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides indicators to help schools make dynamic decisions about in-person learning as local conditions evolve throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. When coupled with local data about community spread, these indicators are an important tool to help local health officials, school administrators, and communities prepare, plan, and respond to COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/indicators.html

title: Estimating Under-Ascertainment of COVID-19 Mortality: An Analysis of Novel Data Sources to Provide Insight into COVID-19 Dynamics in Damascus, Syria
annotation: This 46-page report estimates the potential under-ascertainment of COVID-19 mortality in Damascus, Syria, where all-cause mortality data has been reported between July 25 and August 1, 2020. It fits a mathematical model of COVID-19 transmission to reported COVID-19 deaths in Damascus since the beginning of the pandemic and compares the model-predicted deaths to reported excess deaths.
authors: Watson, Oliver; Alhaffar, Mervat; Mehchy, Zaki; Whittaker, Charles; Akil, Zack
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.imperial.ac.uk/media/imperial-college/medicine/mrc-gida/15-09-2020-COVID19-Report-31.pdf

title: Practice Reopening Guidance
annotation: This web page, updated on September 15, 2020, provides guidance for physicians who are considering re-opening their practices during the COVID-19 pandemic. It includes a Checklist to Support Reopening and Promote Safety.

title: Operational Considerations for Personal Protective Equipment in the Context of Global Supply Shortages for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Pandemic: Non-US Healthcare Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on September 15, 2020, provides specific operational considerations that healthcare settings and healthcare authorities can review in the context of global supply shortages of personal protective equipment (PPE), to help with decision-making in order to provide needed surge capacity during the COVID-19 response.

title: Infectious Diseases Society of America Guidelines on the Treatment and Management of Patients with COVID-19: Part 1
annotation: This web page, updated on September 15, 2020, provides evidence-based rapid guidelines intended to support patients, clinicians, and other healthcare professionals in their decisions about treatment and management of patients with COVID-19. The guideline panel agreed on seven treatment recommendations, and provided narrative summaries of other treatments undergoing evaluations.
authors: Bhimraj, Adarsh; Morgan, Rebecca; Shumaker, Amy Hirsch; Lavergne, Valery; Baden, Lindsey
access_notes: Link to Part 2: Infection Protection: https://www.idsociety.org/practice-guideline/covid-19-guideline-infection-prevention/Link to Part 3: Diagnostics: https://www.idsociety.org/practice-guideline/covid-19-guideline-diagnostics/Link to Part 4: Serology: https://www.idsociety.org/practice-guideline/covid-19-guideline-serology/

title: Management of Visitors to Healthcare Facilities in the Context of COVID-19: Non-US Healthcare Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on September 15, 2020, provides guidance to healthcare facilities on the management of visitors to reduce the risk of transmission of SARS-CoV-2, also known as COVID-19 virus, to visitors of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19.

title: Loneliness Among Older Adults Before and During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: The University of Michigan National Poll on Healthy Aging (NPHA) asked a national sample of U.S. adults age 50–80 about lack of companionship and isolation (loneliness), social interactions, and health behaviors in June 2020. This was a follow-up to a similar NPHA survey conducted in October 2018 among a different national sample. The comparisons that follow show a substantial increase in loneliness among older adults from before the COVID-19 pandemic to the period March–June 2020.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: MAGLUMI 2019-nCoV IgM/IgG
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the MAGLUMI 2019-nCoV IgM/IgG. The MAGLUMI 2019-nCoV IgM/IgG is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and serum in separating gel tubes (SST).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142232/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142230/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142233/download

title: WHO SAGE (Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization) Values Framework for the Allocation and Prioritization of COVID-19 Vaccination
annotation: This 14-page Values Framework offers guidance globally on the allocation of COVID-19 vaccines between countries, and guidance nationally on the prioritization of groups for vaccination within countries while supply is limited. It has been endorsed by the Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization (SAGE).

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: cobas SARS-CoV-2 & Influenza A/B Nucleic Acid Test for use on the cobas Liat System
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the cobas SARS-CoV-2 & Influenza A/B Nucleic Acid Test for use on the cobas Liat System. Testing is to be conducted on specimens from individuals suspected of respiratory viral infection consistent with COVID-19 by a healthcare provider. Symptoms of respiratory viral infection due to SARS-CoV-2 and influenza can be similar.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/142192/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/142190/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/142193/download

title: World in Disorder: Global Preparedness Monitoring Board Annual Report 2020
annotation: This 52-page annual report provides a harsh assessment of the global COVID-19 response, warning that the world cannot afford to be unprepared again when the next pandemic hits. The Global Preparedness Monitoring Board calls for five urgent actions to be taken to bring order out of the catastrophe and chaos currently facing the world: responsible leadership; engaged citizenship; strong and agile systems for health security; sustained investment; and robust global governance of preparedness.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AR_2020_EN.pdfLink to executive summary in Arabic: https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AWID_ES_2020_AR.pdfLink to executive summary in Chinese: https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AWID_ES_2020_ZH.pdfLink to executive summary in French: https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AWID_ES_2020_FR.pdfLink to executive summary in Russian: https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AWID_ES_2020_RU.pdfLink to executive summary in Spanish: https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AWID_ES_2020_ES.pdf

title: Topic Collection: Behavioral Health Compendium
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This interagency TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) product, compiled by ASPR's Behavioral Health Team and the Division of Recovery, was designed to help regional emergency coordinators and federal and state planners support stakeholders in various areas of COVID-19 response and recovery. It features sections on steady state programs, grants, impacted HHS programs, online resources and training, waivers and flexibilities, and data sources, all of which include behavioral health components.

title: Public Health Preparedness: Information on the Use of Medical Reserve Corps Volunteers during Emergencies
annotation: This 32-page report describes the number and type of Medical Reserve Corps volunteers; the types of public health emergencies volunteers have participated in; and how the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has assisted in developing volunteer capabilities.
authors: Denigan-Macauley, Mary
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/709350.pdf

title: Considerations for School-Related Public Health Measures in the Context of COVID-19
annotation: This 10-page document, updated on September 14, 2020, provides considerations for decision-makers and educators on how or when to reopen or close schools in the context of COVID-19. These decisions have important implications for children, parents or caregivers, teachers, and other staff, communities, and society at large.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1303058/retrieve

title: Guidance for Alternative Care Provision During COVID-19
