annotation: This 16-page toolkit from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) is a compilation of considerations for long-term care facilities based on lessons learned during the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic, accompanied by resources to inform planning and response efforts.

title: Understanding and Responding to Global Health Security Risks from Microbial Threats in the Arctic
annotation: This 84-page publication summarizes the presentation and discussion of a workshop held in November 2019 that examined case studies such as the specific case of Arctic region anthrax outbreaks, as a known, observed risk, as well as other types of human and animal microbial health risks that have been discovered in snow, ice, or permafrost environments, or that could conceivably exist.

title: Framework for Assessing Mortality and Morbidity After Large-Scale Disasters
annotation: This 208-page report reviews and describes the current state of the field of disaster-related mortality and significant morbidity assessment. It examines practices and methods for data collection, recording, sharing, and use across state, local, tribal, and territorial stakeholders; evaluates best practices; and identifies areas for future resource investment.

title: Understanding Compliance with OSHA’s Respiratory Protection Standard During the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Pandemic
source: Occupational Safety and Health Administration [U.S. Department of Labor]
annotation: The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has had an unprecedented impact on the availability of respirators and fit-testing supplies. This two-page document is intended to help employers understand and comply with OSHA’s temporary enforcement guidance for the Respiratory Protection standard.

title: ASHP Principles for COVID-19 Vaccine Distribution, Allocation, and Mass Immunization
annotation: This four-page document offers 10 principles for COVID-19 vaccine development, distribution, allocation, mass vaccination, monitoring, and surveillance.

title: Caring for Children and Youth With Special Health Care Needs During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page discusses the overall approach to minimizing the risk of infection while meeting the ongoing needs of children and youth with special health care needs during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Contagion Externality of a Superspreading Event: The Sturgis Motorcycle Rally and COVID-19
annotation: Between August 7 and 16, 2020, nearly 500,000 motorcycle enthusiasts converged on Sturgis, South Dakota, for its annual motorcycle rally. Large crowds, coupled with minimal mask-wearing and social distancing by attendees, raised concerns that this event could serve as a COVID-19 “super-spreader.”  This 63-page study is the first to explore the impact of this event on social distancing and the spread of  COVID-19.
authors: Dave, Dhaval; Friedson, Andrew; McNichols, Drew; Sabia, Joseph

title: COVID-19 Information Metrics for Response Leadership's Decision Making: Guidance in Non-U.S. Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page aims to provide critical COVID-19 information metrics by technical area that response leaders in non-U.S. settings can request to aid in informing COVID-19 response decisions. It includes a set of core metrics within 10 technical areas for response leaders to help monitor response progress and guide decision making.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: MobileDetect Bio BCC19 Test Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the MobileDetect Bio BCC19 Test Kit. The MobileDetect Bio BCC19 Test Kit is authorized for use with certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141790/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141788/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141791/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Kaira 2019-nCoV Detection Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Kaira 2019-nCoV Detection Kit. The Kaira 2019-nCoV Detection Kit is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141794/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141792/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141795/download

title: Conversations on COVID-19: Impacts on Communities of Color
source: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine
annotation: This web page provides videos of conversations with experts on a variety of topics related to minority health and COVID-19, as well as information and resources from the National Academies on topics related to health equity.

title: Aid and Health Worker Safety and Security in the Context of the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This six-page document provides an overview of developments that have affected the safety and security of aid and health workers in the first half of 2020 and in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Occupational Health and Safety for Health Workers in the Context of COVID-19
annotation: Participants in this course will learn to describe the most common occupational risks to health and safety to which health workers are exposed while responding to the COVID-19 pandemic; describe the rights of health workers to decent working conditions; describe how to apply measures for protecting their health and safety and actively propose improvements; and access and use supportive services for protection of health and safety of health workers.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: Federal Medical Stations: Training from the Strategic National Stockpile for the COVID-19 Response
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This web page provides a list of videos from the Strategic National Stockpile that are designed to assist in the assembly and/or operation of key components and equipment in the Federal Medical Station deployment cache.

title: What to Do if a Student Becomes Sick at School or Reports a New COVID-19 Diagnosis Flowchart
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This one-page flowchart details what to do if a student becomes sick at school, reports a new COVID-19 diagnosis, or tests positive or negative.
access_notes: Link to web page with more information: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/student-becomes-sick-diagnosis-flowchart.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/student-becomes-sick-diagnosis-flowchart.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/student-becomes-sick-diagnosis-flowchart.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/student-becomes-sick-diagnosis-flowchart.html

title: Overlooked and Undercounted: The Growing Impact of COVID-19 on Assisted Living Facilities
annotation: This analysis examines the impact of COVID-19 on assisted living facilities, as well as changes over time, using state-level data on COVID-19 cases and deaths reported in early June 2020, and again in early August.
authors: True, Sarah; Ochieng, Nancy; Cubanski, Juliette; Chidambaram, Priya; Neuman, Tricia

title: Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children (MIS-C) Interim Guidance
annotation: This web page, updated on September 1, 2020, provides answers to questions, and guidance for clinicians about multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children (MIS-C), including when to perform testing for MIS-C and what sort of testing to start with in the outpatient or emergency room setting.

title: Surveillance and Studies in a Pandemic in Europe
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 19-page report is a summary of Surveillance and Studies in a Pandemic in Europe, including early detection, investigation, early assessment, monitoring, and investigation of the effectiveness of countermeasures.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/media/en/publications/Publications/0906_TER_Surveillance_and_Studies_in_a_Pandemic_in_Europe.pdf

title: Internal Displacement 2020: Mid-Year Update
annotation: This 60-page report reveals the most significant new internal displacements associated with conflict, violence, and disasters around the world between January and June 2020. It serves as an important temperature gauge of global displacement halfway through the year, looking ahead to the trends and patterns expected in the months to come.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.internal-displacement.org/sites/default/files/publications/documents/2020%20Mid-year%20update.pdfLink to chapter on Impacts of Covid-19 on iDPs: https://www.internal-displacement.org/sites/default/files/publications/documents/2020%20Mid-year%20update.pdf#page=41 Link to Mid-Year Figures, January to June 2019: https://www.internal-displacement.org/sites/default/files/inline-files/2019-mid-year-figures_for%20website%20upload.pdf

title: UK (United Kingdom) Recovery Handbook for Chemical Incidents
annotation: This 600-page book, updated on September 1, 2020, was designed to help manage the recovery phase of a chemical incident where contamination has affected food production systems, inhabited areas, and water environments.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/912808/UKRHCI_2019_Update_v1.1__2_.pdfLink to Disaster Lit record for Chemical Recovery Guidance and Tools: User Guide: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:17955Link to Disaster Lit record for Chemical Recovery Record Form: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:15073Link to Disaster Lit record for Chemical Recovery Navigation Tool: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:9656

title: Curriculum Recommendations for Disaster Health Professionals
source: National Center for Disaster Medicine and Public Health [Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences]
annotation: This 48-page document, updated in September 2020, was created with the intent to provide a framework upon which to build disaster behavioral health curricula, and compile and give access to up-to-date, credible resources to support such curricula. It is intended for use by those developing and delivering disaster behavioral health training, as well as community leaders, policymakers, and others seeking to better understand the behavioral health impacts of disasters on individuals and communities.  It includes a table for COVID-19 Special Section: Behavioral Health Resources.
authors: Flynn, Brian; Vance, Mary; Morganstein, Joshua

title: Response to the Ebola Virus Disease in the Eastern of the Democratic Republic of Congo
source: Enhancing Learning and Research for Humanitarian Assistance
annotation: This 27-page report summarizes a study called “Humanizing the design of the Ebola response in DRC: Anthropological research on humane designs of Ebola treatment and care to build trust for better health,” which examined how humane designs of treatment and care at Ebola Treatment Centers (ETCs) influence the formation of trust into the response to the Ebola virus disease epidemic in Democratic Republic of Congo.
authors: Morisho, Nene; Park, Sung-Joon; Kalubi, Josepha; Lubula, Mumbere
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.elrha.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/2020-Elhra-Report_ENGL.pdfLink to report in French: https://www.elrha.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/2020-rapport-ELHRA.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: TBG SARS-CoV-2 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the TBG SARS-CoV-2 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Kit. The TBG SARS-CoV-2 IgG/IgM Rapid Test Kit is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma (Acid Citrate Dextrose -ACD).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141772/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141770/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141773/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: COVID-19 ELISA pan-Ig Antibody Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the COVID-19 ELISA pan-Ig Antibody Test. The COVID-19 ELISA pan-Ig Antibody Test is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141776/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141774/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141777/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: T2SARS-CoV-2 Panel
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the T2SARS-CoV-2 Panel. The T2SARS-CoV-2 Panel is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141754/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141752/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141755/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: MiraDx SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the MiraDx SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141758/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141756/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141760/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: SARS-CoV-2 DETECTR Reagent Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the SARS-CoV-2 DETECTR Reagent Kit. The SARS-CoV-2 DETECTR Reagent Kit is authorized for use with upper respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141764/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141762/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141765/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: BayCare SARS-CoV-2 RT PCR Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the BayCare SARS-CoV-2 RT PCR Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The BayCare SARS-CoV-2 RT PCR Assay is authorized for use on nasopharyngeal swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141768/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141766/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141769/download

title: COVID-19: Brief Update on Initial Federal Response to the Pandemic
annotation: This 44-page report examines federal spending on the COVID-19 response; indicators for monitoring public health and the economy; and the status of matters for congressional consideration and recommendations from GAO’s June 2020 report.
authors: Clowers, A. Nicole
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/709033.pdf

title: Reducing the Risk  of COVID-19 Using  Engineering Controls
annotation: This seven-page document provides details about the recommendations of the American Industrial Hygiene Association (AIHA) and its volunteer committees of industrial hygienists for the use of engineering controls in all indoor workplaces, even those outside of the health care industry, to reduce the spread of COVID-19.

title: FAQ: Should Antibiotic Therapy be Continued in Patients Diagnosed with COVID-19?
annotation: This three-page fact sheet provides information about the ability to streamline and de-escalate empiric antibiotic therapy and why it remains a challenge for antimicrobial stewardship programs. This challenge is further complicated by the ongoing pandemic and increased concern for COVID-19 infection, especially in light of reported mortality rates associated with severe disease presentation.

title: Public Health Assessment Training
source: Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry
annotation: This training provides the basics to conduct a public health assessment, consisting of six modules based on a realistic environmental health case study, problem-solving exercises, and comprehensive resources and references to conduct public health assessments. Modules 7 and 8 are under construction.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: ASPR TRACIE (Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response/Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) Technical Assistance Request: Home Infusion Pharmacy Resources
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This three-page document from TRACIE responds to a request for Emergency Operations Plans (EOPs) for home infusion pharmacies, and provides related resources.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: PCL SARS-CoV-2 Real-Time RT-PCR Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the PCL SARS-CoV-2 Real-Time RT-PCR Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141664/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141662/downloadLink to EUA Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141665/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: DxTerity SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR CE Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the DxTerity SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR CE Test. The DxTerity SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR CE Test is authorized for use with saliva specimens collected from individuals consistent with the Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141668/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141666/downloadLink to Instructions for Use (Home Collect): https://www.fda.gov/media/141670/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141669/download

title: Opioid Overdose
annotation: This fact sheet provides information about opioid overdose, including risk factors for opioid overdose, emergency responses to opioid overdose, and prevention of opioid overdose.

title: Rights in a Pandemic: Lockdowns, Rights and Lessons from HIV in the Early Response to COVID-19
annotation: This 76-page report outlines 10 immediate areas for action for governments toward building effective, rights-based COVID-19 responses. These include taking proactive measures to ensure that people, particularly people in vulnerable groups, can access HIV treatment and prevention services; designating and supporting essential workers, including community-led organizations; and implementing measures to prevent and address gender-based violence.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.unaids.org/sites/default/files/media_asset/rights-in-a-pandemic_en.pdf

title: Health Conditions and an Older Population Increase COVID-19 Risks in Rural America
annotation: This eight-page brief discusses the likely influence that the age structure and the incidence of pre-existing health conditions have on the risks of those exposed to COVID-19 in rural and urban counties in the United States.
authors: Johnson, Kenneth
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://scholars.unh.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1415&context=carsey

title: Airborne Transmission of SARS-CoV-2: A Virtual Workshop
source: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine
annotation: This Environmental Health Matters Initiative (EHMI) workshop, held on August 26-27, 2020, delves into the rapidly evolving science on the spread of the SAR-CoV-2 virus, as part of a larger body of COVID-19 related work at the National Academies. It features experts in aerosol science, virology, infectious disease, and epidemiology. This page provides videos and materials from the workshop.

title: Promoting Mask-Wearing During the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Policymaker's Guide
annotation: This 18-page document draws on scientific evidence from the COVID-19 pandemic and from prior public health research on behavior change, with the purpose of empowering governments to measure face mask use in their jurisdictions and promote widespread adoption of masks in the general population. Annexes to the report, infographics, and press releases are included in the related playbook.
access_notes: Link to Mask Guidance Playbook: https://preventepidemics.org/covid19/resources/mask-playbook/

title: Pulse Survey on Continuity of Essential Health Services During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: The Pulse survey on continuity of essential health services during the COVID-19 pandemic aimed to gain initial insight from country key informants into the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on essential health services across the life course. The survey results in this 29-page interim report can improve understanding of the extent of disruptions across all services, the reasons for disruptions, and the mitigation strategies countries are using to maintain service delivery.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1297631/retrieve

title: Responsible Official Resource Manual
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Center for Preparedness and Response
annotation: This guidance from the Division of Select Agents and Toxins, updated on August 27, 2020, is for the responsible official (RO) for select agents, the individual designated by the registered entity with the authority and responsibility to act on behalf of the entity to ensure compliance with Section 9 of the select agent regulations. It describes the ore responsibilities of and criteria to be the RO.

title: Guidance on the Necessary Use of Telehealth During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page provides guidance on the use of telehealth to provide health care for children and adolescents during the COVID-19 pandemic. Use of telehealth should be based on the medical condition; preferences of the patients, families, and provider; and resources available.

title: Health Care and Health Care Financing for COVID-19 in Correctional Facilities
source: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine
annotation: This one-hour, 31-minute webinar discusses sick call and long-term care for COVID-19 patients in correctional facilities, protection of medically vulnerable people in correctional facilities, and opportunities for expansion of Medicaid coverage for correctional populations.
authors: Clarke, Jennifer; Wachino, Vikki; Williams, Brie

title: Caring for Children With Acute Illness in the Ambulatory Care Setting During the Public Health Emergency
annotation: This interim guidance helps pediatricians through the unprecedented challenges of caring for acutely ill children during the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic. The value of pediatric expertise within the medical home for all children, especially vulnerable children with special health care needs, should be emphasized.

title: Rapid, Point‐of‐Care Antigen and Molecular‐Based Tests for Diagnosis of SARS‐CoV‐2 Infection
annotation: This report assesses the diagnostic accuracy of point‐of‐care antigen and molecular‐based tests to determine if a person presenting in the community or in primary or secondary care has current SARS‐CoV‐2 infection.
authors: Dinnes, Jacqueline; Deeks, Jonathan; Adriano, Ada; Berhane, Sarah; Davenport, Clare
access_notes: Link to report in French: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013705/full/fr#CD013705-abs-0003

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: BinaxNOW™ COVID-19 Ag Card
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the BinaxNOW™ COVID-19 Ag Card. The BinaxNOW™ COVID-19 Ag Card is authorized for use using nasal swab specimens collected from individuals who are suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider within the first seven days of the onset of symptoms.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141569/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141567/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141570/download

title: U.S. Blood Supply and the COVID-19 Response: In Brief
annotation: This 19-page report, updated on August 26, 2020, provides a brief background of the regulatory framework for the U.S. blood supply, explains the federal response to the current crisis, and discusses potential treatment of COVID-19 using blood-derived products.
authors: Sussman, Jared; Dabrowska, Agata

title: Emergency Preparedness Tips for Those with Functional Needs
annotation: This 26-page document is a tool for caregivers and healthcare providers to help assist those with functional needs prepare for an emergency or disaster situation. Included are tips regarding what items to have on hand such as extra batteries for devices and medications, as well as guidelines for making an emergency plan. A template for an emergency health information card is provided at the end of the document.

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Preparing K-12 School Administrators for a Safe Return to School in Fall 2020
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This guidance, updated on August 26, 2020, is intended to aid school administrators as they consider how to protect the health, safety, and well-being of students, teachers, other school staff, their families, and communities, and prepare for educating students this fall, with key COVID-19 considerations listed.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/prepare-safe-return.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/prepare-safe-return.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/prepare-safe-return.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/prepare-safe-return.html

title: FAQs on Diagnostic Testing for SARS-CoV-2
annotation: This web page, updated regularly, provides answers to frequently asked questions relating to the development and performance of tests for SARS-CoV-2.

title: Adolescent Mental Health During COVID-19
source: Association of State and Territorial Health Officials
annotation: This one-hour webinar discusses the challenges that COVID-19 has created for youth mental health, shares lessons learned from a program that supports youth released from a detention center, and shares strategies that state health officials can implement to support and advocate for youth and adolescents with mental health needs both during and beyond the pandemic.
authors: Howdershelt, Marissa; Hsi, Andrew; Kimball, Angela

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Tell Me Fast Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) IgG/IgM AntibodyTest
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Tell Me Fast Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) IgG/IgM Antibody Test. The Tell Me Fast Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) IgG/IgM Antibody Test is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum, plasma (Lithium-Heparin, Sodium-Citrate and Acid Citrate Dextrose (ACD)) and venous whole blood (Lithium-Heparin, Sodium-Citrate and Dipotassium EDTA).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141549/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141547/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141550/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Advanta Dx SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Advanta Dx SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay. The Advanta Dx SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Assay is authorized for use with saliva specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141540/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141538/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141541/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: QDx Pathology Services – QDx SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the QDx SARS CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The QDx SARS CoV-2 Assay is authorized for use on nasal swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141544/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141542/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141545/downloadLink to Instructions for Use - Home Collect: https://www.fda.gov/media/141546/download

title: Novel H1N1 Flu (Swine Flu) Public Service Announcements (PSAs)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This Web page contains PSAs about preventing the spread of H1N1 influenza in script, MP3, and some as podcasts.

title: COVID-19 Essential Supplies Forecasting Tool
annotation: This 13-page document provides technical details and methodological explanations on the structure of the COVID-19 Essential Supplies Forecasting Tool (ESFT). It is intended  to provide information that will allow users to a) trace and understand the calculations, assumptions, and limitations of ESFT; and b) modify these assumptions for different contexts or use cases.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333983/WHO-2019-nCoV-Tools-Essential_forecasting-Overview-2020.1-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=yLink to resource in French: https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/336007Link to resource in Spanish: https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/335942Link to document in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333983/WHO-2019-nCoV-Tools-Essential_forecasting-Overview-2020.1-rus.pdf?sequence=5&isAllowed=y

title: Promoting Public Health Measures in Response to COVID-19 on Cargo Ships and Fishing Vessels
annotation: This 10-page document provides guidance for shipowners, seafarers, unions and associations, and competent authorities for health and transport on protecting seafarers working on cargo ships and fishing vessels from transmission of SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19) and management of COVID-19.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1297150/retrieve

title: Information for Healthcare Professionals about Coronavirus (COVID-19)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 25, 2020, provides information, tools, and guidance about COVID-19 for healthcare professionals, including about Care for Patients, Protect Patients and Workers, and Facility Guidance. The page has been updated to organize content for simplified navigation and includes a search function to allow users to more easily find information and resources.

title: Responding to the Needs of Youth Involved With the Justice System During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: The COVID-19 pandemic presents unique challenges to the health and well-being of youth involved with the justice system. This web page, updated on August 25, 2020, provides recommendations for juvenile justice agencies.

title: COVID-19 Management in Hotels and Other Entities of the Accommodation Sector
annotation: This eight-page document, updated on August 25, 2020, is designed to cover hotels and other accommodation facilities of all sizes, including campsites, operating in the time of the current COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1297222/retrieveLink to Q&A: Staying at hotels and accommodation establishments and COVID-19: https://www.who.int/news-room/q-a-detail/q-a-staying-at-hotels-and-accommodation-establishments-and-covid-19Link to Q&A: Working in hotels and COVID-19: https://www.who.int/news-room/q-a-detail/q-a-working-in-hotels-and-covid-19Link to Guidance from April 30, 2020: Operational considerations for COVID-19 management in the accommodation sector: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/331937/WHO-2019-nCoV-Hotels-2020.2-eng.pdf

title: State and Territory Policy Strategies Supporting Maternal and Child Health During COVID-19
annotation: In June and July of 2020, the National Governors Association Center for Best Practices (NGA Center) surveyed executive branch officials regarding state policies to safeguard against COVID-19 for pregnant women, postpartum women, and infants. This web page provides the results of the survey.
access_notes: Link to results in a PDF file: https://www.nga.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Maternal_Child_Health_COVID-19.pdf

title: Nursing Home Strategies for COVID-19 Only Isolation of COVID-19 Residents
annotation: This five-page document highlights specific actions that certain states have already taken to better support the nursing facilities’ ability to safely care for all residents, including COVID-19-positive residents, during this public health emergency, and how enhanced nursing facility payment supported those efforts.

title: Pooled Sample Testing and Screening Testing for COVID-19
annotation: This web page provides an overview of available resources related to SARS-CoV-2 screening testing and testing using pooled samples.

title: SNS (Strategic National Stockpile)-Held Ventilator Resources
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This web page provides training on the use of ventilator models held in the Strategic National Stockpile.
access_notes: Link to Ventilator Training Alliance App: https://vta.allego.com/home.do Link to SNS-held Ventilator Maintenance: https://www.phe.gov/emergency/events/COVID19/SNS/ventilators/Pages/default.aspx

title: CDC 2019-nCoV Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: The lots of N1, N2, and RP primers and probes on this one-page document have passed functional testing at CDC and may be used with the CDC 2019-nCoV Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel Instructions for Use under CDC’s Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

title: Compounding Activities: COVID-19
annotation: This web page provides guidance to states and compounders on issues associated with compounding drugs during the COVID-19 pandemic. The guidance aims to protect patients from unsafe, ineffective and poor-quality compounded drugs, while preserving access for patients.

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Nursing Homes and Long-Term Care Facilities
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides COVID-19 guidance for nursing homes and long-term care facilities, with topics covering Infection Control Guidance, SARS-CoV-2 Testing Guidance, Infection Control Assessment Tool, Training Resources, and Videos for Training Front Line Long-Term Care Staff.

title: COVID-19 Partner Update Call: Health and Safety at the Polling Place
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: Speakers in this 48-minute presentation share updates on the CDC’s COVID-19 response, including the latest scientific information and what everyone should know about protecting themselves and others; and review the CDC’s updated considerations for election polling locations and voters.
authors: McDonald, Clifford; Kirby, Amy; Hall, Diane

title: Providing Care and Treatment for People Living with HIV in Low-Resource Non-US Settings During COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page offers operational considerations and guidance for maintaining essential HIV services in low-resource settings in the context of COVID-19.

title: Communicable Disease Threats to Public Health in the European Union
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 13-page report covers the events and threats detected by the ECDC epidemic intelligence (EI) team in 2019 and the actions taken in relation to these findings. In 2019, 306 new events were monitored and discussed at the daily round table meeting.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/AER_for_2019_threats.docx.pdf

title: HIPAA and COVID-19
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: The HHS Office for Civil Rights (OCR) has provided these Bulletins, Notifications of Enforcement Discretion, Guidance, and Resources that help explain how patient health information may be used and disclosed in response to the COVID-19 nationwide public health emergency, including under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). This page was updated on August 24, 2020.

title: Interim Additional Guidance for Infection Prevention and Control Recommendations for Patients with Suspected or Confirmed COVID-19 in Outpatient Hemodialysis Facilities
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This information, updated on August 24, 2020, is provided to clarify COVID-19 infection prevention and control (IPC) recommendations that are specific to outpatient hemodialysis facilities. This information complements, but does not replace, the general IPC recommendations for COVID-19. As part of routine infection control, outpatient dialysis facilities should have established policies and practices to reduce the spread of contagious respiratory pathogens, which are listed on this page.
access_notes: Link to Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Outpatient Dialysis Facility Preparedness Assessment Tool: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/COVID-19-outpatient-dialysis.pdf Link to Frontline Staff Toolkit: Tips for Outpatient Hemodialysis Facilities During COVID-19: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/dialysis.html#anchor_1588604087

title: Disaster Behavioral Health
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This resource collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange), updated on August 24, 2020, can help stakeholders incorporate disaster behavioral health (DBH) into all phases of emergency management to ensure resident and responder preparedness; an effective, compassionate response effort; and a more resilient community moving forward. Resource categories are Topic Collections; Other ASPR TRACIE-Developed DBH Resources; ASPR At-Risk Individuals, Behavioral Health, and Community Resilience Resources; and Other Federal Resources.

title: Prevention of Targeted Violence and Terrorism Against Public Health Personnel and Assets
annotation: This memorandum provides guidance in topics that cover Actions for Governors to Protect Public Health Personnel and Assets; Overview of Key Strategies for Preventing Targeted Violence; Coordinate Protection Activities to Address Immediate Threats; and Buy Down Long-term Risk by Mitigating Motivations to Violence and Strengthening the Social Fabric.
access_notes: Link to memorandum in a PDF file: https://www.nga.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NGA-Memo-on-TVTP-for-PH-Assets.pdf

title: Elastomeric Half-Mask Respirators and Powered Air-Purifying Respirators in Healthcare and Emergency Medical Service Settings
source: Federal Emergency Management Agency [Department of Homeland Security]
annotation: This eight-page fact sheet provides useful information for healthcare and emergency medical service organizations regarding re-usable, National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH)- approved elastomeric half-mask respirators (EHMRs) and powered air-purifying respirators (PAPRs) to expand options to meet respiratory protection demand.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) of COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma for Treatment of COVID-19 in Hospitalized Patients
annotation: This five-page fact sheet provides information for healthcare providers about the Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) to permit the emergency use of the unapproved product COVID-19 convalescent plasma to treat hospitalized  patients with  COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to Providers Fact Sheet in Chinese: https://www.fda.gov/media/141983/downloadLink to Providers Fact Sheet in Korean: https://www.fda.gov/media/141981/downloadLink to Providers Fact Sheet in Spanish: https://www.fda.gov/media/141978/downloadLink to Providers Fact Sheet in Tagalog: https://www.fda.gov/media/141979/downloadLink to Providers Fact Sheet in Vietnamese: https://www.fda.gov/media/141982/downloadLink to Fact Sheet for Patients and Parents/Caregivers: https://www.fda.gov/media/141479/downloadLink to Patients Fact Sheet in Chinese: https://www.fda.gov/media/141983/downloadLink to Patients Fact Sheet in Korean: https://www.fda.gov/media/141987/downloadLink to Patients Fact Sheet in Spanish: https://www.fda.gov/media/141984/downloadLink to Patients Fact Sheet in Tagalog: https://www.fda.gov/media/141985/downloadLink to Patients Fact Sheet in Vietnamese: https://www.fda.gov/media/141986/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141477/downloadLink to Decision Memorandum: https://www.fda.gov/media/141480/downloadLink to EUA Request: https://www.fda.gov/media/141481/download

title: COVID-19 Guidance for Shared or Congregate Housing
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides guidance that was created to help owners, administrators, or operators of shared (also called “congregate”) housing facilities – working together with residents, staff, and public health officials – prevent the spread of COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/shared-congregate-house/guidance-shared-congregate-housing.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/shared-congregate-house/guidance-shared-congregate-housing.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/shared-congregate-house/guidance-shared-congregate-housing.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/shared-congregate-house/guidance-shared-congregate-housing.html

title: Effective and Safe  Practices, Guidance for  Custodians, Cleaning, and Maintenance Staff
annotation: This 14-page document provides cleaning and disinfection guidance for custodians, cleaning, and maintenance staff to reduce transmission of COVID-19 within workplaces.
access_notes: Link to document in Spanish: https://aiha-assets.sfo2.digitaloceanspaces.com/AIHA/resources/Effective-and-Safe-Practices-Guidance-for-Custodians-Cleaning-and-Maintenance-Staff-Guidance-Document_Spanish.pdf

title: Future of Emergency Medicine – The Pandemic Factor
annotation: This summit, held in July 2020, brought together leaders across the College to discuss the future of emergency medicine and pandemics in four main areas: people (workforce), patients, practice, and payment.

title: Environmental Health: Air Pollution, COVID-19 and Health Disparities
source: National Institute for Health Care Management Foundation
annotation: This one-hour, five-minute webinar explores how the environmental justice movement can address air pollution, health disparities, and COVID-19, and offers solutions to improve health outcomes. Speakers discuss what contributes to air pollution, how environmental injustice has been highlighted during COVID-19, and how neighborhoods experiencing environmental injustice face poorer air quality and extreme heat while also bearing the brunt of this pandemic.
authors: Lee, Charles; Hoffman, Jeremy; Stewart, Valerie; Williams, Josie

title: Exploration of COVID-19 Health-Care Worker Cases: Implications for Action
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for the Western Pacific
annotation: This four-page guidance describes a system to detect healthcare worker COVID-19 cases, investigate avenues of infections, and guide appropriate responses at the facility and public health levels based on the investigation findings. It is intended for national and sub-national public health authorities and healthcare facility managers.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333945/WPR-DSE-2020-027-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: CDC COVID-19 Response Health Equity Strategy: Accelerating Progress Towards Reducing COVID-19 Disparities and Achieving Health Equity
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page details the CDC’s COVID-19 Response Health Equity Strategy, which broadly seeks to improve the health outcomes of populations disproportionately affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The population health impact of COVID-19 has exposed long-standing inequities that have systematically undermined the physical, social, economic, and emotional health of racial and ethnic minority populations and other population groups that are bearing a disproportionate burden of COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/cdc-strategy.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/cdc-strategy.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/cdc-strategy.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/cdc-strategy.html

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Guardant-19 Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Guardant-19 test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141486/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141484/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141487/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: DxTerity SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the DxTerity SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test. he DxTerity SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test is authorized for use with saliva specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141490/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141488/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141491/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS) SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS) SARS-CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141495/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141493/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141496/download

title: Protective Barrier Enclosures Without Negative Pressure Used During the COVID-19 Pandemic May Increase Risk to Patients and Health Care Providers
annotation: This letter alerts health care providers (HCP) and health care facilities that the use of passive protective barrier enclosures (those without negative pressure) when treating patients who are known or suspected to have coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) may pose an increased health risk to patients and HCPs, and provides recommendations.

title: Advice on the Use of Masks for Children in the Community in the Context of COVID-19
annotation: This nine-page document, co-published with UNICEF, provides guidance to decision-makers, the public, and child health professionals to inform policy on the use of masks for children in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. It does not address the use of masks for adults working with children or parents/guardians or the use of masks for children in healthcare settings.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1296520/retrieve

title: Preventing the Spread of COVID-19 in Correctional Facilities
source: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine
annotation: Jails and prisons are epicenters of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States. This one-hour, 33-minute webinar discusses preventing new cases, testing, and contract tracing in correctional facilities; vaccine distribution; and best practices for decarceration.
authors: Chambers-Smith, Annette; Kariko, Sara; Puglisi, Lisa; Venters, Homer; Western, Bruce

title: Strengthening Nursing Home Policy for the Post-Pandemic World: How Can We Improve Residents’ Health Outcomes and Experiences?
annotation: This report assesses how nursing home policies might be strengthened to improve health outcomes and experiences for residents, and improve the work environment for staff post-COVID-19 pandemic. It provides a number of possible nursing home reform options to better protect nursing home residents and the individuals who care for them.
authors: Grabowski, David
access_notes: Link to report in a PDF file: https://www.commonwealthfund.org/sites/default/files/2020-08/Grabowski_strengthening_nursing_home_policy_postpandemic_ib.pdf

title: Dilemma Facing America’s Schools During COVID-19
annotation: Speakers in this one-hour webinar discuss the daunting choices facing school leaders this fall as they navigate the conflict between community health and the learning needs of students during the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Beutner, Austin; Bleich, Sara; Oxtoby, David

title: Considerations for School Nurses in Return to School: Dental Screening
annotation: This four-page document provides a summary of currently available resources about dental screening that school nurses can consult as they formulate independent nursing judgment for their practice or when participating in policy discussions in their districts.

title: Nursing’s Role in Health Equity, Public Health Emergencies, and COVID-19
annotation: This one-hour, 30-minute webinar features speakers from the study on the Future of Nursing 2020-2030 who share updates on the study’s status and sought public input on nurses’ roles in responding to COVID-19. A panel of experts also discusses how nursing can advance health equity, the role of nurses in public health emergencies, and nurses’ experiences on the frontlines of COVID-19.
authors: Dzau, Victor; Hassmiller, Susan; Cooper, Lisa; Qureshi, Kristine; Baez, Frank

title: 2020-2021 Influenza Vaccination Recommendations and Clinical Guidance during the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: Presenters in this one-hour Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) call discuss updates to the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) recommendations for the 2020-2021 influenza vaccination season. Topics include the Standards for Adult Immunization Practice, flu vaccination planning, general vaccination guidance during the COVID-19 pandemic, and guidance for large vaccination clinics held in satellite, temporary, or off-site locations.
authors: Grohskopf, Lisa ; Jalaoui, Tara; Fiebelkorn, Amy
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2020/COCA_Call_Slides_08_20_20_final.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Personnel: Nova2200 for Decontaminating Compatible N95 Respirators
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare personnel of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of decontaminated, compatible N95 respirators. These compatible N95 respirators have been decontaminated with the Nova2200 using the NovaClean decontamination process.
access_notes: Link to Instructions for Healthcare Facilities: https://www.fda.gov/media/141384/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Personnel: https://www.fda.gov/media/141385/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141382/downloadLink to Instructions for Decontamination Personnel: https://www.fda.gov/media/141386/download

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Clinical Mitigation (Non-US Settings)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides resources about clinical mitigation, which encompasses strategies to ensure adequate provision of care for mildly to moderately ill COVID-19 patients, and delivery of other non-COVID-19 essential health services during the COVID-19 outbreak.

title: Federal/Provincial/Territorial Public Health Response Plan for Ongoing Management of COVID-19
annotation: The purpose of this plan is to provide federal, provincial, and territorial public health officials; Indigenous partners; health system partners; and other stakeholders with a common forward planning approach for ongoing management of COVID-19 in Canada. It promotes a long-term approach that covers immediate planning imperatives for the fall/winter 2020 period and thereafter until population herd immunity in one form or another is sufficient to bring the pandemic activity in Canada to an end.
access_notes: Link to plan in a PDF file: https://www.canada.ca/content/dam/phac-aspc/documents/services/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-infection/federal-provincial-territorial-public-health-response-plan-ongoing-management-covid-19/fpt-response-plan-english.pdf

title: E4GDH (Evidence for Global and Disaster Health) and HBS (Health and Biosciences Libraries) Webinar: Librarians Supporting Humanitarian Information Efforts
source: International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions
annotation: This 64-minute webinar highlights two outlets in which librarians are key players in humanitarian information efforts: OpenStreetMap mapping to create a free editable map of the world, and the Evidence Aid COVID-19 Evidence Collection, which contains summaries of high-quality systematic reviews related to the impact of COVID-19.
authors: McGowan, Bethany; Wood, Jo

title: Advances in Science and Technology in the Life Sciences
annotation: This 36-page report summarizes several trends facilitating advances across the life sciences: immunology, neuroscience, human genetics and reproductive science, agriculture, and infectious disease. Though research and development in these fields is by and large conducted for peaceful purposes in order to benefit society, the same outputs can pose serious ethical, safety, and security concerns if they are misused.
authors: Warmbrod, Kelsey; Revill, James; Connell, Nancy
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.unidir.org/sites/default/files/2020-08/Advances%20in%20Science%20and%20Technology%20in%20the%20Life%20Sciences%20-%20Final.pdf

title: Protecting Building Engineering and Maintenance Staff from COVID-19
source: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine
annotation: This one-hour, three-minute webinar discusses protecting building engineering and maintenance staff from COVID-19. While many people are working remotely, the staff who keep facilities functioning must generally be on-site to do their jobs - telework is not an option.
authors: Boles, Corey; Krause, David

title: Well-Being of Underserved Populations during COVID-19 Crisis
source: National Center for Disaster Medicine and Public Health [Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences]
annotation: This one-hour webinar explores the physical and mental well-being of vulnerable populations during the COVID-19 crisis. Trusted experts in public health, behavioral health, social work, and indigenous science address many of the conditions and situations underserved populations have encountered during COVID-19.
authors: Quintanilla, Norma; Wolfe, Elizabeth; Flores, Noemi; Blanchard, Paulette; Patterson, Jacqueline

title: CDC Webinar – Strengthening Vaccine Confidence in Pediatric and Family Practice Offices During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: Participants in this one-hour webinar will learn to describe trends in vaccine hesitancy among American parents; describe the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)’s Vaccinate with Confidence framework; identify strategies for reducing vaccine hesitancy and addressing vaccine myths; describe CDC guidance for immunization during the COVID-19 pandemic, including strategies for ensuring safe well-visits; and locate CDC communication resources for providers and parents.
authors: Schillie, Sarah; MacNeil, Jessica
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: Considerations for Quarantine of Contacts of COVID-19 Cases
annotation: This six-page document is an update of COVID-19 interim guidance published on March 19, 2020. It provides updated guidance for the implementation of quarantine, as well as additional guidance on ventilation and on the care of children in quarantine.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333901/WHO-2019-nCoV-IHR_Quarantine-2020.3-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=yLink to document in Arabic: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333901/WHO-2019-nCoV-IHR_Quarantine-2020.3-ara.pdf?sequence=5&isAllowed=yLink to document in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333901/WHO-2019-nCoV-IHR_Quarantine-2020.3-rus.pdf?sequence=10&isAllowed=y

title: Employee Health and Food Safety Checklist for Human and Animal Food Operations During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) are providing this 16-page checklist for FDA-regulated human and animal food operations to use when assessing operations during the COVID-19 pandemic, especially when re-starting operations after a shutdown or when reassessing operations because of changes due to the COVID-19 public health emergency.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/141141/download

title: Rescission of Guidances and Other Informal Issuances Concerning Premarket Review of Laboratory Developed Tests
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: The Department of Health and Human Services has determined that the Food and Drug Administration will not require premarket review of laboratory developed tests absent notice-and-comment rulemaking, as opposed to through guidance documents, compliance manuals, website statements, or other informal issuances.

title: Operational Considerations for Community Isolation Centers for COVID-19 in Low-Resource Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides operational considerations for CDC Country Offices, Ministries of Health, and partners about establishing and operating community isolation centers (CICs) for people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are remaining in the CIC voluntarily, and ensuring that people in CICs are safe and have access to adequate healthcare, food, water, sanitation, and hygiene products and services.

title: IS-806
source: Federal Emergency Management Agency [Department of Homeland Security]
annotation: This 30 minute course provides an overview of one of the 15 Emergency Support Functions (ESFs).  This course introduces ESF #6 - Mass Care, Emergency Assistance, Housing, and Human Services. At the end of this course, users will be able to: describe the overall purpose and scope of ESF #6; identify the types of supplemental assistance ESF #6 provides to individuals and state, tribal, and local governments; identify typical activities accomplished by ESF #6 resources and teams; and describe the types of partnerships formed between ESF #6 and other response agencies and organizations.

title: Interim Framework for COVID-19 Vaccine Allocation and Distribution in the United States
source: Center for Health Security [Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health]
annotation: This 46-page document provides an ethical framework to guide discussion and inform decisions about COVID-19 vaccine allocation. It compares the implications of the framework to the prior Centers for Disease Control and Prevention guidance for prioritization of pandemic influenza vaccine allocation, and suggests candidate groups who should be given serious consideration for inclusion in the top allocation tier when vaccine availability is limited and in a second tier (those also prioritized before the general public) if/when more vaccine supply becomes available.
authors: Toner, Eric; Barnill, Anne; Krubiner, Carleigh; Bernstein, Justin; Privor-Dunn, Lois
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.centerforhealthsecurity.org/our-work/pubs_archive/pubs-pdfs/2020/200819-vaccine-allocation.pdfLink to Q&A with author: https://www.jhsph.edu/covid-19/articles/interim-framework-for-covid-19-vaccine-allocation-in-the-united-states.html

title: Population-Wide Testing of SARS-CoV-2: Country Experiences and Potential Approaches in the EU/EEA and the United Kingdom
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 12-page document summarizes country experiences and perspectives relating to the objective and application of different population-wide SARS-CoV-2 testing approaches and discusses the options in the context of the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/covid-19-population-wide-testing-country-experiences.pdf

title: COVID-19 Planning Considerations: Guidance for School Re-Entry
annotation: The purpose of this guidance, updated on August 16, 2020, is to support education, public health, local leadership, and pediatricians collaborating with schools in creating policies for school re-entry during the COVID-19 pandemic that foster the overall health of children, adolescents, staff, and communities, and are based on available evidence.

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Using Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 19, 2020, details who needs to use personal protective equipment (PPE), and how to put it on and take it off. The updated guidance adds a statement about the importance of the selected respirator and eye protection not interfering with the correct fit or function of the other, and removes a second hand hygiene step from step 6 in How to Put On (Don) PPE Gear.
access_notes: Scroll down for infographics and video.

title: Considerations for Quarantine of Individuals in the Context of Containment for Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)
annotation: The purpose of this six-page document, updated on August 19, 2020, is to offer guidance to Member States on quarantine measures for individuals in the context of COVID-19. It provides updated guidance for the implementation of quarantine, as well as additional guidance on ventilation and on the care of children in quarantine.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1296389/retrieveLink to document in Arabic: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/331299/WHO-2019-nCov-IHR_Quarantine-2020.1-ara.pdfLink to document in Chinese: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/331299/WHO-2019-nCov-IHR_Quarantine-2020.1-chi.pdfLink to document in French: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/331364/WHO-2019-nCov-IHR_Quarantine-2020.1-fre.pdf

title: Digital Contact Tracing Technologies in Epidemics: A Rapid Review
annotation: This report assesses the benefits, harms, and acceptability of personal digital contact tracing solutions for identifying contacts of an identified positive case of an infectious disease. Digital technology could be implemented to augment and accelerate manual contact tracing.
authors: Anglemyer, Andrew; Moore, Theresa; Parker, Lisa; Chambers, Timothy; Grady, Alice
access_notes: Link to report in Arabic: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013699/full/fa#CD013699-abs-0004Link to report in French: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013699/full/fr#CD013699-abs-0006Link to report in Spanish: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013699/full/es#CD013699-abs-0009

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: LumiraDx SARS-CoV-2 Antigen (Ag) Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the LumiraDx SARS-CoV-2 Antigen (Ag) Test. The LumiraDx SARS-CoV-2 Ag Test is authorized for use using nasal swab specimens collected from individuals who are suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider within the first 12 days of the onset of symptoms.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141303/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141301/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141304/download

title: 2020 Survey of America's Physicians: COVID-19 Impact Edition
annotation: Part One of The Physicians Foundation’s Survey of America’s Physicians: COVID-19 Impact Edition focuses on how the coronavirus has affected physicians’ practices and their patients. Among the findings in this 20-page report is that nearly 50 percent of physicians believe the coronavirus pandemic will not be under control until sometime after June 1, 2021.
access_notes: Direct link to document: http://physiciansfoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/20-1278-Merritt-Hawkins-2020-Physicians-Foundation-Survey.6.pdf

title: Considerations for Selecting Respirators for Your Health Care Facility
annotation: This flowchart and the information on this web page illustrate which Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) applies to specific respirator types, and provide links to information on performance factors for each type to consider when selecting respirators for use in health care facilities in the United States.
access_notes: Direct link to flowchart: https://www.fda.gov/media/141263/download

title: Manufacturing and Distributing Respirators for Health Care Use in the United States Under an Existing Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This flowchart provides information on manufacturing and distributing respirators for health care use in the United States under an existing emergency use authorization (EUA) during the COVID-19 public health emergency. It also provides links to detailed information provided by the FDA, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH).
access_notes: Direct link to flowchart: https://www.fda.gov/media/141261/download

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Action Guide: Wearing Masks as a COVID-19 Community Mitigation Strategy
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This action guide is developed to help evaluators, program implementers, and policymakers monitor and evaluate wearing masks as a COVID-19 community mitigation strategy. It is not meant for healthcare settings. The guide provides practical considerations and examples of evaluation questions, indicators, and data sources.

title: Master Question List for COVID-19 (Caused by SARS-CoV-2)
annotation: This Master Question List (MQL), updated on August 18, 2020, is intended to quickly present the current state of available information to government decision-makers in the operational response to COVID-19, and allow structured and scientifically guided discussions across the federal government without burdening them with the need to review scientific reports, and to prevent duplication of efforts by highlighting and coordinating research.  This document is a “living document” that will be updated as needed when new information becomes available.

title: COVID-19 and People with Disabilities in Canada
annotation: This web page discusses some of the factors that may make a person with a disability more at risk of acquiring COVID-19 or progressing to more severe COVID-19 infection, other than age and underlying chronic condition, and how to protect people with disabilities from COVID-19.

title: ASPR TRACIE (Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response/Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) Technical Assistance Request: CMS Emerging Infectious Disease Terminology Requirements in Hazard Vulnerability Assessments
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This three-page document from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides resources in response to a requestor who asked if their healthcare facility needed to change their current terminology from “pandemic/ epidemic” to “emerging infectious diseases” (EID) in their Hazard Vulnerability Assessment (HVA) per the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Emergency Preparedness (EP) Rule.

title: Key Components for Continued COVID-19 Management for Dialysis Facilities
annotation: To assist in preventing the transmission of COVID-19 within the dialysis population, CMS is reinforcing this 11-page infection control guidance based upon the current Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommendations for dialysis facilities, which include screening for COVID-19, patient placement, personal protective equipment, isolation, cleaning, and disinfection.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cms.gov/files/document/qso-20-36-esrd.pdfLink to Checklist for Dialysis Facilities in COVID-19 Hotspots: https://www.cms.gov/files/document/checklist-dialysis-facilities-covid-19-hotspots.pdf

title: Enforcement Cases Held during the Prioritization Period and Revised Survey Prioritization
annotation: This nine-page document describes how the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services is revising guidance on the expansion of survey activities to authorize on site revisits and other survey types, and to State Survey Agencies (SAs) on resolving enforcement cases.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cms.gov/files/document/qso-20-35-all.pdf

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Diazyme DZ-Lite SARS-CoV-2 IgM CLIA Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Diazyme DZ-Lite SARS-CoV-2 IgM CLIA Kit. The Diazyme DZ-Lite SARS-CoV-2 IgM CLIA Kit is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum or plasma (potassium EDTA, disodium EDTA and lithium heparin).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141254/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141252/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141255/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: BioCheck SARS-CoV-2 IgG and IgM Combo Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the BioCheck SARS-CoV-2 IgG and IgM Combo Test. The BioCheck SARS-CoV-2 IgG and IgM Combo Test is authorized for the qualitative detection and differentiation of IgG and IgM antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141249/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141247/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141251/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: COVID-19 Nucleic Acid RT-PCR Test Kit
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the COVID-19 Nucleic Acid RT-PCR Test Kit. The COVID-19 Nucleic Acid RT-PCR Test Kit is authorized for use with upper respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141245/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141243/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141246/download

title: Racial Disparities in COVID-19
annotation: This brief summarizes key findings from data and analyses examining COVID-19-related cases, deaths, hospitalizations, and testing by race and ethnicity as of early August 2020 to provide increased insight into racial disparities.
authors: Artiga, Samantha; Corallo, Bradley; Pham, Olivia

title: Operational Considerations for Maintaining Essential Services and Providing Prevention, Care, and Treatment for Tuberculosis (TB) in Low-Resource non-US Settings During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page summarizes operational considerations to assist tuberculosis (TB) programs, health service managers, and healthcare personnel in maintaining continuity of essential TB services in low-resource, non-U.S. settings during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: National Wastewater Surveillance System (NWSS)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), in collaboration with agencies throughout the federal government, are initiating the National Wastewater Surveillance System (NWSS) in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The data generated by NWSS will help public health officials to better understand the extent of COVID-19 infections in communities.

title: EUA (Emergency Use Authorization) Authorized Serology Test Performance
annotation: This web page, updated on August 17, 2020, summarizes the expected performance of the COVID-19/SARS-CoV-2 serology tests the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has authorized based on the information FDA reviewed when deciding whether or not to grant these tests an Emergency Use Authorization. It also provides a calculator that will allow users to see the estimated performance of a single test or two independent tests based on their performance characteristics and the estimated prevalence of SARS-CoV-2 antibodies in the target population.
access_notes: Link to calculator: https://www.fda.gov/media/137612/download

title: Clinical Management of Patients with Moderate to Severe COVID-19: Second Interim Guidance
annotation: This guidance, updated on August 17, 2020, provides clinicians with interim advice on timely, effective, and safe supportive management of adult and pediatric patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19. It is not meant to replace clinical judgment or specialist consultation, but rather to strengthen the clinical management of these patients. Best practices for triage and optimized supportive care are included.
access_notes: Link to guidance in French: https://www.canada.ca/fr/sante-publique/services/maladies/2019-nouveau-coronavirus/professionnels-sante/prise-charge-clinique-covid19.html

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: SalivaDirect
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the SalivaDirect assay. The SalivaDirect assay is authorized for use with saliva specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141195/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141194/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141192/download

title: Guidance for General Laboratory Safety Practices During the COVID-19 Pandemic
