source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This guidance, updated on August 15, 2020, is to address the general workflow safety concerns of laboratory personnel during the COVID-19 pandemic, including guidance on social distancing, face coverings, and personal hygiene and disinfection. All laboratories should perform site- and activity-specific risk assessments to determine the most appropriate safety measures to implement for particular circumstances.

title: COVID-19 Toolkit: Information for Long-Term Care Facilities
annotation: This 51-page toolkit was created for long-term care facilities to implement measures to prevent and control disease spread in a facility, and to collect data that will help to track respiratory illness and COVID-19 in residents and staff.

title: Physician Liability for COVID-19 Testing
annotation: This web page provides a response to a public health physician's request seeking clarification of their duties in light of Michigan Governor Whitmer’s Emergency Declaration (Executive Order 2020-104) to increase COVID-19 testing, and if testing for COVID-19 establishes a physician-patient duty to patients for whom a physician orders or conducts a test.
authors: Jacobson, Peter

title: Issuing a COVID-19 Press Release That Identifies a Specific Location
annotation: This web page provides a response to a county health department's request seeking guidance on whether the department can issue a press release indicating that individuals who attended a party on a specific date at a specific address may have been exposed to COVID-19. There are no legal barriers to issuing the proposed press release. Instead, this is a policy question within the health department’s discretion.
authors: Jacobson, Peter

title: Study of the COVID-19 Outbreak and Response in Connecticut Long-Term Care Facilities
annotation: This 93-page report describes the impact of COVID-19 in Connecticut as a whole and in long-term care facilities compared with other states in the region and the country. It presents a preliminary assessment and interim recommendations for short-term changes Connecticut and industry can take to mitigate a potential second wave of COVID-19.
authors: Rowan, Patricia; Lester, Rebecca; Levere, Michael; Libersky, Jenna; Lipson, Debra

title: Community Health Centers and Medication-Assisted Treatment for Opioid Use Disorder
annotation: This issue brief presents findings from a 2019 survey of community health centers on activities related to the prevention and treatment of opioid use disorder, with a focus on medication-assisted treatment (MAT), to assess services and capacity prior to the recent surge in need.
authors: Corallo, Bradley; Tolbert, Jennifer; Sharac, Jessica; Markus, Anne; Rosenbaum, Sara

title: Medical Device Shortages During the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency
annotation: This web page provides an up-to-date list of the devices the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has determined to be in shortage during the COVID-19 pandemic. It also provides a list of medical devices for which the FDA has been notified that manufacturing has been permanently discontinued.

title: NETEC COVID-19 Webinar Series: Approach to Anticoagulation in COVID-19: Evidence and Practice Patterns
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: This 54-minute webinar articulates the pathophysiology of the hypercoagulable state seen in COVID-19 and discusses current evidence surrounding anticoagulation in COVID-19. Institutional practice patterns for anticoagulation are also discussed.
authors: Tennill, Trish; Gaddh, Manila; Pradhan, Deepak; Mukherjee, Vikram
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/1220661bf117f7c223ff49df98bbc921.pdf

title: Personal Protective Equipment EUAs
annotation: This web page provides information and documents about the Food and Drug Administration's issuing of Emergency Use Authorizations (EUAs) for certain personal protective equipment products, including face shields, other barriers, and respiratory protective devices such as respirators, during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: COVID-19 Emergency Legal Preparedness Primer
annotation: This primer, updated on August 14, 2020, provides key information on the public health emergency response to the COVID-19.  It includes information about a COVID-19 Epi Snapshot; International legal response efforts; and U.S. legal preparedness/response (including emergency declarations).
authors: Hodge, James G.

title: ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) National Network Learning Session: FEMA Perspective on Emergency Management, COVID-19 and People with Disabilities
source: ADA [Americans with Disabilities Act] National Network
annotation: This one-hour, 35-minute webinar provides an overview of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA)'s roles and responsibilities in the midst of COVID-19, how FEMA continued to serve people with disabilities during that response, and how it continued to plan and prepare for the 2020 natural disaster season in the midst of the pandemic.
authors: Lewis, Charlotte; Crawford, Roxann; Adler, Candice; Ahern, Edward; Gottesman, Jessica
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://www.adapresentations.org/doc/8_12_20/FEMA%20Perspective%20on%20Emergency%20Management,%20COVID-19%20and%20People%20with%20Disabilities.pdfLink to transcript: https://www.adapresentations.org/doc/8_12_20/Transcript%2008-13-20.pdf

title: COVID-19 Public Health and Economic Crises Leave Vulnerable Populations Exposed
annotation: This report uses a novel panel data set collected between March and July of 2020 to describe disparities in outcomes related to the COVID-19 pandemic across race/ethnicity and employment status. The evidence suggests a need for a more robust safety net, such as an expanded unemployment benefits program and more accessible public health insurance during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as more deliberate targeting of federal support to Black and Hispanic households.
authors: Grooms, Jevay; Ortega, Alberto; Rubalcaba, Joaquin

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Pro-AmpRT SARS-CoV-2 Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Pro-AmpRT SARS-CoV-2 Test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141148/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141146/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141149/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: REGIOCIT
annotation: This six-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers about REGIOCIT, which has been authorized for emergency use as a replacement solution in adult patients treated with Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy (CRRT), and for whom RCA is appropriate, during the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients and Caregivers: https://www.fda.gov/media/141172/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141168/downloadLink to Package Insert: https://www.fda.gov/media/141186/download

title: Epidemiological Alert: COVID-19 During Pregnancy
source: World Health Organization, Pan American Health Organization
annotation: This eight-page document details how the Pan American Health Organization/World Health Organization (PAHO/WHO) requests that Member States intensify efforts to ensure access to prenatal care services, as well as to implement preventive measures to reduce morbidity and mortality associated with COVID-19 across all levels of the health system, in order to maintain the commitment to reducing maternal and perinatal mortality and the progress achieved to date.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.paho.org/en/file/70317/download?token=G29wByLG

title: Progress on Drinking-Water, Sanitation and Hygiene in Schools
annotation: This 82-page report, co-published with UNICEF, details the latest data from the WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP), which reveal that 43 percent of schools around the world lacked access to basic hand-washing with soap and water in 2019 – a key condition for schools to be able to operate safely in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/wash-documents/progress-of-drinking-water-sanitation-and-hygiene-in-schools---special-focus-on-covid-19.pdf?sfvrsn=d5b40ebd_6&download=true

title: SARS-CoV-2 Infection and Transmission in Educational Settings
annotation: Public Health England initiated enhanced national surveillance following the reopening of educational settings during the summer mini-term on June 1, 2020. COVID-19-related situations in educational settings across England were reviewed daily and followed up until July 31, 2020. SARS-CoV-2 infection and outbreak rates were calculated for staff and students attending early year settings, primary, and secondary schools during June 2020. This 28-page report summarizes those findings.
authors: Ismail, Sharif; Saliba, Vanessa; Bernal, Jamie; Ramsey, Mary; Ladhani, Shamez

title: Considerations for Systematic Screening PK-12: Universal Screening for Internalizing and Externalizing Behaviors in the COVID-19 Era
source: Mental Health Technology Transfer Center Network
annotation: This one-hour, 33-minute webinar for educational leaders offers considerations for conducting systematic screenings for internalizing and externalizing behaviors in the COVID-19 era.
authors: Lane, Kathleen
access_notes: Link to recording: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-d5BNkrGRU&feature=youtu.beLink to presentation slides: https://mhttcnetwork.org/sites/default/files/2020-08/2020.8.12%20Screening_Lane%20MHTTC%20FINAL.pdf

title: Guidelines for Healthy In-Person Voting
annotation: The Brennan Center and the Infectious Diseases Society of America have issued these four-page joint guidelines to minimize the risk of transmitting COVID-19 at the polls this November.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.brennancenter.org/sites/default/files/2020-08/2020_08_Guide%20for%20Healthy%20In%20Person%20Voting_Finalv2.pdf

title: Epidemiological Alert: Complications and Sequelae of COVID-19
source: World Health Organization, Pan American Health Organization
annotation: Through this 16-page alert, the Pan American Health Organization/World Health Organization (PAHO/WHO) urges Member States to keep health professionals informed as new information continues to become available in order to strengthen the timely detection and proper management of COVID-19 cases, complications, and sequelae.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.paho.org/en/file/70246/download?token=Y4NGNdQv

title: Collaborating to Learn from Hurricanes
source: Natural Hazards Center [University of Colorado at Boulder]
annotation: This 32-minute webinar features the leaders of the National Science Foundation-supported Nearshore Extreme Events Reconnaissance (NEER) Association, which organizes interdisciplinary teams and supports travel for rapid, pre-event site characterization and instrument deployments to collect perishable data needed to understand impacts of major storms on the nearshore system.
authors: Raubenheimer, Britt; Chen, Qin Ben; Elgar, Steve; Michael, Holly; Moore, Laura

title: Interim Guidance: SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) and Field Trauma Triage Principles
source: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, Office of Emergency Medical Services
annotation: This three-page document provides a brief overview of how the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) impacts trauma triage for first responders, including Emergency Medical Service (EMS), fire and rescue, and law enforcement.

title: COVID-19 and Child Welfare: A Series of Virtual Meetings
annotation: This web page provides information and links for a webinar series that highlights state and federal policy responses to COVID-19 in the child welfare system. Sessions feature state legislators and legislative staff, National Conference of State Legislatures staff, and other experts.

title: Providing Medical Respite for People Experiencing Homelessness during COVID-19
source: Center for Health Care Strategies, Inc.
annotation: This one-hour, 31-minute webinar highlights the experiences and innovations of three medical respite centers in California and Washington State during COVID-19.  Presenters provide an overview of programs and share how their medical respite centers responded to COVID-19, including changes to structures, processes, and partners, as well as lessons for how to improve their services for people experiencing homelessness.
authors: Moses, Kathy; Dobbins, Julia; Bhalla, Pooja; Jeevanjee, Sara; Enzian, Leslie

title: Scramble for Vaccines and the COVAX Facility
source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
annotation: This one-hour video features a discussion on the ACT Accelerator’s COVAX Facility. COVAX has emerged as a promising, nascent, international initiative to develop and equitably distribute COVID-19 vaccines to benefit all countries.
authors: Gilbert, Nikolaj; Hoyt, Kendall; Lurie, Nicole; Morrison, J. Stephen; Hamburg, Margaret A.

title: Registration and Listing of Medical Devices during the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page provides information for medical device establishments, including owners and operators of places of business (also called facilities) that are involved in the production (e.g., manufacturing, assembling, or processing) and distribution of medical devices that are authorized by Emergency Use Authorizations (EUAs) or that are the subject of one of FDA’s COVID-19 guidance documents.

title: Importing Medical Devices During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page provides information on importing certain medical devices during the COVID-19 pandemic. It describes procedures for importing devices that have been issued Emergency Use Authorizations (EUAs) and for devices for which an enforcement discretion policy has been published in guidance.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Biomeme SARS-CoV-2 Real-Time RT-PCR Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Biomeme SARS-CoV-2 Real-Time RT-PCR Test. The Biomeme SARS-CoV-2 Real-Time RT-PCR Test is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141051/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141049/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141052/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: LumiraDx SARS-CoV-2 RNA STAR
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the LumiraDx SARS-CoV-2 RNA STAR. The LumiraDx SARS-CoV-2 RNA STAR test is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141056/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141054/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141057/download

title: Joseph Leiter NLM/MLA Lectureship: Digital Epidemiology and the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: National Library of Medicine [National Institutes of Health]
annotation: The Joseph Leiter NLM/MLA Lectureship was established in 1983 to stimulate intellectual liaison between the Medical Library Association (MLA) and the National Library of Medicine (NLM). The presenter in this one-hour lecture speaks on translation impact on the surveillance, control, and prevention of disease; the development and application of data mining; and citizen science to public health in relation to his work with the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Brownstein, John

title: COVID-19 Considerations for Labor and Delivery Patients
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: COVID-19-positive pregnant, birth, and labor and delivery patients should follow the specific, recommended infectious disease, screening/testing, and medical practice considerations on this web page.
access_notes: Link to related flyer: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/83496a89e330e33749d8cbaa7483e5ed.pdf

title: COVID-19 Clusters and Outbreaks in Occupational Settings in the EU/EEA and the UK
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The aim of this 17-page document is to describe COVID-19 clusters and outbreaks in the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK) linked to occupational settings, including healthcare and non-healthcare settings, and to identify possible factors contributing to transmission in these settings.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/COVID-19-in-occupational-settings.pdf

title: Disparities in the Risk and Outcomes of COVID-19
annotation: This 92-page document, updated on August 11, 2020, is a descriptive review of surveillance data on disparities in the risk and outcomes from COVID-19. The review looked at different factors, including age and sex, where people live, deprivation, ethnicity, people’s occupation, and care home residence.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/908434/Disparities_in_the_risk_and_outcomes_of_COVID_August_2020_update.pdfLink to data pack: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/889167/Disparities_risks_outcomes_of_COVID19_data_pack.ods

title: Coronavirus (COVID-19): Support for Well-being in the Healthcare Workforce
annotation: This report brings together Cochrane evidence on interventions that may help support the well-being of the healthcare workforce and reduce occupational stress during the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Report is available in German, Farsi, French, Japanese, Malay, Portuguese, Russian, and Spanish.

title: Joint Statement: Roadmap for Maintaining Essential Surgery during COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: The American Hospital Association, American College of Surgeons, American Society of Anesthesiologists, and Association of periOperative Registered Nurses, have released this updated joint statement that provides a list of principles and considerations to guide physicians, nurses, and hospitals and health systems during the COVID-19 pandemic as they provide essential care to their patients and communities, and seek to ensure ongoing preparation to meet patients’ needs for recommended essential procedures.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Alpha Genomix TaqPath SARS-CoV-2 Combo Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Alpha Genomix TaqPath SARS-CoV-2 Combo Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141020/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141017/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141021/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Solaris Multiplex SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Solaris Multiplex SARS-CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141015/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141013/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/141016/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Emergency Use of the Prismaflex HF20 Set During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This two-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Prismaflex HF20 Set to provide continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT) to treat low weight (8-20 kg) and low blood volume patients who have acute renal failure, fluid overload, or both, and who cannot tolerate a larger extracorporeal circuit volume in an acute care environment during the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/141033/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/141031/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/141034/download, and https://www.fda.gov/media/141035/download

title: Critical Role of Health Care Professionals During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This 58-minute speech discusses COVID-19, the Food and Drug Administration’s role in responding to this public health emergency, and the continuing challenges the agency and the medical profession face as it continues to evolve.
authors: Hahn, Stephen

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in the EU/EEA and the UK – Eleventh Update: Resurgence of Cases
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This 34-page update analyzes the risk of further escalation of COVID-19 in the countries that have reported a recent increase in COVID-19 cases, and the risk of further escalation of COVID-19 across all European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom (UK).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/covid-19-rapid-risk-assessment-20200810.pdf

title: Objectives for COVID-19 Testing in School Settings
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The aim of this four-page document is to provide an overview of major aspects of COVID-19 testing, contact tracing, contact identification, and contact follow-up in school settings within the European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom (UK).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/covid-19-objectives-school-testing.pdf

title: Criteria for Return to Work for Healthcare Personnel with SARS-CoV-2 Infection (Interim Guidance)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This guidance, updated on August 10, 2020, is for occupational health programs and public health officials making decisions about return to work for healthcare personnel (HCP) with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection, or who have suspected SARS-CoV-2 infection (e.g., developed symptoms of COVID-19) but were never tested for SARS-CoV-2. For HCP with severe to critical illness or who are severely immunocompromised, the recommended duration for work exclusion was changed to at least 10 days and up to 20 days after symptom onset.

title: Children and COVID-19: State-Level Data Report
annotation: The American Academy of Pediatrics is collecting and sharing all publicly available data from states on child COVID-19 cases. This web page, updated on August 10, 2020, provides state-level data on confirmed COVID-19 cases for children; detail varies substantially by state and by week.
access_notes: This web page is frequently updated.

title: Discontinuation of Transmission-Based Precautions and Disposition of Patients with COVID-19 in Healthcare Settings (Interim Guidance)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This guidance, updated on August 10, 2020, is a reference to guide healthcare personnel regarding discontinuing transmission-based precautions and discharging hospitalized patients with COVID-19. It includes updated guidance for a test-based strategy.

title: Contact Tracing: A Community Engagement Checklist for Health Departments
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: Health departments often collaborate with other organizations to improve the health and well-being of their community. This three-page document provides a list of tips for health departments when they are working with community organizations on contact tracing.

title: CDC/IDSA COVID-19 Clinician Call: Neurologic Manifestations in Patients with COVID-19
annotation: This one-hour webinar features speakers who discuss neurologic manifestations in patients with COVID-19, what is known and not known about the neurology of COVID-19, and several case scenarios.
authors: Wollins, Dana; Russman, Andrew; Sejvar, James

title: Project Firstline Training Modules
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: These training modules on infection control were designed with workers in healthcare facilities in mind, so regardless of workers' previous training or education, they will gain critical information from this training.

title: Law and Epidemic Emergency Preparedness (LEEP) Online Training
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This Law and Epidemic Emergency Preparedness (LEEP) training covers provisions and concepts applicable to epidemic response, including various challenges faced during the 2014 Ebola response, and applies them to future infectious disease emergency response planning. LEEP examines legal underpinnings of emergency preparedness and response systems, what actions are authorized, and how to minimize legal barriers to an effective large-scale communicable disease response.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.Unit 3 of this training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092660.Unit 4 of this training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092873.Unit 5 of this training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092874.Unit 8 of this training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092877.

title: COVID-19 and Dentistry: Challenges and Opportunities for Providing Safe Care
source: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality  [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This web page provides information and guidance for planning for the resumption of routine dental care during the COVID-19 pandemic, and finding creative ways to care for dental patients who are reluctant to come to the dental office for the foreseeable future.

title: Additional Expiration Date Extensions of Certain Lots of Doxycycline Hyclate 100 mg Capsules Held in Strategic Stockpiles
annotation: This three-page memorandum was written in response to a stakeholder request to extend the manufacturer labeled expiration date of five (5) lots of doxycycline hyclate 100 mg capsules manufactured by West-Ward Pharmaceuticals (West-Ward) that have been stockpiled for anthrax preparedness under the manufacturer labeled storage conditions.
access_notes: Link to Disaster Lit record for previous date extension: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:14828

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: GWU COVID-19 RT-PCR Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the GWU COVID-19 RT-PCR Test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140979/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140977/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140980/download

title: NETEC COVID-19 Webinar Series: Supply Management and Inventory Control During COVID-19 – Part Two
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: In this 56-minute webinar, participants discuss the principles of the Hospital Incident Command System (HICS) and other innovative approaches to assist with making informed decisions related to COVID-19 preparedness, mitigation, and response. Participants will learn how to articulate creative ways to manage reusable and disposable supplies and how to approach the need for substitution during the pandemic crisis.
authors: Vanairsdale, Sharon; Love, Kari; Spencer, Brian
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/34243d3a9fe410401150468e61b55255.pdf

title: Global Surveillance of COVID-19: WHO Process for Reporting Aggregated Data
annotation: This spreadsheet is for weekly reporting of new COVID-19 cases and aggregated data. It includes tabs for transmission classification per week at subnational level 1, and a data dictionary.

title: Public Health Surveillance for COVID-19
annotation: This 10-page document summarizes current WHO guidance for public health surveillance of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in humans caused by infection with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1291156/retrieve

title: COVID-19: HEALTH DEPARTMENTS COVID-19 Contact Tracing Training
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated August 7, 2020, provides a sample training plan, including training topics that may be helpful for state and local public health jurisdictions to consider when designing their own training plan for COVID-19 contact tracers. Each heading represents the learning objective for that section. Suggested training modalities/formats are provided, as well as information about sample existing trainings and resources.
access_notes: Link to Special Considerations for Health Departments: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/php/contact-tracing/contact-tracing-plan/special-considerations.html

title: Policy for Temporary Compounding of Certain Alcohol-Based Hand Sanitizer Product During the Public Health Emergency
annotation: This 19-page guidance, updated on August 7, 2020, communicates the FDA's policy for the temporary compounding of certain alcohol-based hand sanitizer products by pharmacists in state-licensed pharmacies or federal facilities and registered outsourcing facilities (referred to collectively in this guidance as compounders) for the duration of the COVID-19 public health emergency.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/136118/download

title: Topic Collection
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This Topic Collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange, updated on August 7, 2020, provides resources about utility failures, and include lessons learned from recent disasters, case studies, and toolkits designed to help healthcare planners prepare to respond to, continue functioning during, and recover from post-disaster utility failures. Resources are in categories that include Education and Training, Guidance, Lessons Learned, and Plans, Tools, and Templates.
access_notes: Link to resource from February 2017 in a PDF file: https://files.asprtracie.hhs.gov/documents/utility-failure.pdf

title: Topic Collection
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This Topic Collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange), updated on August 7, 2020, highlights key health and medical preparedness resources for natural disasters. The resources highlight lessons learned from recent events, communication tools and information, and checklists, plans, tools, and templates that can be modified to suit specific threats and needs. Articles in this Topic Collection address specific natural disasters and hazards and elements of their planning.

title: Topic Collection
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This Topic Collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange), updated on August 7, 2020, highlights key health and medical preparedness resources for Healthcare Facility Evacuation and Sheltering. The resources include plans, guidelines, lessons learned from recent events, and promising practices that can help healthcare facility staff develop evacuation and sheltering plans, and facilitate their training and exercise development.
access_notes: Link to PDF file of resources: https://files.asprtracie.hhs.gov/documents/healthcare-facility-evacuation-shelter.pdf

title: Respiratory Protection Resources in Long-Term Care
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This one-hour, 19-minute webinar presents information about respiratory protection resources in long-term care during the COVID-19 pandemic. Speakers define "respirator," discuss the hierarchy of controls, and discuss hazard assessment criteria.
authors: Gackle, Tim; Rogers, Bonnie; Casey, Megan; de Perio, Marie

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: VIDAS® SARS-COV-2 IgG
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the VIDAS® SARS-COV-2 IgG. The VIDAS® SARS-COV-2 IgG is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum or plasma (lithium heparin).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140936/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140934/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140937/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: VIDAS® SARS-COV-2 IgM
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the VIDAS® SARS-COV-2 IgM.  The VIDAS® SARS-COV-2 IgM is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum or plasma (lithium heparin).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140932/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140930/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140933/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Helix COVID-19 NGS Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Helix COVID-19 NGS Test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140916/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140914/downloadLink to EUA  Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140917/download

title: Veterans Health Administration’s Role During the COVID-19 Response
annotation: Within the context of the coronavirus pandemic, this brief examines the role of the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) during the COVID-19 public health emergencies and its capacity to support the broader community if called upon.
authors: McDermott, Daniel; Hudman, Julie; Cox, Cynthia

title: Could the President or Congress Enact a Nationwide Mask Mandate?
annotation: Several public officials have begun to call for a federal nationwide mask mandate to stem the tide of COVID-19 cases. This four-page document provides an overview of the relevant federal authority to issue such a mandate, as well as other legal considerations for Congress.
authors: Shen, Wen

title: Frequently Asked Questions about Coronavirus (COVID-19) for Laboratories
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides answers to frequently asked questions about COVID-19 for laboratories, in these categories: Accessing Laboratory Testing, General Guidance and Regulatory Requirements, Test Developers, Serology, Specimen Handling, Specimen Packing and Shipping, Specimen Types, Anatomic Pathology, Ordering Supplies (For Public Health Laboratories), and Ordering Supplies (For Clinical Laboratories).

title: COVID-19 in Children and the Role of School Settings in COVID-19 Transmission
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The aim of this 31-page document is to provide an overview of the epidemiology and disease characteristics of COVID-19 in children (0-18 years) in the European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom (UK), and an assessment of the role of childcare (preschools; ages 0-<5 years) and educational (primary and secondary schools; ages 5-18 years) settings in COVID-19 transmission.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/COVID-19-schools-transmission-August%202020.pdfLink to Related Infographic: COVID-19 in Children and the Role of Schools: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/publications-data/infographic-covid-19-children-and-role-schools

title: Do Americans Face Greater Mental Health and Economic Consequences from COVID-19?
annotation: This report illustrates COVID-19’s effects on people’s mental health and economic security, and compares levels of public trust in national leaders in responding to the pandemic in the United States and other countries.
authors: Williams II, Reginald; Shah, Arnav; Tikkanen, Roosa; Schneider, Eric; Doty, Michelle

title: Challenges to Safely Reopening K-12 Schools
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Oversight and Reform
annotation: This two-hour, eight-minute hearing of the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis features education and public health professionals who examine the challenges to safely reopening K-12 schools during the coronavirus pandemic, and the steps the federal government can take to help schools safely reopen in person and stay open.
authors: Clyburn, James; Duncan, Arne; Rivers, Caitlin; Skillings, Angela

title: COVAX Facility: Global Procurement for COVID-19 Vaccines
annotation: This six-page document provides information about the COVID-19 Vaccines Global Access (COVAX) Facility, where countries have the opportunity to benefit from a portfolio of vaccine candidates so that their populations can have early access to effective vaccines.
access_notes: Link to COVAX, the Act-Accelerator Vaccines Pillar: Insuring Accelerated Vaccine Development and Manufacture: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/act/covax-pillar-background.pdf?sfvrsn=b6d9a2a8_2&download=true

title: Assessment of Evidence for COVID-19-Related Treatments
annotation: The information in this 102-page evidence table, updated on August 6, 2020, is emerging and rapidly evolving because of ongoing research and is subject to the professional judgment and interpretation of the practitioner due to the uniqueness of each medical facility’s approach to the care of patients with COVID-19 and the needs of individual patients. This evidence table is provided to help practitioners better understand current approaches related to treatment and care.

title: Contact Tracing in the Context of COVID-19 Response
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: Participants in this course will learn to explain to decision makers the importance of contact tracing as public health measure in the context of COVID-19; adapt to the local context the processes of contact tracing for COVID-19; and identify ways to scale up contact tracing and reflect on how to adapt them to the local context.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.This training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092903.

title: Emergency Use of Authorized Disposable, Single-Use Surgical Masks During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This two-page fact sheet informs healthcare personnel of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of authorized disposable, single-use surgical masks during the COVID-19 pandemic. It is specific to surgical masks that were authorized by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) under an emergency use authorization (EUA).
access_notes: Link to Appendix A Authorized Surgical Masks: https://www.fda.gov/medical-devices/coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19-emergency-use-authorizations-medical-devices/personal-protective-equipment-euas#appendixasurgicalmasks

title: Legislative and Regulatory Steps for a National COVID-19 Testing Strategy
annotation: This 13-page report outlines legislative actions and federal appropriation targets that Duke-Margolis and its collaborating experts believe are needed to get a robust, diversified COVID-19 testing strategy in place for the nation by fall 2020.
authors: McClellan, Mark; Rivers, Caitlin; Silcox, Christina
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://healthpolicy.duke.edu/sites/default/files/2020-08/COVID%20testing%20legislative%20recs%208-6%20correction_WITH%20COVER%20V2%208-6-2020.pdf

title: Guidance for Influenza Vaccine Delivery in the Presence of COVID-19
annotation: This web page provides guidance for the delivery of seasonal influenza vaccine in fall 2020, when ongoing COVID-19 activity may continue to stress public health capacity and affect clinic operations and attendance.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: WANTAI SARS-CoV-2 Ab ELISA
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the WANTAI SARS-CoV-2 Ab ELISA. The WANTAI SARS-CoV-2 Ab ELISA is authorized for the detection of total antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 inhuman serum and Acid Citrate Dextrose (ACD) plasma.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140928/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140926/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140929/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: ViroKey™ SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the ViroKey™ SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test. The ViroKey™ SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR Test is authorized for use with certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140921/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140919/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140922/download

title: Ethical Issues in the Age of COVID-19: Part 1 of 2
annotation: This one-hour, 31-minute workshop looks at unique ethical challenges that have arisen in the age of COVID-19. Ethical issues include maintaining privacy, challenges in providing telehealth services, and working remotely; the need to use caution with digital communication is also explored.
authors: Sacco, James
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/alphtn/assets/08052020handouts.pdf

title: NETEC COVID-19 Webinar Series: Supply Management and Inventory Control During COVID-19 – Part One
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: In this 55-minute webinar, participants will foster effective team strategies to assist in problem-solving to collectively control inventory and supply chain needs during the coronavirus pandemic; integrate approaches for optimizing personal protective equipment supply when caring for patients with COVID-19, including CAPRs/ PAPRs, masks, face shields, and other essential supplies; and discuss options for product substitution while maintaining a safe clinical environment as derived from case-based scenarios.
authors: Vanairsdale, Sharon; White, Bethany; Arguinchona, Christa; Maharaj, John; Tennill, Trish
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/68201dc38aa9c032a12151769cdebbff.pdf

title: Physician Guide to Keeping Your Practice Open During COVID-19
annotation: This six-page checklist was developed for physicians to ensure that their medical practice is ready for reopening and is well-situated to remain open going forward during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Implementing Filtering Facepiece Respirator (FFR) Reuse, Including Reuse after Decontamination, When There Are Known Shortages of N95 Respirators
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: N95 filtering facepiece respirators (FFRs) are meant to be disposed of after each use. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention developed these contingency and crisis strategies to help healthcare facilities conserve their supplies in the face of shortages.

title: Information for Health Care Facilities and Providers on “In-Use Time:” COVID-19
annotation: During the COVID-19 pandemic, health care facilities and providers have reported that care of ventilated patients can be complicated by the need to discard containers of medications before they are fully administered because of the in-use time specified on the FDA-approved label. This web page provides information to minimize the likelihood of physicochemical degradation or microbial proliferation during use in situations where a provider is considering use beyond the labeled in-use time for the products listed on this page.

title: COVID-19 and Telehealth Implementation: Stories from the Field
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Center for Preparedness and Response
annotation: In this one-hour, 30-minute Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) call, presenters discuss telehealth benefits and challenges during and after the COVID-19 pandemic. Presenters share their experiences implementing telehealth across diverse healthcare settings and address considerations for its future use.
authors: Tindall, Erica; Prescott, Rasheda; Alli, Kemi; Wallace, Febe
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2020/Slides_08_04_2020_v2.pdf

title: Estimating Mortality from COVID-19
annotation: Differences in mortality between groups of people and countries are important proxy indicators of relative risk of death that guide policy decisions regarding scarce medical resource allocation during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. This four-page document is intended to help countries estimate case fatality ratio (CFR), and, if possible, infection fatality ratio (IFR), as appropriately and accurately as possible, while accounting for possible biases in their estimation.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1289937/retrieve

title: Dental Settings: Interim Infection Prevention and Control Guidance for Dental Settings During the COVID-19 Response
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 4, 2020, includes additional guidance on physical distancing and how to respond to SARS-CoV-2 exposures among dental healthcare personnel and others. It includes recommendations for routine care, and recommendations for patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19.

title: Clinical Questions about COVID-19: Questions and Answers
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 4, 2020, provides answers to clinical questions about COVID-19, in these categories: COVID-19 Risk; Infection Control; Transmission; Testing, Diagnosis, and Notification; Testing in Nursing Homes; Treatment and Management; Patients with Persistent or Recurrent Positive Tests; Obstetrical Care;  Drugs and Investigational Therapies; Patients with Asthma; Patients with Liver Disease; Patients with Hypertension; and Waste Management.

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Frequently Asked Questions and Answers
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 4, 2020,  provides answers to frequently asked questions about Coronavirus Disease 2019 Basics; How COVID-19 Spreads; How to Protect Yourself; COVID-19 and Children; School Dismissals and Children; Preparing Your Home and Family for COVID-19; In Case of an Outbreak in Your Community; Symptoms and Testing; Higher Risk; Healthcare Professionals and Health Departments; COVID-19 and Funerals; What CDC is Doing; and COVID-19 and Animals.

title: Preparing for the COVID-19 Vaccine and Considerations for Mass Distribution
annotation: This nine-page memorandum provides COVID-19 information about Actions for Governors Preparing for Mass Distribution of a Vaccine; Overview of Planning Considerations for Mass Distribution; Distribution: From Industry to States; Distribution: From States to the Public; Prioritization of Critical Populations; Previous Planning Efforts and Lessons Learned;       Addressing Vaccine Hesitancy and Misinformation; and Legal Considerations.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.nga.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NGA-Memorandum-on-COVID-19-Vaccine-and-Mass-Distribution-Considerations.pdf

title: Considerations for the Provision of Essential Oral Health Services in the Context of COVID-19
annotation: The purpose of this five-page document is to address specific needs and considerations for essential oral health services in the context of COVID-19 in accordance with WHO operational guidance on maintaining essential health services.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1289841/retrieve

title: Environmental Health Assessment Form for Disaster Shelters During COVID-19
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: The CDC’s Interim Guidance for General Population Shelters During COVID-19 provides guidelines with in-depth steps on how to prevent transmission of COVID-19 in general population shelters. The CDC recommends reviewing those guidelines in addition to using this four-page assessment form.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Emergency Use of Impella Left Ventricular Support Systems During the COVID-19 Outbreak
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Impella Left Ventricular (LV) Support Systems. The Impella LV Support Systems are authorized for emergency use by healthcare providers (HCP) in the hospital setting for providing temporary LV unloading and support to treat critical care patients with confirmed COVID-19 infection who are undergoing extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) treatment and who develop pulmonary edema while on veno-arterial (V-A) ECMO support or late cardiac decompensation from myocarditis while on veno-venous (V-V) ECMO support.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140764/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140762/downloadLink to three sets of Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140765/download; https://www.fda.gov/media/140766/download; https://www.fda.gov/media/140767/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Poplar SARS-CoV-2 TMA Pooling Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Poplar SARS-CoV-2 TMA Pooling assay. The Poplar SARS-CoV-2 TMA Pooling assay is authorized for use with certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals who are suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140791/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140789/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140792/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Cleveland Clinic SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Cleveland Clinic SARS-CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140787/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140785/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140788/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Ethos Laboratories SARS-CoV-2 MALDI-TOF Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Ethos Laboratories SARS-CoV-2 MALDI-TOF Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Ethos Laboratories SARS-CoV-2 MALDI-TOF Assay is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140779/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140777/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140780/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140781/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Wren Laboratories COVID-19 PCR Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Wren Laboratories COVID-19 PCR Test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140775/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140773/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140776/download

title: Key Questions About Nursing Home Regulation and Oversight in the Wake of COVID-19
annotation: This brief answers key questions about nursing home oversight and explains how federal policy has changed in light of COVID-19. While the pandemic has led to new federal guidance, funding, and reporting requirements, state survey agencies and nursing homes each may face issues related to funding, capacity, and data as the pandemic continues.
authors: Musumeci, MaryBeth; Chidambaram, Priya

title: Contact Tracing for COVID-19: Domestic Policy Issues
annotation: As the COVID-19 pandemic progresses, Congress may consider whether and how to guide U.S. contact tracing efforts. This three-page document discusses COVID-19-specific aspects of contact tracing, and issues for Congress to consider.
authors: Sekar, Kavya; Harris, Laurie

title: Recommendations for Disaster Sheltering of Household Pets, Service Animals, and Support Animals during the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The information on this web page is provided to assist emergency planners who may need to consider local conditions, statutory authorities, resources, agreements, and other critical factors to form the final plan for disaster sheltering of household pets, service animals, and support animals during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: COVID-19: An ACP Physician's Guide and Resources
annotation: This guide and its collected national resources support physicians as they respond to the COVID-19 pandemic. They include guidance about coronaviruses in general, and COVID-19 specifically.

title: WHO COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Progress Report: 1 February to 30 June 2020
annotation: This 26-page report highlights the main points of progress that were made up to June 30, 2020, under the three objectives outlined in the COVID-19 Strategic Response and Preparedness Plan: scaling up international coordination and support; scaling up country preparedness and response by pillar; and accelerating research and innovation. The report also discusses some of the key challenges faced so far, and provides an update on the resource requirements for the next phase of WHO’s response as part of an unprecedented whole-of-UN approach to the pandemic.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/srp-covid-19-6month.pdf?sfvrsn=a7ac05b1_2&download=true

title: Preliminary Report on Case-based Analysis of Influenza A(H1N1) in EU (European Union) and EEA/EFTA (European Economic Area/European Free Trade Association) Countries
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This eight-page report contains statistics, graphs, and charts concerning cases of influenza A(H1N1) in EU and EEA/EFTA countries provided by the national contact points for surveillance and the Early Warning and Response System.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/media/en/publications/Publications/0906_SUR_Preliminary_report_on_case_based_analysis_of_influenza_AH1N1_in_EU_and_EEA_EFTA_countries.pdf

title: Screening Clients for COVID-19 at Homeless Shelters or Encampments
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 3, 2020, provides a simple screening tool that can be used to identify people with symptoms that indicate they might have a respiratory infection. Although not every person who has respiratory infection symptoms will have coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), using this tool during community spread of COVID-19 may help separate those who are more likely to have COVID-19 from the general population at entry to a homeless shelter or other homeless service program.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/screening-clients-respiratory-infection-symptoms.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/screening-clients-respiratory-infection-symptoms.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/screening-clients-respiratory-infection-symptoms.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/screening-clients-respiratory-infection-symptoms.html

title: Considerations on the Safe Use of UVC Radiation for Surface and Air Disinfection
annotation: This one-page fact sheet describes the safe use of UVC radiation for surface and air disinfection, and how studies have indicated that UV radiation also has the capability of killing SARS-CoV-2.
access_notes: Link to document in Spanish: https://aiha-assets.sfo2.digitaloceanspaces.com/AIHA/resources/Public-Resources/UVC-RadiationInfographic_Spanish.pdf

title: Preparation of Viral Transport Medium Standard Operating Procedure
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: Virus sample on a nasal swab might spoil if it is not kept in a special liquid that keeps it fresh and viable during transport on its way from the nose to a COVID-19 testing lab. The liquid is called viral transport medium (VTM), and in the pandemic, supplies of VTM have run low. These eight-page instructions for professionals to make VTM themselves, and many labs and hospitals have used the document to increase their supplies.

title: COVID-19 Community Response: Emerging Themes Across Sentinel Communities
annotation: The Sentinel Communities project described on this web page follows the experiences of nine diverse communities to understand how they are responding to and recovering from the COVID-19 crisis.

title: First Aid for Severe Trauma: Empowering High Schoolers to Respond to Traumatic Injuries
source: National Center for Disaster Medicine and Public Health [Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences]
annotation: In partnership with the American Red Cross, the National Center for Disaster Medicine and Public Health is creating a curriculum geared toward high school students focusing on applying pressure to stop bleeding, communication in emergencies, situational awareness, and body positioning. This 31-minute video discusses the program.
authors: Levy, Matt; Gausche-Hill, Marianne; Neal, Matthew

title: Training, Evaluation, and Monitoring Guidance for Health Departments
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: Case investigation, a core activity in COVID-19 control, is crucial to an effective COVID-19 public health control program. As a management tool for quality assurance for case investigation, this 24-page document will help supervisors and training leads to effectively develop and assess Case Investigators’ interviewing skills.

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Framework for the COVID-19 Response in the WHO African Region
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for Africa
annotation: This 27-page monitoring and evaluation framework targets ministries of health, WHO country offices, and the Regional Office, and aims to assess national, country, and regional response performance and progress, measured against country national plans, response efforts, and the broader WHO COVID-19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/334344/9789290234432-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=yLink to resource in French: https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/334343

title: Rapid Stocktake of Lessons Learnt and Good Practice in the Management of Local COVID-19 Outbreaks
annotation: This 27-page report sets out learning and best practice drawn from Dame Mary Ney’s rapid stocktake of lessons learned from the Leicester City/Leicestershire experience of responding to a local surge in COVID-19 cases. The Leicester City/Leicestershire Intervention was the first of its type and commenced when some of the architecture for managing such an event was underdeveloped and had never been exercised.
authors: Ney, Mary
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/924639/Local_COVID-19_outbreaks_lessons_learnt_and_good_practice.pdf

title: Tackling COVID-19 Pandemic through Integrating Digital Technology and Public Health
annotation: Through a combination of desktop research and key informant interviews used in this study, this 142-page report documents and analyses the impact and implications of the actions of the Chinese government and digital technology solutions during the COVID-19 pandemic. It offers an in-depth understanding of the actions and strategies implemented by the government, the roles digital technology played, the technologies used, and the impact made across six outbreak response categories.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.rockefellerfoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/v7_RF-Final-Report_AHI_2020903_reduced.pdf

title: Remote Work and the Heterogeneous Impact of COVID-19 on Employment and Health
annotation: This 35-page paper examines the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on employment and respiratory health for remote workers (i.e., those who can work from home) and non-remote workers in the United States.
authors: Angelucci, Manuela; Angrisani, Marco; Bennett, Daniel; Kapteyn, Arie; Schaner, Simone
access_notes: Direct link to document: http://ftp.iza.org/dp13620.pdf

title: Methodology: COVID-19 Pandemic: Attacks on Health Care in 2020
annotation: This six-page document provides the definitions for the data used in the report on COVID-19 pandemic: Attacks on health care in 2020, and information on the methodology used  to  generate  the data.

title: Childhood Traumatic Grief: Youth Information Sheet
annotation: This two-page fact sheet offers information for youth to help them understand the differences between grief and traumatic grief, the signs and symptoms of traumatic grief in children and youth, and what to do to feel better.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.nctsn.org/sites/default/files/resources/fact-sheet/childhood_traumatic_grief_youth_information_sheet.pdf

title: Childhood Traumatic Separation: Youth Information Sheet
annotation: This two-page fact sheet provides information for youth about separation distress, when separation can be traumatic for children and youth, traumatic reactions to separation, and what to do to feel better.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.nctsn.org/sites/default/files/resources/fact-sheet/childhood_traumatic_separation_youth_information_sheet.pdf

title: Supporting a Nation in Crisis: Solutions for Local Leaders to Improve Mental Health and Well-Being During and Post-COVID-19
annotation: This 34-page action guide, published with the de Beaumont Foundation, is intended for local policymakers and civic institutions (e.g., universities, hospitals, and other organizations that play a vital role in their local communities and economies; chambers of commerce; philanthropies; and multi-sector collaboratives). It provides recommendations that can be implemented to address mental health in both the immediate response and recovery phases of the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Bork, Rachel; Gendelman, Moriah
access_notes: Link to one-page summary: https://www.debeaumont.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Pager.pdf

title: COVID-19: Ambulatory PPE
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: This web page provides links to documents and guidance about ambulatory personal protective equipment (PPE) for COVID-19.

title: Fighting Compassion Fatigue During Public Health Epidemics
source: Association of State and Territorial Health Officials
annotation: Compassion and empathy have been relentlessly challenged by multiple epidemics in the United States. This two-page brief examines the opioid overdose epidemic as a case study in compassion fatigue during public health epidemics.

title: Exploring the Impact of COVID-19 on Social Services for Vulnerable Populations in Los Angeles
annotation: The authors of this 30-page report conducted semi-structured interviews with representatives from social services organizations in Los Angeles County to assess how these service providers are responding to COVID-19. The interviews also uncovered lessons learned and innovative strategies for dealing with the pandemic that could be more broadly disseminated. The authors recount these interviews and lessons learned, and provide recommendations for social services organizations.
authors: Holliday, Stephanie; Hunter, Sarah; Dopp, Alex; Chamberlin, Margaret; Iguchi, Martin
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/research_reports/RRA400/RRA431-1/RAND_RRA431-1.pdf

title: America at a Glance: Social Isolation and Loneliness During the First Wave of COVID-19
annotation: To learn more about how COVID-19 and related responses (i.e., stay-at-home orders) may contribute to feelings of social isolation and loneliness among people with disabilities, this study, summarized in this eight-page document, compared data from two cross-sectional samples collected before and after the first wave of “stay-at-home” orders. Post-COVID rural and urban samples reported significantly more interactions with family and close friends.
authors: Ipsen, Catherine; Myers, Andrew; Smith, Lauren
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://scholarworks.umt.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1050&context=ruralinst_health_wellness

title: COVID-19 Testing Database
annotation: This database is a tool for those who need to quickly obtain information about COVID-19 test kits and services for use in the United States. The database includes molecular tests that have received Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) from the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), whether they are kits that can be purchased by lab managers, or tests performed as a service by laboratories, whether sourced from manufacturers, or developed for their own use (so called “laboratory-developed tests”, or LDTs).
access_notes: Link to background information: https://www.bnext.org/article/b-next-covid-19-test-database/

title: LabTrainingVR: Biosafety Cabinet Edition
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This course enables learners to apply knowledge and practice setting up a biosafety cabinet (also known as a biological safety cabinet, or BSC) in a virtual laboratory. Participants can step into a virtual laboratory and learn how to work safely in the first Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) virtual reality (VR) laboratory training course.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.This training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/cdctrain/course/1091139/.

title: COVID-19
annotation: This is a mixed-method, interviewer-administered tool to (1) identify barriers that WIC (Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children) participants in California are experiencing in using WIC food benefits (e.g., access to WIC-eligible foods); and (2) identify additional short-term unmet basic needs (e.g., food and housing insecurity, as well as access to unemployment benefits, healthcare, childcare, and social support while required to remain at home) of low-income families during the COVID-19 pandemic.Questions Adapted From: U.S. Household Food Security Survey Module, USDA ERS: Q43COVID-19 Community Outcomes (COCO) Needs Assessment, Stanford University: Q1, Q4The Epidemic Pandemic Impacts Inventory (EPII): Q10aPatient Health Questionnaire-2 (PHQ-2): Q48Population: Adults OnlyLength: 55 questionsTime to Complete: 30-35 minutesMode of Administration: TelephoneAdministered by: Professional InterviewerLanguage(s): English; title: Views from the Big Cities: Webinar Series
annotation: This web page provides links to a series of webinars that share wisdom, experience, and lessons learned related to COVID-19 from communities that experienced the earliest and greatest impact of the pandemic.

title: Leadership Check-Up Series: Developing Your Resiliency as a Public Health Professional
source: Association of State and Territorial Health Officials
annotation: As the nation continues to struggle with COVID-19, public health professionals working on the front lines leading activities may be feeling angry, confused, stressed, and dismayed. Join national behavioral health and resilience experts for these 60-minute sessions of conversation, reflection, and nourishment to help professionals continue the vital work of responding to COVID-19 while better supporting their families, friends, co-workers, and communities.
access_notes: Link to recordings: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-GVXxC1njCD1tXpDB1KNdKjeXU3v0Sne

title: School Attendance, Asthma and COVID-19: Considerations for School Nurses
annotation: The purpose of this two-page document is to summarize current overall recommendations during the COVID-19 pandemic for students with asthma, which may be modified in the future as more is learned about COVID-19.

title: Long-Stay Mental Health Care Institutions and the COVID-19 Crisis
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for Europe
annotation: This 20-page report presents the results of a survey conducted by the Mental Health Programme, WHO Regional Office for Europe, with 169 long-stay institutions in the WHO European Region to assess the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on services, staff, service users, and residents with psychosocial and intellectual disabilities.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333964/WHO-EURO-2020-40745-54930-eng.pdf

title: Encouraging Participation and Cooperation in Contact Tracing: Lessons from Survey Research
annotation: This 11-page report is intended to help decision-makers in local public health departments and local governments increase participation and cooperation in contact tracing related to COVID-19. It focuses on contact tracing methods that involve phone, text, or email interviews with people who have tested positive and with others they may have exposed to the virus.
authors: Groves, Robert; Bassett, Mary; Hout, Michael

title: Exchange Newsletter: Volume 1, Issue 11: Special Edition: COVID-19 Healthcare Lessons Learned
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This 12-page issue of The Exchange from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides articles that highlight lessons learned (from the responder, practitioner, and planner perspectives) specific to COVID-19 patient surge; patient, caregiver, and provider behavioral health; operational considerations; and telehealth.

title: Coronavirus Victimization Distress Scale (CVDS)
annotation: The Coronavirus Victimization Distress Scale (CVDS) is a brief self-report questionnaire developed by Fordham University's Center for Ethics Education and Applied Developmental Psychology Program as part of the Pathways to Health Study. The CVDS assesses bully and cyberbully victimization distress results from being viewed as having coronavirus. Questions include distress about being verbally and physically bullied, treated rudely or unfairly, verbally taunted in public, and cyberbullied because of coronavirus.Population: Adults and TeensEthnic/Religious GroupsSexual or Gender MinoritiesLength: 5 itemsTime to Complete: Less than 5 minutesMode of Administration: Online (e.g., computer-assisted interview)Administered by: Self AdministeredLanguage(s): English
access_notes: Free/Publicly AvailableAvailable Formats: PDFContact Information:Celia B. Fisher, Ph.D.Center for Ethics EducationFordham UniversityEmail: Fisher@fordham.eduAdministrator: Lori MeroneEmail: lmerone@fordham.edu

title: Aid Worker Security Report 2020
annotation: This 22-page annual Aid Worker Security Report focuses on humanitarians working in the health sector. It examines the data from 2019 on attacks against health workers, and discusses how the humanitarian sector is dealing with the new risks and disruptions caused by major epidemics occurring in contexts of broader complex emergency.
authors: Stoddard, Abby; Harvey, Paul; Czwarno, Monica; Breckenridge, Meriah-Jo
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.humanitarianoutcomes.org/sites/default/files/publications/awsr2020_0.pdfLink to Figures at a Glance 2020: https://www.humanitarianoutcomes.org/publications/AWSDfigures2020

title: PPE CASE - Filtration Efficiency Performance of Non-NIOSH-Approved International Respiratory Protective Devices
source: National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health [Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]
annotation: This eight-page report summarizes the filtration performance results from the assessments that took place as a result of the initial Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) issued by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and discusses important considerations when purchasing non-NIOSH approved international respiratory devices temporarily authorized for occupational use in the United States.
authors: Andrews, A.; Powers, J.; Cichowicz, J.; Coffey, C.; Friese, M.L.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.cdc.gov/niosh/npptl/ppecase/pdfs/PPE-CASE-P2020-0112-508.pdf

title: Returnee Migrants-Focused Rapid Assessment on Impacts of COVID-19 and Preparedness and Response Plans of Local Governments, Nepal
annotation: This 75-page rapid assessment on COVID-19 in Nepal was conducted through phone interviews and covered 730 municipalities of all 77 districts. The census survey was carried out with the objective of obtaining baseline information on returnee migrants, along with the challenges they could face in the public health and socio-economic spheres following the pandemic.

title: Manufacturing,  Supply Chain, and Drug and Biological Product Inspections During COVID-19 Public Health Emergency Questions and Answers
annotation: This 12-page guidance provides answers to frequently asked questions about regulatory and policy issues related to inspections, pending drug applications, and changes in manufacturing facilities for approved pharmaceutical products during the COVID-19 epidemic.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/141312/download

title: Foundational Training for COVID-19 Responders
annotation: This training plan provides foundational COVID-19 information for individuals assisting in the COVID-19 response. The plan includes required, recommended, and supplemental training. After completing this training, responders will be better prepared to receive specialized training required by the jurisdictions for the role they are serving (e.g., contact tracers, case investigators, epidemiologists, data analysts).
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: Trauma-Informed, Recovery-Oriented System of Care Toolkit
source: Indiana Family and Social Services Administration
annotation: This 151-page toolkit provides information, resources, and tools to guide implementation of Trauma-Informed, Recovery-Oriented Systems of Care (TI-ROSC) to best serve individuals with opioid use disorder (OUD) and other substance use disorders.

title: COVID-19 Severity Classification Tool
annotation: ACEP and EvidenceCare created this seven-step triage process for emergency physicians to better classify COVID-19 patients and inform next steps.
