It classifies patients on a range from mild/low risk to critical, based on seven categories of measurement: assessing vital signs, a qCSI calculator, symptoms and risk factors, discharge home criteria, diagnostic testing and suggested labs, imaging and lab results, and the disposition.
access_notes: Link to summary document: https://www.acep.org/globalassets/sites/acep/media/covid-19-main/acep_evidencecare_covid19severitytool.pdf

title: COVID-19 Real-Time Learning Resource Center
annotation: This curated COVID-19 resource center is updated daily to reflect rapidly emerging literature and multimedia resources. It provides must-have information to clinicians and decision-makers, including COVID-19 clinician calls in the Latest Media section.

title: Heat and Health Tracker
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This tracker map provides local heat and health information so communities can better prepare for and respond to extreme heat events. The search function allows users to explore how extreme heat affects a specific county, populations that are at risk, and resources for response.

title: Basic Microbiology
annotation: In this course, participants will learn about how disease-causing microbes, called pathogens, are classified, identified and transmitted. Participants will be introduced to basic microbiological principles, fundamental laboratory diagnostics, and mechanisms by which microbes transmit and cause diseases.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: National Crisis Support Hotlines and Directories: For Healthcare Workers Experiencing COVID-19-Related Stress and Burnout
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: This one-page document lists hotlines and directories to support healthcare workers experiencing COVID-19-related stress and burnout.

title: Topic Collection: COVID-19 Health Equity
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This collection from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) provides a set of resources on the topic of Health Equity and Health Disparities associated with the COVID-19 emergency. The collection includes but is not limited to a wide spectrum of topics ranging from cultural competency in the wake of a global pandemic and general guidance to mitigate racial and ethnic inequities in our healthcare system.

title: Assessing Legal Responses to COVID-19
annotation: This 261-page collection of 36 expert assessments shows that the COVID-19 failure is, in important ways, also a legal failure. It offers more than 100 specific legal recommendations for the president and Congress, governors and state legislatures, and mayors and city councilors across the country. Sponsored by the de Beaumont Foundation and the American Public Health Association, the report was produced by Public Health Law Watch in cooperation with the Center for Public Health Law Research at Temple University Beasley School of Law, the Center for Health Policy and Law at Northeastern University, Wayne State University Law School, the Hall Center for Law and Health, the Network for Public Health Law, and ChangeLab Solutions.
authors: Burris, Scott; de Gaia, Sarah; Levin, Donna; Parmet, Wendy; Terry, Nicholas
access_notes: Link to Summary of findings and recommendations for action: https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5956e16e6b8f5b8c45f1c216/t/5f33fcd1b1efb82ac2a50331/1597242577976/COVID19PolicyPlaybook_Aug2020-Summary.pdf

title: UCSF Collaborative to Advise on Re-opening Education Safely (CARES) Webinar Series
annotation: This web page provides information and links for a series of webinar conversations hosted by UCSF Benioff Children's Hospitals on the re-opening of schools during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: EMS COVID Resource Reporting Tool
source: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, Office of Emergency Medical Services
annotation: This tool has been created to document, in one place, EMS agency personal protective equipment (PPE) needs and personnel shortages related to the COVID-19 crisis. Data collected will be used to communicate needs and critical information from the local agency to state and federal partners.

title: 2019 National Profile of Local Health Departments
source: National Association of County and City Health Officials
annotation: This 147-page study summarizes the collection of data about local health department infrastructure and practice at the national level. It discusses how crises like the COVID-19 pandemic emphasize the need for timely information and data to support public health practice, especially at the local level, and how the pandemic has impacted local health departments.

title: Framework for Equitable Allocation of Vaccine for the Novel Coronavirus
source: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine
annotation: This web page provides information and webinars from an ad hoc committee of the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine and the National Academy of Medicine, which will develop an overarching framework for vaccine allocation to assist policymakers in the domestic and global health communities in planning for equitable allocation of vaccines against severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
access_notes: Link to Disaster Lit record for Framework for Equitable Allocation of COVID-19 Vaccine document: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:24190

title: COVID-19 Rapid Needs Assessments
annotation: This web page provides country COVID-19 Rapid Needs Assessments that contain key findings, observations, and a detailed analysis of the many challenges older people face as a result of COVID-19.

title: Psychosocial Support for Older People in the Context of COVID-19
annotation: This 15-page document discusses how providing psychosocial support during the different phases of the COVID-19 crisis can help people cope better, including older people, their caregivers, and their families.

title: Harvard Dataverse: COVID-19 Research and Evaluations
annotation: This is a free data repository open to all researchers from any discipline, both inside and outside of the Harvard community, where they can share, archive, cite, access, and explore research data. Partnering with national health ministries and other government agencies in sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia, and Latin America, Population Council global and in-country scientists are conducting COVID-19 public health and social science research to produce relevant and timely evidence to support policymakers in controlling the spread of coronavirus, evaluating the effectiveness of prevention and mitigation measures, and assessing longer-term health, social, and economic effects of the pandemic.

title: Guidelines for Tsunami Warning Services, Evacuation, and Sheltering during COVID-19
source: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
annotation: This four-page document is aimed at national authorities responsible for the organization of tsunami warning and emergency response. It clarifies the status of the regional tsunami services for the Indian Ocean and suggests best practices for national and local actions during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) (COVID-19) Use and Conservation
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: The resources on this web page reflect the current supply shortage in which masks, goggles, and face shields may be conserved during the COVID-19 pandemic. Flyers, PAPR and CAPR flyers, guides, videos, and checklists are provided, with additional materials to be added in the future.

title: Vaccine Access and Hesitancy: Part One of a Workshop Series
annotation: This five-page publication summarizes the presentations and discussions from a workshop, the first in a series on the topic of vaccine access and vaccine hesitancy, held via Zoom on May 28, 2020. The remaining meetings are scheduled for August 17–20, 2020. The coronavirus pandemic made clear that people want scientific information, but many distrust it at the same time, making questions of vaccine hesitancy even more prominent.

title: Mass Attacks in Public Spaces – 2019
annotation: This 36-page report examines 34 targeted attacks that occurred in public or semi-public spaces (e.g., schools, places of business, houses of worship, open spaces) from January through December 2019. It is the agency’s third in a series of annual reports that have examined mass attacks in the United States, during which three or more individuals were harmed.
authors: Alathari, Lina; Drysdale, Diana; Blair, Ashley; Carlock, Arna; Cotkin, Aaron

title: Exploring the Frontiers of Innovation to Tackle Microbial Threats
annotation: This 158-page publication summarizes the presentations and discussions from a workshop held on December 4-5, 2019, that examined major advances in scientific, technological, and social innovations against microbial threats. Such innovations include diagnostics, vaccines (both development and production), and antimicrobials, as well as non-pharmaceutical interventions and changes in surveillance.
access_notes: This text is also available from the National Library of Medicine Bookshelf at https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK560433/.

title: NIEHS Worker Training Program COVID-19 Webinars and Presentations
source: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences [National Institutes of Health]
annotation: In response to COVID-19, the National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS) Worker Training Program (WTP) has been conducting these webinars and presentations on technical topics related to COVID-19, with a focus on protecting workers who may be at risk of exposure to COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to related flyer: https://tools.niehs.nih.gov/wetp/public/hasl_get_blob.cfm?ID=12185

title: Contact Tracing Resources for COVID-19 Response
source: National Association of County and City Health Officials
annotation: This web page highlights the most useful resources from governmental public health, academia, think tanks, and nonprofits to support local health departments in designing, establishing, scaling up, and strengthening COVID-19 contact tracing programs.

title: Frequently Asked Questions: COVID-19 Testing at Skilled Nursing Facilities/ Nursing Homes
annotation: This eight-page document provides answers to 27 frequently asked questions about COVID-19 testing at skilled nursing facilities and nursing homes.

title: COVID-19 Event Risk Assessment Planning Tool
annotation: This web page provides interactive context in a map to assess the risk that one or more individuals infected with COVID-19 are present in an event of various sizes. The model is simple and provides some context for the rationale to halt large gatherings in early-mid March and newly relevant context for considering when and how to re-open.
authors: Chande, A.T.; Gussler, W.; Harris, M.; Lee, S.; Rishishwar, L.

title: Anthrax Vaccine
annotation: This is a presentation on the Anthrax Vaccine Immunization Program that contains information on current policy, the threat, the disease and the vaccine, dosage schedule and route of administration, exemptions, adverse reactions, storage and handling of the vaccine, and documentation. This briefing can be viewed as a guest or for credit by health care providers.
access_notes: This link is no longer available. 10/12/2016.

title: 2020 Emergency Response Guidebook
source: U.S. Department of Transportation, Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration
annotation: This 396-page guidebook provides first responders with a go-to manual to help deal with hazmat transportation accidents during the critical first 30 minutes. It provides a flow chart for how to use the guidebook in an incident, and detailed chapters to help quickly identify emergency response procedures.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/sites/phmsa.dot.gov/files/2020-08/ERG2020-WEB.pdfLink to mobile apps: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/hazmat/erg/erg2020-mobileappLink to document in French: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/sites/phmsa.dot.gov/files/2020-07/GMU2020-WEB.pdfLink to document in Spanish: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/sites/phmsa.dot.gov/files/2020-07/GRE2020-WEB.pdfLink to data files in English, French, and Spanish: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/hazmat/erg/erg-data-filesLink to tutorial video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WCpr4XmhrssLink to 2020 Windows software: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/hazmat/erg/erg2020-windows-softwareLink to Changes from 2016 Guide: https://www.phmsa.dot.gov/sites/phmsa.dot.gov/files/docs/Summary_changes_ERG2016.pdf

title: Natural Disasters 2019
source: Centre for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters, a WHO Collaborating Centre
annotation: This eight-page report provides information about the 396 natural disasters that occurred in 2019 and were recorded in the Emergency Events Database (EM-DAT), with 11,755 deaths, 95 million people affected, and $103 billion in economic losses across the world.
authors: Below, Regina; Wathelet, Valentin; Froment, Remi

title: Rural Healthcare Surge Readiness
annotation: The Federal Healthcare Resilience Working Group has developed this web portal, a collection of essential rural healthcare resources, tools, and trainings that healthcare workers and organizations – including EMS and 9-1-1, inpatient and hospital care, ambulatory care, and long-term care – can utilize to prepare for and respond to COVID-19. This one-stop shop for rural healthcare lets users quickly find the information they need to prepare for or respond to surge events, navigate financial challenges related to the pandemic, and enhance their capacity and capability to provide lifesaving care to Americans who live in rural areas across the country.

title: Statement on the Fourth Meeting of the International Health Regulations (2005) Emergency Committee Regarding the Outbreak of Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)
annotation: This report summarizes the fourth meeting of the Emergency Committee convened by the WHO Director-General under the International Health Regulations (IHR) (2005) regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19), which took place on July 31, 2020. Recommendations for state parties include sharing best practices, including from intra-action reviews, with WHO; and applying lessons learned from countries that are successfully re-opening their societies (including businesses, schools, and other services) and mitigating resurgence of COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to statement in Arabic: https://www.who.int/ar/news/item/11-12-1441-statement-on-the-fourth-meeting-of-the-international-health-regulations-(2005)-emergency-committee-regarding-the-outbreak-of-coronavirus-disease-(covid-19)Link to statement in Chinese: https://www.who.int/zh/news/item/01-08-2020-statement-on-the-fourth-meeting-of-the-international-health-regulations-(2005)-emergency-committee-regarding-the-outbreak-of-coronavirus-disease-(covid-19)Link to statement in French: https://www.who.int/fr/news/item/01-08-2020-statement-on-the-fourth-meeting-of-the-international-health-regulations-(2005)-emergency-committee-regarding-the-outbreak-of-coronavirus-disease-(covid-19)Link to statement in Russian: https://www.who.int/ru/news/item/01-08-2020-statement-on-the-fourth-meeting-of-the-international-health-regulations-(2005)-emergency-committee-regarding-the-outbreak-of-coronavirus-disease-(covid-19)Link to statement in Spanish: https://www.who.int/es/news/item/01-08-2020-statement-on-the-fourth-meeting-of-the-international-health-regulations-(2005)-emergency-committee-regarding-the-outbreak-of-coronavirus-disease-(covid-19)

title: Interim Guidance for Use of Pooling Procedures in SARS-CoV-2 Diagnostic, Screening, and Surveillance Testing
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 1, 2020, provides guidance on Definitions of Diagnostic, Screening, and Surveillance Testing for SARS-CoV-2;  Diagnostic or Screening Testing Using a Pooling Strategy; Surveillance Testing Using a Pooling Strategy; and Summary Tables.

title: Guidance on HIPAA and Contacting Former COVID-19 Patients about Blood and Plasma Donation
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: This two-page document, updated in August 2020, details how a covered health care provider may use protected health information to identify patients who have recovered from COVID-19 to provide them with information about how they can donate their blood and plasma containing antibodies to the virus that causes COVID-19, to help treat other patients with COVID-19.

title: Interim Guidelines for COVID-19 Antibody Testing
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on August 1, 2020, provides guidelines for COVID-19 antibody testing, under these topics: Background, Development of Antibodies and Immunity, Current Status of Antibody Testing in the United States, Types of Antibody Testing, Optimizing Testing Outcomes, Limitations, and Recommendations for Use.

title: Revised Recommendations for Reducing the Risk of Human Immunodeficiency Virus Transmission by Blood and Blood Products
annotation: This 21-page revised guidance document, updated in August 2020, provides blood establishments that collect blood or blood components, including Source Plasma, with the Food and Drug Administration’s revised donor deferral recommendations for individuals with increased risk for transmitting human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection. There is a significant shortage in the supply of blood in the United States, which early implementation of the recommendations in this guidance may help to address (even though the recommendations in this guidance are broadly applicable beyond the COVID-19 public health emergency).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.fda.gov/media/92490/download

title: Interim Guidance on Unsheltered Homelessness and Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) for Homeless Service Providers and Local Officials
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This guidance, updated on August 1, 2020, is intended to provide key actions that local and state health departments, homelessness service systems, housing authorities, emergency planners, healthcare facilities, and homeless outreach services can take to protect people experiencing homelessness from the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus).
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/unsheltered-homelessness.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/unsheltered-homelessness.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/unsheltered-homelessness.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/homeless-shelters/unsheltered-homelessness.html

title: Strategies for COVID-19 Response for Populations Receiving Long-Term Care
annotation: This 12-page document provides key considerations for governors and state leaders as they develop strategies during the COVID-19 pandemic to protect the health and well-being of individuals receiving long-term care. It includes a high-level review of considerations for governors; a detailed briefing of considerations and related state examples; and an appendix with quick links to additional resources, including relevant federal guidance.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.nga.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Strategies-for-COVID-19-Response-for-Populations-Receiving-Long-Term-Care.pdf

title: REaL Data Collection, Stratification and Utilization in Response to COVID-19
annotation: Speakers in this 50-minute webinar share strategies on leveraging race, ethnicity and language (REaL) data collection, stratification, and utilization during the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Mieres, Jennifer; Wright, Michael

title: Letter of Authorization: UCSD RC SARS-CoV-2 Assay; University of California San Diego Health
annotation: This eight-page letter details the Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for the UCSD RC SARS-CoV-2 Assay for qualitative detection of nucleic acid from SARS-CoV-2 in clinician-instructed self-collected nasal swab specimens (collected on site), and clinician-collected upper respiratory specimens (nasopharyngeal, mid-turbinate, anterior nares or oropharyngeal swab specimens) collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider. This test is also for the qualitative detection of nucleic acid from the SARS-CoV-2 in pooled samples.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140715/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140712/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: SARS-CoV-2 Test Kit (Real-time PCR)
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the SARS-CoV-2 Test Kit (Real-time PCR). The SARS-CoV-2 Test Kit (Real-time PCR) is authorized for use with respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140719/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140718/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140717/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: ADVIA Centaur® SARS-CoV-2 IgG (COV2G)
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the ADVIA Centaur® SARS-CoV-2 IgG (COV2G) assay. The ADVIA Centaur® SARS-CoV-2 IgG (COV2G) assay is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma (potassium EDTA and lithium heparin).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140705/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140703/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140704/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Atellica® IM SARS-CoV-2 IgG (COV2G)
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Atellica® IM SARS-CoV-2 IgG (COV2G) assay. The Atellica® IM SARS-CoV-2 IgG (COV2G) assay is authorized for the detection of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in human serum and plasma (potassium EDTA and lithium heparin).
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Recipients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140701/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140700/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140699/download

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Toolkit for People Experiencing Homelessness
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides COVID-19 guidance and tools to help homeless service providers make decisions and protect and communicate with staff and with people who are experiencing homelessness.

title: Urgent Need for a National Plan to Contain the Coronavirus
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Oversight and Reform
annotation: This three-hour, 30-minute Congressional hearing of the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis examines the urgent need for a national comprehensive plan to address the coronavirus pandemic with three key officials leading the response. The hearing discusses how to identify and correct past failures, and what steps need to be taken from now on.
authors: Clyburn, James; Fauci, Anthony S.; Redfield, Robert; Giroir, Brett

title: Draft Landscape of COVID-19 Candidate Vaccines
annotation: This nine-page document provides details about 26 COVID-19 candidate vaccines in clinical evaluation. Inclusion of any particular product or entity in any of these landscape documents does not constitute, and shall not be deemed or construed as, any approval or endorsement by WHO of such product or entity (or any of its businesses or activities).
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/novel-coronavirus-landscape-covid-19cc0e97e4ea1b4458a05bbd6f5ac6d3fe.pdf?sfvrsn=5c754439_3&download=true

title: COVID-19 One-Stop Shop Toolkits
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on July 31, 2020, provides COVID-19 videos, social media, PSAs, print resources, checklists, FAQs, and web resources, with tabs for communicating with 18 different audiences.

title: Coronavirus (COVID-19): Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Hub
annotation: This guidance, updated on July 31, 2020, contains information on personal protective equipment (PPE), and infection prevention and control (IPC).

title: COVID-19 Contact Tracing
annotation: This course consists of six learning modules that cover an overview of COVID-19, the role of public health in pandemics, how ethics and effective communication play a part in contact tracing, and steps to investigate cases and trace contacts. Each module concludes with a brief knowledge check, and the course concludes with a culminating assessment.
access_notes: Site requires free registration.This training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092698.

title: Considerations for School Nurses When Providing Virtual Care
annotation: This four-page document describes tools and resources for school nurses to consider when delivering direct care to students via live audio-visual technology. Direct care is defined as a service provided by a licensed school nurse, such as attending to identified health needs, providing treatments and medications, as well as care provided under the supervision of a school nurse.

title: Return to School Post COVID-19 Closure Considerations for Students with Disabilities and Special Healthcare Needs
annotation: The purpose of this eight-page document is to guide school nurses when planning for return to school for students with disabilities and special healthcare needs (D/SHN) as defined by Section 504 or Individual Education Program (IEP) teams.

title: UK Biobank COVID-19 Antibody Study: Round 1 Results
annotation: This web page reports on an antibody study, undertaken by UK Biobank, to help understand the extent of previous infection with SARS-CoV-2 in different populations across the UK and whether they persist over time.

title: Ending the Triple Pandemic: Advancing Racial Equity by Promoting Health, Economic Opportunity and Criminal Justice Reform
annotation: This one-hour, 27-minute Congressional briefing features presenters from Trust for America’s Health, American Public Health Association, NAACP, the National Black Nurses Association, the National Collaborative for Health Equity, and the National Medical Association, who discuss the disproportionate health and economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Black community and other communities of color, and how structural racism drives systemic inequities in health, the economy, and criminal justice.
authors: Kelly, Robin; Jones, Camara; Johnson, Derrick; Logan, Trevon

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: CRL Rapid Response; Clinical Reference Laboratory, Inc.
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the CRL Rapid Response test, which includes the DNA Genotek OMNIgene ORAL OM-505 collection device, that has been authorized for emergency use with saliva specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140665/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140664/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140661/downloadLink to Instructions for Use (Home Collect): https://www.fda.gov/media/140663/download

title: Critical Care Workforce and COVID-19: A State-by-State Analysis
annotation: There is concern that the availability of medical personnel capable of providing intensive care could be a limiting factor in the care of COVID-19 patients. This Data Note reports baseline estimates of the number of active critical care physicians and nurses in each state relative to state population.
authors: Lopez, Eric

title: Health and the Economy: A Convergence Needed to Address COVID-19 and Retake the Path of Sustainable Development in Latin America and the Caribbean
source: World Health Organization, Pan American Health Organization
annotation: This 24-page joint report by the Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC) and the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) is issued at a time when several Latin American countries have become the epicenter of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. The main conclusion of this report is that if the pandemic transmission curve is not brought under control, the countries’ economies will be unable to recover.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://iris.paho.org/bitstream/handle/10665.2/52535/PAHOHSSCOVID-19200027_eng.pdf?sequence=5&isAllowed=yLink to resource in Spanish: https://iris.paho.org/handle/10665.2/52536

title: Public Health Considerations While Resuming International Travel
annotation: The objective of this guidance is to provide governments, health authorities of WHO Member States, and relevant stakeholders with elements to consider in adjusting international travel measures to the changing epidemiological situation of the COVID-19 pandemic, national public health and health service capacity available in countries, and evolving understanding of the virus.

title: COVID-19: Data Quality and Considerations for Modeling and Analysis
annotation: This 49-page technology assessment examines collection methods and limitations of COVID-19 surveillance data reported by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC); approaches for analyzing COVID-19 data; and uses and limitations of forecast modeling for understanding COVID-19.
authors: Persons, Timothy; Moessbauer, SaraAnn; Denigan-Macauley, Mary
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/708527.pdf

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Treatment Guidelines
annotation: A panel of U.S. physicians, statisticians, and other experts has developed these treatment guidelines for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), updated on July 30, 2020. The 205-page guidelines consider two broad categories of therapies currently in use by healthcare providers for COVID-19: antivirals, which may target the coronavirus directly, and host modifiers and immune-based therapies, which may influence the immune response to the virus or target the virus. The guidelines provide background information about each agent—such as clinical data about its use, ongoing clinical trials, and known interactions with other drugs—that forms the basis for the recommendation.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://files.covid19treatmentguidelines.nih.gov/guidelines/covid19treatmentguidelines.pdf

title: Responding to the Impact of COVID-19 on Refugees
source: Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health
annotation: In this one-hour webinar, disease modeling and humanitarian health experts at Johns Hopkins University discuss what impact COVID-19 will have in terms of infections and outcomes in refugee camps, and the response needed to protect children with routine immunizations and a potential COVID-19 vaccine.
authors: Truelove, Shaun; Spiegel, Paul
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://www.jhsph.edu/ivac/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Slides_Responding-to-the-Impact-of-COVID-19-on-Refugees.pdf

title: Guidance on Federal Health Privacy Laws for Behavioral Health Practitioners and Peer Support Specialists for Virtual Service Delivery during COVID-19
source: Mountain Plains Addiction Technology Transfer Center Network
annotation: This one-hour, 14-minute webinar features speakers who provide information regarding the COVID-19 pandemic and HIPAA, 42 CFR Part 2, and the CARES Act as it relates to virtual services. Participants will be introduced to the tip sheets and technical assistance services provided by the  Center of Excellence for Protected Health Information.
authors: Khaikin, Christine; Waterman, Caroline; Seitz, Jacqueline; Graziano, Michael

title: What Do We Know About Children and Coronavirus Transmission?
annotation: This review of the latest available data indicates that, while children who are infected with COVID-19 are more likely to be asymptomatic and less likely to experience severe disease (though a small subset become quite sick), they are capable of transmitting to both children and adults.
authors: Michaud, Josh; Kates, Jennifer

title: ASPR TRACIE (Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response/Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) Technical Assistance Request: COVID-19 and Skilled Nursing Facility Lessons Learned
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: This two-page document from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) responds to a request for resources that highlight lessons learned from skilled nursing facilities (SNFs) during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Experiences of Community Health Centers in Expanding Telemedicine
annotation: Safety-net medical providers can substantially increase their telemedicine services with modest investments in new staff and technology, a move that can help them expand patients' access to specialized medical care, according to this 60-page study. The findings in the report are relevant to health centers that are trying to rapidly expand telemedicine in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Uscher-Pines, Lori ; Sousa, Jessica; Palimaru, Alina; Zocchi, Mark; Kapinos, Kandice
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/research_reports/RRA100/RRA100-1/RAND_RRA100-1.pdf

title: Q&A: Ventilation and Air Conditioning in Public Spaces and Buildings and COVID-19
annotation: This web page provides answers to questions about ventilation in the context of COVID-19, including what steps can be undertaken to improve the ventilation in indoor public spaces and buildings.

title: Survey Tool and Guidance: Rapid, Simple, Flexible Behavioural Insights on COVID-19
source: World Health Organization, Regional Office for Europe
annotation: This 42-page document provides guidance to Member States in the WHO European Region that wish to conduct behavioral insights studies related to COVID-19. This tool is evidence-informed; can be regularly applied; is flexible to adjust to the changing situation; and follows high ethical standards.
access_notes: Free/Publicly AvailableContact information: Katrine Habersaat (habersaatk@who.int) or Martha Scherzer (scherzerm@who.int)Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333549/WHO-EURO-2020-696-40431-54222-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=yLink to resource in Russian: https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/333550

title: COVID-19 Response: Promising Practices in Health Equity (II)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: In this one-hour webinar, presenters from local jurisdictions and national organizations discuss actions taken to mitigate the disproportionate impact on racial and ethnic minorities during the COVID-19 pandemic. They discuss strategies to reduce COVID-19 health inequities for racial and ethnic minorities at the local, state, and national level.
authors: Maybank, Aletha; Saunders, David; Bloyd, James
access_notes: Link to Disaster Lit record for Part I: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:23225

title: NETEC COVID-19 Webinar Series: Infection Control Precautions in Dentistry During the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: This 58-minute webinar discusses infection control precautions in dentistry during the COVID-19 pandemic. Objectives include defining standard and transmission-based precautions, applying the proper sequence for donning and doffing personal protective equipment (PPE), and describing the characteristics of surgical masks, filtering facepiece respirators, and face shields.
authors: Grindle, Amanda; Cuny, Eve; Morgan, Jill
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/4880856dddff504317e0db9f6d5fdc88.pdf

title: Resetting Our Response: Changes Needed in the U.S. Approach to COVID-19
source: Center for Health Security [Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health]
annotation: This 15-page report describes 10 concrete policy actions at the federal, state, and local levels that are needed to get control of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States. Recommendations identify “quarterbacks,” or responsible designees, to lead each policy action.
authors: Rivers, Caitlin; Martin, Elena; Watson, Crystal; Schoch-Spana, Monica; Cicero, Anita
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.centerforhealthsecurity.org/our-work/pubs_archive/pubs-pdfs/2020/200729-resetting-our-response.pdf

title: UVGI Decontamination Cycle for N95 Respirators
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: In the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, healthcare has experienced significant shortages of personal protective equipment (PPE), including N95 respirators. In an effort to extend the use and reduce risks with reuse of untreated respirators, NETEC has developed this four-step decontamination procedure with the use of Ultraviolet Germicidal Irradiation (UVGI).

title: Water, Sanitation, Hygiene, and Waste Management for SARS-CoV-2, the Virus that Causes COVID-19
annotation: This 11-page interim guidance supplements COVID-19 infection prevention and control (IPC) documents by summarizing WHO guidance on water, sanitation, hygiene (WASH), and waste management relevant to viruses, including coronaviruses. This document is an update to the interim guidance document entitled Water, Sanitation, Hygiene, and Waste Management for the COVID-19 Virus, published on April 23, 2020.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1292822/retrieveLink to Disaster Lit record for Water, Sanitation, Hygiene, and Waste Management for the COVID-19 Virus: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:21955

title: Public Health Preparedness: HHS Has Taken Some Steps to Implement New Authority to Speed Medical Countermeasure Innovation
annotation: The COVID-19 pandemic and other infectious disease outbreaks have raised concern about the nation's ability to prevent, respond to, or mitigate potential public health emergencies. Congress allowed the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to partner with a private, nonprofit entity to work on this problem. This 11-page report describes the status of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA)'s implementation of the innovation partner authority.
authors: Denigan-Macauley, Mary
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/708466.pdf

title: COVID-19 Contracting: Observations on Federal Contracting in Response to the Pandemic
annotation: This 46-page report describes, among other objectives, key characteristics of federal contracting obligations awarded in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Federal agencies awarded $17.8 billion in contracts as of mid-June 2020 for critical goods and services supporting responses to the COVID-19 pandemic. Contracts often play a key role in federal emergency response.
authors: Mak, Marie
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/708455.pdf

title: Preparedness Tools for Healthcare Professionals and Facilities Responding to Coronavirus (COVID-19)
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page, updated on July 29, 2020, provides resources for hospitals and healthcare professionals preparing for patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 in these topics: Healthcare Provider Checklist; Steps Healthcare Facilities Can Take; Healthcare Facility Guidance; Framework for Non-COVID-19 Care; COVID-19 Surge Tool; Hospital Preparedness Tool; Get Your Clinic Ready; Mitigating Staff Shortages; and Print Resources.

title: Rapid Onboarding for Redeployed Clinicians: What Matters to Them?
annotation: The COVID-19 pandemic has led to redeployment of thousands of U.S. clinicians to treat patients using new or updated skills and practicing in unfamiliar locations of the hospital. This research brief provides three key recommendations for onboarding for redeployment under conditions of limited time and resources.
authors: Haas, Susan; Smith, Rachel

title: COVID-19: Paediatric Surveillance
annotation: This web page provides information about how Public Health England, along with National Health Service partners and academic collaborators, has implemented a number of ongoing surveillance programs to monitor the course, progression, and outcomes of COVID-19 in children.

title: eCR Now: COVID-19 Electronic Case Reporting: Health Departments
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides information for Public Health Agencies and Healthcare Providers about COVID-19 Electronic Case Reporting (eCR), the automated generation and transmission of case reports from the electronic health record (EHR) to public health agencies for review and action.

title: Population in Peril
annotation: This 16-page report explores the relationship between insufficient housing, basic sanitation and healthcare, and the high prevalence of violence and disease among asylum seekers and migrants on the northern Mexico Border. It demonstrates how harsh U.S policies that force thousands of asylum seekers and migrants to wait indefinitely on the border, and an inadequate response to meet their basic needs by the Government of Mexico, created the crisis and are fueling it.
authors: Diamond, Megan; Testa, Luke; Novak, Carissa; Kempton-Amaral, Kathryn; Olayo-Mendez, Alejandro

title: Evidence Used to Update the List of Underlying Medical Conditions that Increase a Person’s Risk of Severe Illness from COVID-19
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: Updates to this list of underlying medical conditions that put individuals at increased risk for severe illness from COVID-19 were based on published reports, articles in press, unreviewed pre-prints, and internal data available between December 1, 2019 and July 10, 2020.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/evidence-table.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/evidence-table.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/evidence-table.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/evidence-table.html

title: NIHB Webinar: Strengthening Tribal COVID-19 Laboratory Testing Capacity
annotation: This one-hour, 32-minute webinar provides an overview on using the Public Health Accreditation Board (PHAB) Standards and Measures as a framework for strengthening Tribal Public Health Agencies' ability to work with laboratories on COVID-19 testing. Panelists from Pascua Yaqui Health Services, Osage Nation Health Services, and Tribal Diagnostics, an Oklahoma-based, Native-owned laboratory, discuss how they used the PHAB framework, and other performance improvement tools in their own COVID-19 responses.
authors: Stone, David; Clark, Jaime; Sawney, Laura; Krause, Apryl; Littlepage, Cory

title: How to communicate response strategies to influenza A(H1N1)
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: This document discusses influenza H1N1 background, evidence, experience and practical considerations in making policy decisions on containment and mitigation.
access_notes: This link is no longer available. 2/22/2018.

title: Multisectoral Checklist for School Reopening and School Based Nutrition in the Context of COVID-19
annotation: This 12-page document, co-published with UNICEF, provides a non-exhaustive list of recommended multi-sectoral actions for government, UNICEF, World Food Programme, and other partners to consider as part of their short and longer-term planning for and implementation of school reopening. Part one of this checklist is focused on key nutrition actions, with part two focusing on child protection, WASH, education, and health actions.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://docs.wfp.org/api/documents/WFP-0000118125/download/?_ga=2.66997998.1728482108.1596130625-1605233867.1596130625

title: Rapid Expert Consultation on Staffing Considerations for Crisis Standards of Care for the COVID-19 Pandemic (July 28, 2020)
annotation: This 16-page rapid expert consultation builds on prior National Academies reports on the Crisis Standards of Care (CSC) and the rapid expert consultation on March 28, 2020, and focuses on staffing needs for the care of COVID-19 patients, including adjusting staff responsibilities, providing “hazard pay” to staff, ensuring adequate time off, offering child care and other benefits, and leveraging health care coalitions to ensure appropriate transfer of patients between hospitals.
authors: Hanfling, Dan; Hick, John L.
access_notes: Link to Disaster Lit record for  Rapid Expert Consultation on Crisis Standards of Care for the COVID-19 Pandemic (March 28, 2020): https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:21465

title: Medicare Beneficiary Use of Telehealth Visits: Early Data From the Start of the COVID-19 Pandemic
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
annotation: This 24-page issue brief from the Assistant Secretary for Planning and Evaluation examines changes in Medicare fee-for-service primary care visits and use of telehealth at the start of the COVID-19 public health emergency (PHE). It seeks to address the issue of how and whether the Medicare telehealth flexibilities introduced to address the COVID-19 pandemic may have helped maintain access to primary health care during the PHE.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://aspe.hhs.gov/system/files/pdf/263866/HP_IssueBrief_MedicareTelehealth_final7.29.20.pdf

title: Use of Telemedicine in Alternate Care Sites
source: Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]
annotation: Speakers on this webinar from TRACIE (Technical Resources, Assistance Center, and Information Exchange) discussed operations, management, and lessons learned of using telemedicine in alternate care sites, which can serve various patient types (e.g., COVID-19 or non-COVID-19) and purposes (e.g., non-acute, hybrid, or acute care).
authors: Treber, Meghan; Jolly, Til; Biddinger, Paul; Connelly, Mary; Sommer, Darren
access_notes: Site requires free registration.Link to recording: https://register.gotowebinar.com/recording/3569767218279856910Link to webinar Q&A: https://files.asprtracie.hhs.gov/documents/aspr-tracie-ta-telemedicine-in-alternate-care-sites-qa---final.pdfThis training can be found in the Public Health Foundation TRAIN Learning Network at: https://www.train.org/main/course/1092677.

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and Diabetes: The Importance of Prevention, Management, and Support
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Center for Preparedness and Response
annotation: During this one-hour Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) Call, presenters focus on current information about the impact and increased risk for COVID-19 complications in people with diabetes; the importance of diabetes prevention, management, and support; and the many resources and programs available to help patients continue to manage their diabetes and prevent type 2 diabetes during the pandemic.
authors: Philip, Celeste; Albright, Ann; Saydah, Sharon
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2020/COCA-Call-Slides_07-28-20.pdf

title: Science and Tech Spotlight: Contact Tracing Apps
annotation: This two-page document explains how contact tracing can help reduce transmission rates for infectious diseases like COVID-19 by identifying and notifying people who may have been exposed. Contact tracing apps, notably those using proximity tracing, could expedite such efforts. However, there are challenges, including accuracy, adoption rates, and privacy concerns about these apps.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.gao.gov/assets/710/708405.pdf

title: School-Based Health Care in the Era of COVID-19
annotation: Speakers in this one-hour webinar discuss what school-based health care provides, issues for school-based health care and COVID-19, and the role of school health during COVID-19 closing and re-entry.
authors: Johnson, Sara; Connor, Katherine; Dooley, Danielle; Lever, Nancy

title: Communication Considerations for Vulnerable Populations
annotation: This document is a resource guide for public health and medical professionals who seek to provide vulnerable populations with critical information before, during and after a disaster or incident. It provides information on how to shape messages, identify preferred modes of delivery and choose mediums for each audience.
access_notes: This link is no longer available. 4/12/2018.

title: COVID-19: EU Guidance for Cruise Ship Operations
source: European Union, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
annotation: The objective of this 36-page guidance is to facilitate the re-start of operations of cruise ships in the European Union (EU), by recommending minimum measures expected to be implemented by all those concerned, while maintaining general safety and security standards. This COVID-19 guidance is meant for EU/EEA (European Economic Area) flagged ships engaged in international voyages and for ships calling at an EU/EEA port irrespective of flag.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/COVID-19-cruise-guidance-27-07-2020.pdfLink to related infographic: COVID-19 and Cruise Ship Operations: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/publications-data/infographic-covid-19-and-cruise-ship-operations

title: Considerations for Implementing Mass Treatment, Active Case-Finding and Population-Based Surveys for Neglected Tropical Diseases in the Context of the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This eight-page document outlines a decision-making framework for implementation of mass treatment interventions, active case-finding campaigns, and population-based surveys for neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. It formulates considerations aimed at providing guidance to relevant health authorities, NTD program managers, and their supporting partners.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/333499/WHO-2019-nCoV-neglected_tropical_diseases-2020.1-eng.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y

title: COVID-19 Experiences and Challenges in Fragile Contexts: Building Resilience to Future Shocks
source: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
annotation: This one-hour, 49-minute webinar provides a platform to share information on COVID-19 preparedness, response, and recovery efforts, with a focus on lessons learned, good practices, challenges, and experiences in fragile contexts. Experiences of countries from different contexts are highlighted, and attention is given to lessons learned from previous crises such as the Ebola outbreak, among others.
authors: Abbashar, Amjad; Mizutori, Mami; Jackson, Ronald; Peters, Katie; Williams, Henry
access_notes: Link to recording: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0TGmqXayQDs&list=PLBDwPnveHho9iFI5fyO2vYYPChiIAJ-X4

title: Operational Considerations for Maintaining Essential Services for and Providing Maternal, Newborn, and Child Healthcare in Low-Resource Countries
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: While current data suggest that pregnant women, newborns, and children are not at highest risk for COVID-19 deaths, disruption of routine essential services poses a threat to their survival and health. This web page provides guidance for essential maternal, newborn, and child health (MNCH) services to provide during COVID-19.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Lilly SARS-CoV-2 Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Lilly SARS-CoV-2 Assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140542/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140540/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140543/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: SNL-NM 2019 nCoV Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Assay
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the SNL-NM 2019 nCoV Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic assay that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by the FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140546/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140544/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140547/download

title: Considerations for Implementing Mass Treatment, Active Case-Finding and Population-Based Surveys for Neglected Tropical Diseases in the Context of the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This eight-page document provides a decision-making framework for implementation of mass treatment interventions, active case-finding campaigns, and population-based surveys for neglected tropical diseases in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. A two-step approach is proposed: a risk-benefit assessment, to decide if the planned activity should proceed; and an examination of a list of precautionary measures that should be applied with the aim of decreasing the risk of transmission of COVID-19 associated with the activity, and strengthening the capacity of the health system to manage any residual risk.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1289077/retrieve

title: COVID-19 Fact Sheets and Guidance
source: Federal Emergency Management Agency [Department of Homeland Security]
annotation: This web page, updated on July 27, 2020, provides COVID-19 fact sheets and guidance documents from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). It is continually updated.
access_notes: Some fact sheets and guidance documents are in Spanish and Haitian Creole.

title: Interim Operational Considerations for Implementing the Shielding Approach to Prevent COVID-19 Infections in Humanitarian Settings
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page presents considerations from the perspective of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for implementing the shielding approach in humanitarian settings as outlined in COVID-19 guidance documents focused on camps, displaced populations, and low-resource settings. It highlights potential implementation challenges of the shielding approach from CDC’s perspective.

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Operational Considerations for Schools
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This guidance is intended for use by any person, institution, or organization preparing for or responding to community transmission of COVID-19, and for those assisting these entities (e.g., national and local governments, CDC country offices, and others); it contains special considerations for mitigating the risks of resumption and sustained operation of schools in low-resource, international settings.

title: Safe Eid al Adha Practices in the Context of COVID-19: Interim Guidance
annotation: Eid al Adha is a festival during which Muslim families and friends unite to pray together and give alms, especially in the form of sacrificed animal meat. In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, this four-page document highlights public health advice for social gatherings and religious practices that can be applied across different national contexts.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1288874/retrieve

title: Guidance for Post-Secondary Institutions During the COVID-19 Pandemic
annotation: This web page provides guidance for post-secondary institutions, administrators, and local public health authorities (PHAs) in jurisdictions where these institutions exist in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. These settings include public and private colleges, universities, and vocational/technical schools.

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): Health Equity Considerations and Racial and Ethnic Minority Groups
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page discusses how long-standing systemic health and social inequities have put many people from racial and ethnic minority groups at increased risk of getting sick and dying from COVID-19. Topics include factors that contribute to increased risk, what we can do, and data on COVID-19 and race and ethnicity.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/race-ethnicity.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/race-ethnicity.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/race-ethnicity.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/health-equity/race-ethnicity.html

title: NETEC COVID-19 Webinar Series: Surgical Cases and Considerations for COVID-19 Patients: Part Two
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: This 49-minute webinar describes strategies used for testing COVID-19 patients requiring surgical procedures, and reviews the approach at the University of Nebraska Medical Center and Emory University on virus transmission and personal protective equipment use for infection control. It also defines the setup and pre-briefing process for surgeries during COVID-19, and reviews physical infrastructure setup in alignment with engineering controls in an intraoperative, and post-anesthesia care unit setting.
authors: Cieslak, Ted; Schulte, Thomas; Sullivan, James; Collins, Jeremy; Klopman, Matthew
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://repository.netecweb.org/files/original/7e37460b6be226430ddf1de8c245610b.pdfLink to Disaster Lit record for webinar Part One: https://disasterinfo.nlm.nih.gov/search/id:23078

title: Government-University Dialogue on COVID-19 Surveillance and Testing: Opportunities, Challenges, and Capacity
annotation: This one-hour, 31-minute panel discussion of federal health and university representatives focuses on COVID-19 diagnostics and universities, how diagnostic testing can be speeded up, and what speakers can learn from each other.
authors: Collins, Francis; Giroir, Brett; Verma, Seema; Byington, Carrie; Feser, Edward

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Michigan State University System for Decontaminating Compatible N95 Respirators
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of decontaminated, compatible N95 respirators. These compatible N95 respirators have been decontaminated using the Michigan State University Animal Care Program’s (MSU) System for Decontamination and Reuse of Compatible N95 Respirators with Vaporized Hydrogen Peroxide.
access_notes: Link to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140472/downloadLink to Instructions for Michigan State University Staff: https://www.fda.gov/media/140471/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Facilities and Operator Teams: https://www.fda.gov/media/140469/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Personnel: https://www.fda.gov/media/140470/download

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Emergency Use of the Airway Dome
annotation: This four-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Airway Dome. This device is    authorized for use by healthcare providers (HCP) as an extra layer of barrier protection in addition to personal protective equipment (PPE) to prevent HCP exposure to pathogenic biological airborne particulates by providing isolation of hospitalized patients with suspected or confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19, at the time of definitive airway management, or when performing airway-related medical procedures, or during certain transport of such patients during the COVID-19 pandemic.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140456/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140455/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Facilities: https://www.fda.gov/media/140453/downloadLink to Instructions for Healthcare Providers: https://www.fda.gov/media/140454/download

title: What Public Health Inspectors Need to Know about COVID-19
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides information about COVID-19 for public health inspectors, including how to protect themselves, and how to work with employers on protection.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employees.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employees.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employees.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employees.html

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) Fast Nucleic Acid Detection Kit (PCR-Fluorescence Probing)
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of the Novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) Fast Nucleic Acid Detection Kit (PCR-Fluorescence Probing). The Novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) Fast Nucleic Acid Detection Kit (PCR-Fluorescence Probing) is authorized for use with oropharyngeal swab specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140427/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140426/downloadLink to Instructions for Use: https://www.fda.gov/media/140425/download

title: Preventing and Managing COVID-19 Across Long-Term Care Services
annotation: This 54-page policy brief provides 11 policy objectives and key action points to prevent and manage COVID-19 across long-term care. It builds on currently available evidence on the measures taken to prevent, prepare for, and respond to the COVID‑19 pandemic across long-term care services, including care providers.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/who-2019-ncov-policy-brief-long-term-care-2020-1-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=c6763d51_1&download=trueLink to Web Annex: https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/WHO-2019-nCoV-Policy_Brief-Long-term_Care-web-annex-2020.1

title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) FAQs for School Administrators on Reopening Schools
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page for school administrators provides answers to frequently asked questions about reopening schools, and planning and responding to COVID-19.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese; https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/reopening-schools-faqs.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/reopening-schools-faqs.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/reopening-schools-faqs.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/reopening-schools-faqs.html

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: LabCorp’s COVID-19 RT-PCR Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet, updated on July 24, 2020, informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of LabCorp’s COVID-19 RT-PCR test. The Food and Drug Administration reissued the LabCorp COVID-19 RT-PCR Test emergency use authorization (EUA) to include two new indications for use: testing for people who do not have COVID-19 symptoms or who have no reason to suspect COVID-19 infection, and to allow pooled sample testing.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/136150/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/136148/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/136151/download

title: Interventions Commonly Available During Pandemics for Heavy Menstrual Bleeding: An Overview of Cochrane Reviews
annotation: This report summarizes the evidence from Cochrane Reviews evaluating interventions for heavy menstrual bleeding that are commonly available during pandemics. Within the context of heavy menstrual bleeding, pandemics impact women's assessment and treatment by healthcare providers.
authors: Rodriguez, Magdalena; Lethaby, Anne; Farquar, Cindy; Duffy, James
access_notes: Link to report in Arabic: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013651.pub2/full/fa#CD013651-abs-0003Link to report in French: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013651.pub2/full/fr#CD013651-abs-0005Link to report in Spanish: https://www.cochranelibrary.com/cdsr/doi/10.1002/14651858.CD013651.pub2/full/es#CD013651-abs-0007

title: COVID-19 Surge Planning: Considerations for the Home-based Care Population
source: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
annotation: This four-page document provides guidelines and resources to prepare organizations for an increase in patient volume in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. Surge planning for COVID-19 patients requires administrators to evaluate capacity and capability in space, skills, and supplies, and then develop and apply structures to move current capacity to maximum capability.

title: COVID-19 Confirmed Cases by Occupation and Industry
annotation: This eight-page report was a collaboration between Department of Health and Labor and Industries, Safety and Health Assessment and Research for Prevention Program, and contains data on occupation and industry among lab-confirmed cases of COVID-19 among Washington residents reported through June 16, 2020.

title: Underfunded and Unprepared: Examining How to Overcome Obstacles to Safely Reopen Public Schools
source: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Education and Labor
annotation: This three-hour, seven-minute Congressional hearing features witnesses who discuss what Congress must do to help America’s students get back to school during the COVID-19 pandemic.
authors: Sablan, Gregorio; Hinojosa, Michael; Boggs, Leslie; Schwinn, Leslie; O'Leary, Sean

title: COVID-19 Employer Information for Public Health Inspectors
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides information for public health inspectors, including how public health inspectors and their workforce might come into contact withe the COVID-19 virus, and how they can protect their staff and others, and slow the spread of the virus.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employers.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employers.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employers.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/ph-inspectors-employers.html

title: Guidance for Planning Vaccination Clinics Held at Satellite, Temporary, or Off-Site Locations
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The purpose of this guidance is to assist with jurisdictional planning and implementation of satellite, temporary, or off-site vaccination clinics by public and private vaccination organizations. It also provides information on additional considerations that are required during the COVID-19 pandemic, including physical distancing, personal protective equipment (PPE), and enhanced sanitation efforts.

title: Fact Sheet for Healthcare Providers: Helix COVID-19 Test
annotation: This three-page fact sheet informs healthcare providers of the significant known and potential risks and benefits of the emergency use of a Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test called the Helix COVID-19 Test that has been issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) by FDA. The Molecular LDT COVID-19 Authorized Test is authorized for use on certain respiratory specimens collected from individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.
access_notes: Link to Fact Sheet for Patients: https://www.fda.gov/media/140423/downloadLink to Letter of Authorization: https://www.fda.gov/media/140422/downloadLink to EUA Summary: https://www.fda.gov/media/140420/download

title: COVID-19 Research Synergies Meetings
source: Global Research Collaboration for Infectious Disease Preparedness
annotation: The COVID-19 Research Synergies Meetings took place on July 16-23, 2020, to bring together key stakeholders in the research response to combat COVID-19, and provide a platform to promote and establish collaboration and synergies between researchers funded by GloPID-R members. This web page provides the agenda, programs, and recordings of the four meetings.

title: Updated Interim Recommendations-HIV-Infected Adults and Adolescents
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This Web page contains guidance for clinicians concerning HIV infected individuals and the H1N1 virus, including clinical presentation, treatment, and chemoprophylaxis. The English language content on this page is being archived for historic and reference purposes only.

title: COVID-19 Inter-Agency Guidance for the Management of the Dead in Humanitarian Settings
source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs, Inter-Agency Standing Committee
annotation: This 11-page inter-agency guidance was jointly drafted by the International Committee of the Red Cross, International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and World Health Organization colleagues (in addition to consultation with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and Pan American Health Organization), and is targeted toward humanitarian settings. It aims to complement other guidance on the management of the dead with a stronger focus on the practical realities faced when dealing with the dead in humanitarian settings.
authors: Baller, April; Connix, Rudi; Eamer, Gwendolen; Toledo, Joao; Finegan, Oran
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://interagencystandingcommittee.org/system/files/2020-07/Interagency%20COVID-19%20Guidance%20for%20the%20Management%20of%20the%20Dead%20in%20Humanitarian%20Settings%20%28July%202020%29.pdf

title: Guidance for K-12 School Administrators on the Use of Cloth Face Coverings in Schools
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: The CDC suggests that all school reopening plans address adherence to behaviors that prevent the spread of COVID-19. When used consistently and correctly, cloth face coverings are important to help slow the spread of COVID-19. This web page provides general considerations for face coverings in schools.
access_notes: Link to page in Chinese: https://chinese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/cloth-face-cover.htmlLink to page in Korean: https://korean.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/cloth-face-cover.htmlLink to page in Spanish: https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/cloth-face-cover.htmlLink to page in Vietnamese: https://vietnamese.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/cloth-face-cover.html

title: Guidance for Conducting a Country COVID-19 Intra-Action Review (IAR)
annotation: This 16-page document was developed to guide countries to conduct periodic review(s) of their national and subnational COVID-19 response, so countries do not miss critical opportunities for learning and improvement to better respond to the COVID-19 outbreak in their countries, especially as the possibility of a protracted pandemic becomes increasingly probable.
access_notes: Direct link to document: https://apps.who.int/iris/rest/bitstreams/1288630/retrieveThis page provides links to these tools:Country COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR) Concept Note TemplateCountry COVID-19 intra-action review: Facilitator’s manualCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Generic agenda template Country COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Generic presentationCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Trigger question databaseCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Note taking templateCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Final report templateCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Participant feedback formCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Participant feedback summaryCountry COVID-19 intra-action review (IAR): Success story template

title: COVID-19 Webinar and Partner Calls Videos
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Office of Infectious Diseases
annotation: This web page provides COVID-19 webinar and partner calls videos from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. They can be filtered by audience, including first responders, healthcare facilities, healthcare professionals, and public health professionals.

title: NACo Town Hall: County Public Health Departments on the Front Lines
annotation: This one-hour webinar features a discussion on the role of local public health in combating the COVID-19 pandemic and other public health emergencies. It provides an inside look at how county public health departments are addressing the current crisis, an overview of contact tracing tools for interested public health officials, and an update on federal legislative efforts to aid local public health departments in tracing and tracking the pandemic.
authors: Moehrle, Carol; Bryant, Blaire; Huston, Amanda
access_notes: Site requires free registration.

title: Protection of Children During COVID-19 Webinars
source: Alliance for Child Protection in Humanitarian Action
annotation: This web page provides links to a webinar series about protection of children during the COVID-19 pandemic. Some webinars are available in Arabic, French, Portuguese, and Spanish.
access_notes: Recordings can also be found at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTqpcYbBSkF_qHlkT7PoKcDvHtyGVHKan

title: CDC COVID-19 Response Health Equity Strategy: Accelerating Progress Towards Reducing COVID-19 Disparities and Achieving Health Equity
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: This five-page document details the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's strategy to reduce the disproportionate burden of COVID-19 among populations at increased risk for infection, severe illness, and death; broadly address health disparities and inequities related to COVID-19 with a holistic, all-of-response approach; and develop a strategic plan to help us realize these goals.

title: COVID-19 Law Lab
annotation: This database gathers and shares legal documents from over 190 countries across the world to help states establish and implement strong legal frameworks to manage the COVID-19 pandemic. The goal is to ensure that laws protect the health and well-being of individuals and communities, and that they adhere to international human rights standards. It is a joint project of United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), World Health Organization (WHO), Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS) and O’Neill Institute for National and Global Health Law at Georgetown University.

title: Supporting Children and Adolescents During COVID-19
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
annotation: The National Child Traumatic Stress Network (NCTSN) joined the CDC Emergency Partners Information Connection (EPIC) Team to present this 56-minute webinar featuring Dr. Melissa Brymer, Director of the Terrorism and Disaster Program UCLA/Duke University National Center for Child Traumatic Stress, who discussed possible ways to support young people during COVID-19. She also described NCTSN’s available resources and outlined how to have conversations with children and adolescents about what is happening.
authors: Brymer, Melissa
access_notes: Link to presentation slides: https://emergency.cdc.gov/epic/pdf/2020_07_22_Supporting-Children-and-Adolescents-During-COVID-19_clean_final_508.pdfLink to transcript: https://emergency.cdc.gov/epic/pdf/07222020-transcript.txt

title: NETEC COVID-19 Webinar Series: Identifying Hazards and Mitigating Risks for Long Term Care Facilities
source: National Emerging Special Pathogens Training and Education Center
annotation: In this 54-minute webinar, participants discuss different policies and processes taken at long-term care facilities caring for COVID-19-positive residents based on case-based experiences, describe mitigation strategies involved to promptly identify and isolate residents with possible COVID-19 utilizing appropriate infection prevention practices, and describe the role of local and state public health in the identification, prevention, and control of COVID-19 in long-term facilities.
authors: Schwedhelm, Shelly; Boulter, Kate; Tennill, Trish; Morgan, Jill
